[13]So, yeah, head to the elevator and it'll take you down to residences, real cozy stuff. [18]Clipboard says you'll be looking for a doctor Can or, or Cahn. [21.7]Sounds familiar. [24.1]I guess he's in charge of the rest of your orientation. [26.9]Alright, onward to science. [30.4]Well, for one of us, anyway.
Dialogue.2992348F4DD2AD8B80DE60A786956967_58FA765: Hey, one'a Frake's folk came through. [3.4]Got some new stuff for ya ... if you got what I need.
Dialogue.58EC4F1A42280069EE4D35B8863DE3F1_52045D4: Hey, take a look around, it's a free facility ... kinda, but you got better places to be, right?
Dialogue.02D189604AE9F501DB79BC8626BD1D2B_6AA6D76: Hide somewhere. But not here, alright? [3.5]Close the door!
Dialogue.26B24D7B46FD33BDF25D7DB6D75DAD3F_6B614EA: History will judge us, or else erase us.
Dialogue.77E7E7B44C64128A114368BB9697E2BF_F2E10BE: Hmm, yes that will do nicely.
Dialogue.6E2E1DC64F24BD6A0975229A6027AD8F_F2E10BE: Hmm. My circadian cycle is failing.
Dialogue.378602DE400B474334483B8AF7949346_84DFBE1: Hmmm. Manse mentioned something about that ... material on the vacuum chamber, [7.4]I'm sure of it, in one of his precious logs. [12.0]But I'll be damned if I can remember what he said.
Dialogue.5373D6EC4563B98281DF3F9008C4EC77_09CA50D: Honestly, I prefer these guys to the water bats. You could NOT hear yourself think.
Dialogue.FB0291404645B299A00464A0D5D5988F_98535A7: Honestly, looking around at all of this,[3.45]I'm asking myself whether it's been worth it.
Dialogue.5026C6204BA8AEC242317F96F292530E_EF8738C: How on Earth are we ever going to find a way out of here.
Dialogue.A421E9154A818FC6879E83BC8729718D_5D63EF4: How you got through in one piece, I can't imagine.[3.33]I came through a portal from Labs and it spat me out here -[7.51]I should have known better, but what was I supposed to do,[9.95]just wait for them to find me?!
Dialogue.79CB8C244FC35612EDE0FEACBD66F522_4AE005C: How'd you get past the snipers?
Dialogue.21E393594B0EED08ADA9E2813F218215_4AE005C: How's that power system looking?[2.36]You reset it yet?
Dialogue.8572850346FF1B846778839764962EEB_D280DA7: I 'spose the old facility's kinda munted now, eh?
Dialogue.9C35945244158454349F9E82520B7F0E_09B430A: I advised, Abe.  What are you trying to say?
Dialogue.AB8E44734EB57B780BC168A91DE1ABE6_EF8738C: I am distinctly under the weather.
Dialogue.D9D195BA44E338B0C1ABE7AC2A098C10_9D66FB2: I am going to miss you - and I'm not just saying that. [2.4]We've had some wild times. And I could seriously use a hand. Seriously. [9.03]But you've got places to be, I see that.
Dialogue.610419DD43CDD9D2ECA8CFBE6BD21CD7_98DBDC4: I am going to stay here, for now.
Dialogue.105949A042EEBBFA3308E68D59F13F0A_F2E10BE: I am just about boiling up.
Dialogue.5612E7DC4253971A0189B2960089169C_500EBB0: I ask you to help me betray my brethren in order to serve them. [3.55]I will be condemned, I aver. [5.475]But I accept this fate, for the ends are too great to consider any other course.
Dialogue.557A7260453898F285B28D8601057DCF_AF4702B: I been listening to their transmissions. [2]Military? Government? Mercs? Who the hell are they? [6.2]Can't understand half of what they're sayin'.
Dialogue.46712048471D993408595E8136B2F7B3_58FA765: I been working here eleven years, ain't seen nothing like this.
Dialogue.67F704E84AAD775F1C81809F8770328B_F2E10BE: I believe I need to uh, defecate.
Dialogue.E98C1A06451A994E8944AC95A4710172_98DBDC4: I came through the portal, thank you friend.[3.88]You freed us from the facility.[7.03]To be on this island together is ... nice.
Dialogue.802CC4D64FFFEE01532178AF232474AB_F2E10BE: I can barely keep my eyes open.
Dialogue.339EC3D542161345B4CE9F866BCA68A9_F2E10BE: I can feel my blood sugar falling.
Dialogue.7E71BB794F5219A31B11D697F4EEEECA_98DBDC4: I can feel my new ... shell ... and these limbs ... It is strange ... [8.4]the sense of being able ... to move ... is different.
Dialogue.46A644634FAE19336737309CFBB08548_EF8738C: I can feel my proteins de-naturing.
Dialogue.B605F1AC4F97C10AF63E018EB6453FE4_28A5EA9: I can get us through the Vacuum Chamber, I'm sure of it. [3.5]But you need to find a way to the Control Center and reset the security system.
Dialogue.8DE5786B4E57B55B5250258B56D7CF0D_28A5EA9: I can get us to the Surface Elevator, if we can just get the Vacuum Chamber open. [5.8]I'm certain of it. [7.5]But someone needs to retrieve that goo from the Mycofields in Anteverse 2. [12.8]Now, I'm not necessarily saying that's 'you', but you do seem rather well suited to this kind of thing.
Dialogue.750548F4424C96871D02459D5C977D6C_28A5EA9: I can open a rift for us, but you have to shut their interference down ... now!
Dialogue.D484E333491B1070E2C768A0CC8D0605_09B430A: I can smell so many things, Abe, it's like someone had a three-day party in my sinuses [6]and the maid was locked out and now it's a week later,  [8.2]there's broken glass and vomit everywhere and the carpet's rotting and ...  [13.5]well, you get the idea.  [15.50]Yeah, it stinks here.
Dialogue.D431BE00469D10E7F3EF578810BE8B19_28A5EA9: I can't believe this - I'm ... I'm speechless. [3.23]The Gatekeepers! ... They're trying to bring this thing into our world - [7.28]to harness its power for ... well ... only the gods know what! [11.9]These mana-hungry maniacs! [15.2]Surely you can see this has gone too far - they're a threat to the entire world! [21.15]As scientists, we must do something. [24.18]If we destroy the various fetters, the creature will surely return to whatever limbo it came from. [30.87]And if that resets the rift, we may even be able to use it to get out of here - if you can unshackle this ... thing.
Dialogue.D6896946493747F93465B2B73E8E44B0_5D63EF4: I can't believe we're actually going to do this!
Dialogue.4AFE20414124867B90A932B08E554FD6_F2E10BE: I can't contain this much longer.
Dialogue.7D07EEC9482C894291C3D88C1B088F5B_EF8738C: I can't go on ... without water
Dialogue.FA9CEC7A4FEB81D2AD03A5890B0F25BC_09B430A: I can't just conjure portals out of thin air, Abe.[3.1]It's not magic.
Dialogue.F7E5AA534FF485D5B4A43DBE047A6A18_B19337C: I can't just give this to you for free, you know. Wish I could.
Dialogue.D3A0B9E24AFA6B58703565AD05C3DBE8_28A5EA9: I can't tell if it's a force field ... or some kind of ... hex? [4.53]But it certainly seems that the Gatekeepers have covered this whole area in a sort of shield. [10.89]Whether it's to make sure nothing gets in, or stop something escaping ... [15.58]I have no idea. I suppose we'll know soon enough.
Dialogue.9A65B07B43CD1AB4C6E8B98E762DBE04_28A5EA9: I can't tell you what I've had to DO to bring this all about.[3.6]I don't want to sound ungrateful, but I mean that quite literally - the concepts alone would cause you irreversible brain damage.
Dialogue.5ED69BEC478075CB1E7601B28B4BDB2E_EF8738C: I can't think about that right now.
Dialogue.183ACDC945F2CBA78644CBA646F8241B_D73DE1F: I can't work under these conditions.
Dialogue.861BB4E14170D93102CBFC81F284A79C_F2E10BE: I can't... go on... too... cold.
Dialogue.315C072C4930F6E68DF4CBA2269627E3_F2E10BE: I could certainly use a drink.
Dialogue.2749AB884D2187FEEB77B7ABD20AA5BC_EF8738C: I could do with more, but ... (hmmm)
Dialogue.6E91591E47633EFC6479B6AEA088419D_7D797E7: I couldn't live with myself if I had to abandon my data. [4.6]I mean, what would the point of any of this be?
Dialogue.BA0BD58F47BCE94AA064BD8245C769FC_B493B93: I couldn't tell you just how the Gatekeepers managed to get the Lens back. [3.95]And I don't want to think what they'll do with it now ...
Dialogue.1EFA9C2740CAE97BCC64DB89E3089AEC_28A5EA9: I do love a good plan.
Dialogue.8DEB2D244C789500EC16E894B1BD4DC7_EF8738C: I don't feel good at all.
Dialogue.F138647643A18A982083718451AF73B8_52045D4: I don't know about those guys ... I'm just trying to build ...
Dialogue.7C845C514B843A09BB9041ABC6245757_587DB37: I don't know how you made it this far, those savages have blocked every exit - [3.5]they even collapsed the surface tunnel! [5.7]But remember what happened in '85, when the kinetics team overloaded the synchrotron!? [10.0]They triggered a singularity that carved a hole clean through to the next Sector!  [15.2]We could do it again right now ... if these damn quakes hadn't broken the electron pumps. [19.9]So I sent my team to the Blacksmith [22.12]he can make parts to fix the pumps - [24.3]we'll make our own exit! [26.3] All my people need to do is follow the pipes, red, yellow, green - [29.4]they'll find their way to the pumps they need to fix. [31.8]It's been hours since they left, but they'll be back, I'm sure of it.
Dialogue.AEEA4F104BBB4DD8B426188687D58339_84DFBE1: I don't know if I could have faced the apocalypse without a coffee.
Dialogue.2FBDA73F4BC207159384DEA37FA014A8_98DBDC4: I don't know if Stewart's coming back.[3.6]Please.[5.31]Finish the neural bridge?[8.2]It's what he would have done, I'm sure of it.
Dialogue.C29D857C4A79D918A22448B0B52B5BDC_09195BA: I don't know what happened. [2]They’re saying evacuate, but have you seen what's prowling around out there? [6.7]Clearly some escapees from the Wildlife Pens.[9.9] Things must be really bad if we can't even keep basic containment protocols in check
Dialogue.25ED483240932013297AB3AF2CFA977C_5D63EF4: I don't know what you're going to find there, but it has to be better than this ... doesn't it?
Dialogue.5274FDF34BFDB8F2935546A13654BE59_0508B95: I don't know what you're planning, but if you've got half a brain you'll get as far away from here as you can.[6]The portal system's gone totally haywire. [9.2]I've seen data like this before, when a portal opened in the neutrino detector. [14.5]I swear it's happened again. [16.7]It could lead anywhere, but anywhere's better than this right now. [21.8]Only problem is, it's entirely underwater. [26]I'd come with you if I could, but there's just no way. [30.5]How are you at holding your breath?
Dialogue.281B109943E8736B5AAF6CA6835BADEC_58FA765: I don't know whatcha planning, but it better be something smart.
Dialogue.F8AB8A654F750671854B39BDD030FE68_1E3C2DE: I don't know where the sickness came from! It infected the Lamogi, then the Royal Crowns! [6.0]I'm the only one left! It's just ... me.
Dialogue.62A4FDCB40B405FF4A8C07930317419E_B19337C: I don't know who they were ...
Dialogue.32892728412755605B4BA7B9B4DA3DC8_28A5EA9: I don't like this place ... at all.
Dialogue.A98C76344D3F08C9CD8BC58502AD96EA_EF8738C: I don't think I can hold on much longer.
Dialogue.6ECD3738489A6B286AAD38A69976AD28_98535A7: I don't want to get anyone's hopes up, so let's just say - [5.0]there's certain ... substances in the Containment Block that could be very helpful right now.
Dialogue.1270DFBA4D945CC33550138234C24743_28A5EA9: I don't want to seem demanding! You're doing extremely well! But anything you could do to hurry things along would be marvellous!
Dialogue.1D7201F64D2F70D85A725393826791FD_B10FECB: I don't want to sound cold, but as horrific as it looks, this is barely a drop in the cosmic bucket, believe me.
Dialogue.0A13DD914C08AE3ADD7A8BA70DD8136F_7D797E7: I don’t understand it! The system’s locked us out. [4]But I’m not leaving without my data. I could lose everything! [9.2]I'd never get a Nobel Prize! Then I had an idea. [13.4]I worked on the security bots. [15.5]Their CPUs store access codes. [18.6]If we salvaged some, we could make something to hack the door. [22.3]What do you think?
Dialogue.F579F7144A9C8E240ED494BA96FF7344_18C7EC2: I got a gun ... just sayin'.
Dialogue.2767D3FD4BD8DFD3D05F9896491D7F7A_58FA765: I got a lot of fabrication gear back here. [3.1]You need somethin', I can make it, if you got somethin' to trade - [7.3]gettin' a little low on some necessities back here.
Dialogue.91981D4C490E65F5DE38749A2964DF3B_AF4702B: I got drinks up here, snacks, and ALL the TIME in the WORLD!
Dialogue.B98C3C1F4AF4EAA776BEED8A00D7B41A_52045D4: I gotta get across ... [1.63]Just needa keep building ...  [3.91]Frake's counting on me, we're all ... counting on each other ...  [9.45]Start the reactors, get the hell out of here. [13.05]Made it this far, just gotta keep our heads down. [17.33]It'll be okay.
Dialogue.95EFB8294A2D86232426228C5F92D2AF_28A5EA9: I had no idea they'd gone this far. It looks like it's ... in pain.
Dialogue.0DD3A8BC4B922F57230A2F92D7380211_28A5EA9: I hate to think what will happen if we fail.
Dialogue.6D1B110445B843B425075A8328845605_F5807AE: I have had to secure IS Five-Two personally, following the latest abuse of containment procedures by staff in C-Blocks. [8.35]I understand fully well the attraction of jumping three times higher than normal, or floating gently down from the third story of the megalift, [17.15]but the gravity cube is NOT a toy. [20.48]While I admit to a light skip as I carried it to its containment cell, it is a profound and unique disturbance in the space time fabric of our universe. [30.86]It's also quite glowy.
Dialogue.6773898F43CFA5BD52B684A453FC6379_F5807AE: I have immense respect for Dr. Wakeman's achievements, [3.6]but I'm concerned at the limits - or lack thereof - on his robotics research. [9.67]As far as I can discern, Wakeman has been given carte blanche to pursue a machine consciousness program. [15.6]He is a poor communicator at the best of times, but if I understand his recent ... mutterings, [22.7]he has incoporated elements of IS-Oh-One-Four-Two into his new "Waterbot". [28.8]How he did this, and whether its conversational ability is a charming trick, or something more ... enduring, [36.76]well, I'm not convinced even Dr. Wakeman knows.
Dialogue.DAE7FBB04916C2BFD553ACAFA4586FCA_C8E28C6: I have never tasted you before?
Dialogue.6DF0EFCD43421177CA9993A8FE821ABA_EF8738C: I have no idea what you're talking about.
Dialogue.E9B960574B64A21AA1ADD0A797FBEB92_AD7A481: I have seen you before, and sung all of this again. [6.86]No origin, no end, but a loop in which we spin ...  [13.74]The wheel rolls on, the compass turns, the words we speak like echoes ... [23.04]So ... you will go, because you shall come back ... [29.92]You are here, so you are there, and all seems new, and none is true.
Dialogue.6DA5F67949C326894B0461A7920C4C92_587DB37: I have to admit, you surprised me. [2.85]I had to come and see this for myself. [5]You gonna do the honors?
Dialogue.A22CB6E84EB7B53EB357669382802772_09B430A: I haven't been there for a while, but it can't be as bad as what happened in Reactors. [4.9]That took months to clean up.
Dialogue.FBD3E6A94848556ECCFE82B1ADDCC6E5_98535A7: I hear those gun-toting apes stole the dark lens, and caused this whole kerfuffle. [7.3]Didn't you work on that project, Janet?
Dialogue.D84C6A3646A99E055D7E9DB0595F9824_587DB37: I heard the portal down here leads to some kinda sanctuary ... [3.5]but Gatekeepers can't tell the difference between a hex and a tri-wing screw, [6.75]so I'd take that with a grain of salt.
Dialogue.DA36615146F73CE2A9CB988DF7F7F5AC_6AA6D76: I heard their radios, something about Level 3. [3]I’d stay away if I were you.
Dialogue.0CC0E95C4C885E0C08BED9A5CFFCAE7D_AF4702B: I heard those crazy assholes blew the tunnel up. [3.0]Real smart thinking! [4.8]Sounds like Frake's got an even crazier plan. [8.0]Don't tell me you're gonna help her? [10.3]Haha - I knew today was gonna be a wild one!
Dialogue.824E596E46758E1658CF138DFC2D18E9_27E759D: I hope you have a wonderful morning/day/evening.
Dialogue.05627E1447D8EE2A3A27D9BE2A599088_5952414: I knew this would happen. [2.25]Ever since Verenkov's team took over Silo 3. [5]You couldn’t get a single power cell after that. Now look. [9]Their precious 'anteverses'. Totally out of control.
Dialogue.DF376C274BC7C24E926B178AC951E1A6_28A5EA9: I know I'm asking a lot, but working together is our best chance. [6.75]It's our only chance, don't you agree?
Dialogue.D43EEF964F0ECF6A546C7B95D3226665_84DFBE1: I know a megalomaniac when I see one. [3.6]He was standing on the pulpit of a CHURCH for crying out loud. [8.7]He and Enderson would get along swimmingly. For all we know, they did! [15.8](Sigh)[17.5]You haven't managed to arrange a coffee have you?
Dialogue.CD7A05824E91A382FF853FB315126BEE_09CA50D: I know it sounds crazy, but if Frake says it'll work ... well ... I trust her. [5.6]Just ... stand back when it all goes up, yeah?
Dialogue.860A05A34F88CE14B5E0B8B5BF1A7858_08113E4: I left them alone for thirty minutes, and this happens.
Dialogue.0A51DC094E6DECD386063C8525917AC9_5FC0510: I locked it in ... with everyone else ... Am I ... there too?
Dialogue.4BC7C0BF48C8F676B14D2EBC6D3D1E3D_27E759D: I look forward to meeting you again, under better circumstances.
Dialogue.B2CE76C047A389BC259417AD04AA2687_A783C72: I lost my whole team - you think I'm going back in there, you better think again. [5.3]You need a goddamn army.
Dialogue.E9C970A1443E9C4A04516A933178C07A_98DBDC4: I may have to go back to the facility to charge, but I will return.
Dialogue.9EB89BD24E90F397A23AAB89D9A9C8B1_F2E10BE: I may soon need the facilities.
Dialogue.DC5E30464AE83D62A4C03BA2639BC20C_1E3C2DE: I met someone who looked like you before! [3.5]He said his name was ... Abe, I think. He wanted to help us, but he never came back.
Dialogue.9AE972DA4A2092BD1458759E5FB60F1F_F2E10BE: I must say, I am feeling a bit under the weather.
Dialogue.4EAD05034BC89DB5C3E20DAF85E827AF_5D63EF4: I need to access the Dark Lens. There's no telling what will happen if someone else - or something else - used it.[8]We should explore the Botanical Wing and see if there isn't some kind of technology or... perhaps a key that can help us through the force field.[16]I'm sure when you find it, you'll know it. If history tells us one thing, you seem to have a nose for it.
Dialogue.E66D55164AABF49D1661A688D10D4A47_F2E10BE: I perceive a distinct lack of snacks.
Dialogue.CB04684E417826851AB45CB7ACF1D9DE_28A5EA9: I really am in your debt.[2.25]I'm not just saying that.
Dialogue.D2439F464203FC6AF38E8980DCBD344B_28A5EA9: I really can't tell you how much I detest some of the people in GATE's employ. [5.79]We call them "contractors" but... where's the line, really?
Dialogue.0589B13F4C127DDDC5555EB215128339_EF8738C: I really don't know what to say.
Dialogue.513BEBDC4008F2B93E4305A154495683_18C7EC2: I reckon you know what you need to do, and if you don't, well, don't look at me.
Dialogue.845D0F5D41C378AF2A380583A5516C0B_08CBFFC: I remain, as a witness, and gatherer.
Dialogue.EA2E20964E9BC7ACA6CB77BECF583685_98535A7: I saw Thule before, coffee cup in hand. [3.7]He said something about going to Residence Sector and 'giving Manse a piece of his mind'. [10.10]Whatever that means.
Dialogue.D56F1BF040A69D8311930682A665EB4C_0630D2E: I saw a transrecon report once.[2.35]It mentioned something looking like ... that ...[6.69] like ... well, I don't have to tell you, do I?[10.58]But I've seen every specimen TR brings back.[13.37]There's nothing like this in Containment ...[15.57]It isn't one of OURS, so how did it get here?
Dialogue.BAAAA5B646DCF5AEDEE6D4A669945D9D_500EBB0: I see this cannot have been your intended destination! [3.02]Not even Prometheans would be so foolish as to enter the heart of our kingdom. [7.03]Ah, but the Anchorae ... the Lodestones, you call them ... more than mere rock and bone and flesh, [13.58]they are more potent than we know - they pursue their own ends, and warp perforations like water.
Dialogue.72333268469C1069F141AAB96704AEE1_28A5EA9: I see why they call it the Control Center.
Dialogue.F401A9E047ACA1FD7CAF3F9A144693BB_9EAF573: I see ye, deceiver! Be gone!
Dialogue.851AB1204312A8BFA7FB55891A8CE8B4_58FA765: I seen some crazy stuff down here. Workin' with Frake's been a trip. [5.7]First time we been invaded, though. [8.4]If I were you, I'd head for the surface tunnel. Get your ass outta here.
Dialogue.2663204C42EFEC946182E385C21E033E_A783C72:
I seen some crazy stuff here, I mean, we all have, [4.5]but no-one said
anything about a goddamn invasion.
Dialogue.B83CFABC4C351D159DA4B49E17A1AF63_98DBDC4: I sense intense electromagnetic fluctuations - can you see them too?
Dialogue.0CFBAB5D4E241435E74D35A05E0919B1_F2E10BE: I should probably locate a restroom...
Dialogue.9D9875764F4CDA60FA27448DBCA31021_D280DA7: I shoulda checked the contract with my lawyer, my mum said. But I don't have a lawyer. [6.0]Nobody gave me one.
Dialogue.EACF69924E69F47102F3A6BEF26F7251_7D797E7: I still don't understand - the system shouldn't have locked us out. [4.6]That's not how I designed it.
Dialogue.65FF2A564B04F2ED7AAB60AF1BAADA5D_09B430A: I suppose it's a bit like a slip and slide,[2.95]but bigger, and louder,[5.7]and more likely to kill or maim or drown you.
Dialogue.9F6239FF4D5870AABF6E5F8F70CBC964_84DFBE1: I suppose you want me to tell you everything's going to be fine - well, it's not.
Dialogue.280F75E24F1B183C6B6F3B977A3C8ABA_84DFBE1: I suppose you're actually going to listen to this creature.[4.0]He's about as human as my shoe.[7.6]Trust an IS? We'd have to be in a dire situation, indeed.[13.4]I suppose you think this qualifies? Hmph, still being dramatic I see.
Dialogue.3D73875B4C3429F87643499053C00DD6_09CA50D: I think ... I may be lost.
Dialogue.EB0C6A5A45F7AA837B1782B3CFA0D0B2_98DBDC4: I think I will grow used to this.
Dialogue.1A91D11E467B3E6C89B214A1A72F8ACF_5D63EF4: I think that's Dr. Verenkov over there ...
Dialogue.B4B39A2A431A931C823CD0ADB51DEF7A_587DB37: I think the soldiers are running out of ammo, but we're not safe yet ...
Dialogue.730265EB4D08264CF9C699A4AE2EE082_28A5EA9: I thought I was going to be stuck there forever.
Dialogue.B8528AD74AF3F118292B908DCBD9F8D5_5D63EF4: I thought about using the portals to get out of here, of course I did! [5.2]But without the Lens they're impossible to predict, let alone control. [9.6]And besides, exits ground near entries. [13]If you don't get stranded in some random anteverse, you'll just end up dumped in another part of the facility.
Dialogue.5D9CCA1F4C2B1DF92DEAC7A3581F4FF9_6AA6D76: I thought they were coming to help! [2]But they weren’t Gatekeepers! [3]They started shooting! [4.6]I wasn’t trained for this! [6]I’m just a receptionist!
Dialogue.C6DFEF0B486EC3D645332A8F034EA55B_D5875C8: I thought this might be a safe place to wait until they sorted this out ... [4.1]whatever 'this' is. Looks like I was wrong. [8.3]That useless rent-a-cop in the plaza said to go through Manufacturing, [12.26]then head for the Surface Tunnel I suppose... But that's a whole sector away. [16.3]If they think I'm walking all that way, through their toxic machine shops, [20]they can think again.
Dialogue.EB26E10E4BC660BCEB709A9C65915983_0630D2E: I thought you ... were the creature ...
Dialogue.B954387141CAA363B1B8299F54848E3D_D5875C8: I told Derek it would happen - but he just kept saying 'No, the Dark Lens is stable, Elanor knows what she's doing.' [7.2]Well, apparently not.
Dialogue.77EA0A2B4843AD4483026290B3AE6D73_09B430A: I told you it was going to get worse before it gets better.
Dialogue.5A5FDFF945368E7C17A2F4B281C5BE6F_F2E10BE: I was not made for this heat!
Dialogue.786335F14330E08D8BEE1A816112B92B_8C6F078: I was trying to get down to Reactors,[3.0]but prudence dictated holing up here, as you may imagine.[7.6]I can only assume you're here to utilize the transmitter for some reason.[13]It appears the radiation is blocking the signal. [16.6]Perhaps you could devise something to shield it,[19.8]but I'm afraid that's outside my realm of ... ah ... expertise.
Dialogue.56868CB146333D5282F5CE87995ED393_28A5EA9: I wasn't sure you were still alive.
Dialogue.C93FA306482C9D7BD62B769BBEAA7A8B_27E759D: I will be here if you require me to water anything. [3.5]Dr. Wakeman says I am equal to my gardening, and that I am a conversationalist. [9.3]He is kind, but I know we all need watering from time to time.
Dialogue.CE062B314FF127420C0B82A0D201D183_28A5EA9: I wish I could help - but if you could just dispense with these savages, I'll get us out of here!
Dialogue.58D5E5A24A8E4592F76231A36007C80D_09B430A: I wonder if the energy shedding caused by the trans-luminal effects of the mega-portal has inverted the entropic frame ...
Dialogue.B5A2BA5A4734C5EC361F9E81D97AF729_98535A7: I wonder if we should try and reach Residence Sector? [4.4]I mean, surely Manse and his lot had a way out of here. [8.5]Somewhere in the Executive Wing maybe?
Dialogue.62D7E53C4F68C6CACDD3C3920A9F8552_98DBDC4: I wonder what Dr. Wakeman would think of this.
Dialogue.AD54944D4454E9E440474894D1972AA7_5D63EF4: I wouldn't blame you for trying your luck, but don't expect me to follow.
Dialogue.811674E14E615ECF10342AB7006C6305_587DB37: I wouldn't say we have a lot of time.
Dialogue.5D82904940439419420D12A212963E10_98535A7: I'd almost forgotten this place was down here, Janet. [4.3]You remember when they did the first perforation test in Power Services, after Flathill? [10.33]It took so much power they made us turn off every light, and half the equipment in the facility! [16.2]And they still almost didn't have enough. [18.9]Now it's all fuel cells and Dark Lenses.
Dialogue.C341609340CD435D9A7E49B6E63636A5_28A5EA9: I'd be intrigued to know where the waygate in the central fusion reactor leads. [4.55]The Gatekeepers have been using it with impunity, which suggests they have a degree of control over its destination - [11.39]nice to know we won't end up at the bottom of the ocean, or thrust into the heart of a star, I suppose.
Dialogue.36A58FA04E7389637F81B3932EB14791_28A5EA9: I'd been quite worried about you, but I can see there was no need. You are... incredible.
Dialogue.A35C93EA40DB47CA9F15D69FEA2F5775_F2E10BE: I'd give up my doctorate for a little rest.
Dialogue.2CA0076B46013B7B9A43ADBA1D1D7C0B_AF4702B: I'd head for the garage, and go from there, if I were you. [3.2]You can't miss it. [4.4]Just be careful - these guys ain't messin' around.
Dialogue.0B8F088443C8A6F30A6F5CBABAC5E1D2_18C7EC2: I'd love to help, but what am I supposed to do?
Dialogue.47A712EE48DE468ED5700FA681DE2A7B_98535A7: I'd say this makes the top five worst things that have ever happened here.
Dialogue.849518004099B2377248E5B8A7872486_09B430A: I'd worry if you didn't, Abe.
Dialogue.4AC9AB494D9CC52AA59844A4B5C13C36_587DB37: I'll admit, some of those Gatekeepers pack a punch, for a bunch of sage-burning woo-woos.
Dialogue.5B4FAF184471886B43A4EA889A1956DC_4D54ED2: I'll be going soon - I'm sure Frake's worrying about me.
Dialogue.61B8E98F4DE5E46E6A59DF8E95517E60_587DB37: I'll be sorry to sacrifice that beautiful machine, but we're past worrying about property damage.
Dialogue.77C6C98840D1EDD0C90F2C81CF1E2E4F_1E8E4DD: I'll come soon, when it's safer ... but I'm not going to stop you.
Dialogue.7EEC7DF449A105C5E678E1981382BD2D_5FC0510: I'll follow you soon ... Uh, through Manufacturing...  ... When I'm back ... When I've returned... from where I am.
Dialogue.AF9F39564463FE6A9E7BF0B1D6EDBFEC_28A5EA9: I'll just wait here, shall I?
Dialogue.EFCCF0ED4F37D833342453AFE7F4E840_98535A7: I'll survive, Janet, if I must. ... Wait, let me see those readings. Oh. Oh dear. Perhaps not. ... Well, good luck in there!
Dialogue.5FFFF3B54ECF0ED0CDD5D6BB9CCEC429_5D63EF4: I'll try and convince Abe and Dr. Ross to follow you ... if I can.
Dialogue.DF7E841E44A47FDFC3AF5BBAEF1481EC_9D66FB2: I'm a little tied up right now - but you're new, so take a look around. [3.75]Not exactly ideal timing, but you're looking at one of the facility's oldest areas - where our perforation work started! [10.55]It's history down here! [12.19]And yeah, getting past some of the security might mean getting your hands a little ... [16.5]messy, but hey, if you want tidy, go work in a library!
Dialogue.537F426E41665E459CA4C4971087A556_B10FECB: I'm aware that thinking on the cosmic scale is a defense mechanism in times of extreme stress or chaos, but it's really all I have right now.[9.98]Please don't judge me.
Dialogue.E7BDB2BE404D996ECB598BB31528F7D7_9D66FB2: I'm being realistic here: [1.06]I know we've got some work cut out for us cleaning this place up, but the power is one less thing to worry about. [7.42]Except for the electrical fault, I guess, but we can deal with the substation whenever. [11.54]I mean, it's just on the other side of that wall. No hurry.
Dialogue.5E80F44442C20E4549D0DE9BDC06441B_28A5EA9: I'm confident that if you can deal with the ice and the Gatekeepers, I'll be able to activate the Dark Lens and open the way.[6.74]I just need access.
Dialogue.5BF0B1204729B303A0BF8F84AFF503E8_F2E10BE: I'm experiencing an insufficiency of food.
Dialogue.7758D5C5431EF8DDC10BB180E85C30A0_5D63EF4: I'm glad to see you're alright.
Dialogue.BDCAE3424E7BBC2BECCDB6940AD47213_5D63EF4: I'm glad you're still alive, and look,[2.37]this is going to sound ridiculous ... but ... we need to get down to Reactors![7.55]With the Dark Lens gone, it's the only working portal equipment in the facility![12.1]... A way out![14.25]So what if we opened the spillway?![17]All that water ends up in one place - Reactors![21.2]Nobody would expect us to risk our lives like that -[25]which is exactly why we should do it![28.2]It could be our only chance!
Dialogue.3353D23141F691213CEBC7AF79787A88_98535A7: I'm glad you're still with us.
Dialogue.8DA6699746FAA52B4F3ACB9764DB57BF_98535A7: I'm going to miss this hallway.
Dialogue.ED876A69481D2C8A2CF2FA8DD9408DFB_08113E4: I'm going to wait here. It's not safe out there.
Dialogue.165F21D24249B362E212F29FCC06F033_09B430A: I'm just fine with lonely, Abe.
Dialogue.7D83604F48306B6BD2C229AF2EA6D44F_09CA50D: I'm just trying to help get us out of here
Dialogue.10D3CE1545A6581963FAEDA8B576AF45_D5875C8: I'm just waiting for the right moment to ... well ... I'll know it when I see it. I'm an optimist.
Dialogue.FC84BD8541D2D1B2D16BDCA2E2BB0A42_B10FECB: I'm no defeatist, but objectively, this is almost certainly the end of life as we know it, [5.96]and frankly, we brought this on ourselves[9.69]so ... I'm going to find a cosy anteverse and probably stay there indefinitely.[15.34]You're welcome to join me. You seem to be quite in your element.
Dialogue.63556C594A99D9224C3F749EAEB8183F_28A5EA9: I'm not entirely sure how this happened,[2.24]but it looks like the way into the Hydroplant[4.77]is blocked by a rather large volume of water.[7.93]But not to panic - if you just activate the pumps,[11.9]I ... think it should drain ... somewhere.[15.8]And whatever that is ... in the water ...[18.79]I wouldn't worry about it ... we've got bigger fish to fry.
Dialogue.FDB872DB4BFF49F564B7B781AA033E42_28A5EA9: I'm not going lie to you - this is worse than I expected. [5.07]Much worse. [7.0]This sector is swarming with Gatekeepers, which can only mean one thing: GATE is cleaning house ... and we are the dirt. [19.14]They were using a waygate in the center to come and go from this facility. [23.98]But now those scoundrels have shut down the nuclear reactors that power it. [29.04]I presume, to prevent the invaders from using it. [32.98]However, we rather need that waygate to ... not be closed. [38.06]Therefore ... we should look into bringing it all back online. [38.07]But no need to get ahead of ourselves. [40.85]Let's start simple - with Dusk Reactor. That seems sensible? It just needs a little fuel, I imagine. [49.36]I'm going to look around, maybe poke my nose into a few spots, and try to figure out this place a little more. [56.9]I'll let you know what I dig up.
Dialogue.4F778E1E41EC96B2241862A20951256A_587DB37: I'm not going to say it, I'm not going to say 'I told you so'.
Dialogue.49AD1D9B4835E2BF3AA38E83991808A0_9D66FB2: I'm not gonna lie - it's been a weird couple o' days, but we're almost there. [4.33]We're almost ... there. We're almost ...
Dialogue.FC21B87E4F8DD919DAEBC79D9AC1D7AC_09B430A: I'm not ready to think about ... the implications of that, Abe.[4.5]I'm still wondering why you make them play lethal games of "Capture the Abe" every friday night.
Dialogue.F8FACFCB498D003D4C16869F7B5D9BA2_D5875C8: I'm not ready yet ... just a little longer ... [3]Maybe they'll fix this and I can get back to my work. [5]I have samples denaturing as we speak.
Dialogue.FBA6038D4968DE908075C791C81681EB_09B430A: I'm not staying here forever, Abe[2.3]but neither of us is ready to confront several squads of highly armed and desperate Gatekeepers[7.7]somewhere inside what is clearly a significant breakdown in the space-time continuum.
Dialogue.1F91F4524D689E5C14068CB0E892EC84_EF8738C: I'm not sure I understand what you're getting at.
Dialogue.7002072443BCF9FCBA9E628AE4CFF3FD_D5875C8: I'm not sure any of us really understood the risks. There are questions we should have stopped to ask. [8.2]For all the good it does now.
Dialogue.65868106419A302C6F664C9058FD69ED_84DFBE1: I'm not sure how you did it, but I'm grateful, slightly.
Dialogue.A4CDC9A24A7CF4888B4BC890D21575B8_0508B95: I'm not sure if you're aware,[2.27]but IS Oh Four Two has colonised[6.39]a large part of the reservoir down there.[9.95]It's benign as far as we know,[13.1]but I wouldn't go touching it.
Dialogue.9CCA634441194EC936D22299378F8B55_84DFBE1: I'm really not enjoying this at all.
Dialogue.0162461D4121081DCA71448A2751F2E8_09195BA: I'm staying right here. Anything else is crazy. [3.7]If the portal system has malfunctioned, [5.9]there's no telling what could have found its way into the facility.
Dialogue.14BFFB6745B70CF0141643BCA2E1B0FC_28A5EA9: I'm still locked out of the system! Their Magi is blocking it! ... just keep trying!
Dialogue.2ECEFBE6453B0DA022CE96B954F23A94_B7CAC62: I'm supposed to transfer to Cascade, it's all approved. I'm joining Dr. Tengku's team, do you know her?
Dialogue.0E8A8C3B40D0680569972A9315DFCBA9_84DFBE1:
I'm sure Manse and his crew made it out, of course they did. [5.96]
The Exec probably rocketed out of here on golden jet packs.
Dialogue.6E2A0DC94C531A4FB5499C89C006217E_98535A7: I'm sure we'll think of something.
Dialogue.75F536354CC5F667A62C82AF68B68089_28A5EA9: I'm surprised we haven't met before, actually.
Dialogue.0DFE02CB4B3A577DE991D29B0CE56E46_09B430A: I'm trying not to think too much right now, Abe.
Dialogue.E9826F0A490EC09FBDACF4825D0715D9_8C6F078: I've been here almost twenty years,[4.5]from the very beginning.[7.7]And now we must abandon the facility.[12]I can scarcely believe it.[15.3]But bullets have a way of bringing reality forward, rather, don't they.
Dialogue.87DC7D534EA3C775EEACDD834EECF0B8_28A5EA9: I've been working in this facility for almost 15 years. [4.55]I honestly can't believe it's come to this.
Dialogue.D202F93649AD5ED1E5C18A92B7DC5B43_84DFBE1: I've got one piece of advice for dealing with that frozen floating gasbag, but if you see it, it's probably already too late.
Dialogue.9E6B46CD4F1CD7B16BB1A9995CC3884A_08113E4: I've had just about enough of this.
Dialogue.E761102745BA49090194B587D1382427_28A5EA9: I've heard of this place ... Intrados. Makes you shudder, doesn't it? [6.05]They call it Shadowgate, because of course they would. A GATE containment facility run by those esoteric brutes. [16.8]This is what happens when you're given too long a leash. [21.4]It would appear they've surrounded these woods with some kind of containment field... [27.42]I wonder if that related to... Hmm. [33.16]Friend, it probably goes without saying... a frontal assault would be ... particularly unstrategic.
Dialogue.D85B1A6C44667A3B01A9DC86069DCB7F_F5807AE: I've never been entirely sure what Lenora sees in IS-111, [4.55]or even why she brought it back from A21 in the first place. [8.77]She says being near it gives her a 'warm, calm sense of peace.' [14.75]I pointed out that as the strange little furry cone of flesh seems to hunt entirely by telepathy, [20.6]it's likely she was simply falling prey to its psychic lure. [24.9]She did not seem overly concerned. [28.03]But after all, that is her way.
Dialogue.8C0689E248E58857779A149D2CF28E6A_98535A7: I've never understood, Janet. [2.6]What do the Gatekeepers actually believe?
Dialogue.2D08BAFD4E6EE141C0C4CFB8EAEA9C88_0508B95: I've seen something in the water ... I think.[3.0]Could be to do with I.S. Oh Four Two ...[6.58]or something else entirely ...[9.0]Right now ... it's impossible to tell.
Dialogue.C7A7695A41D3E348ECEEBCB73E9AAE97_5FC0510: I.. I thought I was there... but I'm.... I'm still here ... am I? ... I'm here ... ? ... but ... she's ... there.
Dialogue.DAF20DF84462ED57882A17BA489367FD_F2E10BE: I... I'm dying. It's so hot.
Dialogue.F5C642244C71B498805634A543E6D7C2_F5807AE: IS-0173 - the aptly-named Pest - [4.64]is intriguing in part for the similarities it bears to so much early life on Earth. [9.52]Based on certain genetic parallels, and indeed, its genetic structure, [14.05]Dr Pendleton has identified some striking similarities to early life on Earth. [18.44]But until we gather more information, her theory remains ... theory, at best.
Dialogue.31574D724AA945B59A50EA992374D02F_F5807AE: IS-091 is the most intense AV candidate we've ever encountered. [6.5]Despite its appearance, it's a transcorporeal entity of some kind, [11.50]invulnerable to any of the physical deterrents we've tested so far. [15.93]Walls, doors, shielding, they do nothing to impede it ... [20.85]Intriguingly, it only appears to a single viewer at one time. [25.53]Dr. Stern has that dubious honor. [28.95]He identified it in the field and it followed him back here - [32.4]began materializing in the facility, looking for him like a lost puppy.
Dialogue.8D43CA874FB87EA1D9E22EB2D573C58D_09B430A: If Abe doesn't turn up soon ... someone's going to have to go find him ... [5.3]Looks like that's me. [7.6]But I guess any plans I had just went out the window, anyway.
Dialogue.0482F1724ED61069284FB59B559F467B_5D63EF4: If I could only get to Reactors, there's equipment that could help. [5.8]But it may as well be on the moon right now.
Dialogue.17211204454924C337EB6BBDA0220776_EF8738C: If I don't go soon, horrible things will happen.
Dialogue.C3734EAA4CED2D0503D729851314E30F_EF8738C: If I don't sleep, I'm going to fall over.
Dialogue.925529EC49A64184136AC7B7DE2514AA_09B430A: If I had to guess, I'd say that creature you, ah, inconvenienced ...[6.4]somehow harnessed the geomagnetic forces focused on this island [10.4]to generate a standing perforation of incredible size when it ... well ...[16.8]I was going to say 'died', but I'm not sure that's what actually happened here.
Dialogue.C3A49DF64BD8866ACBFE23B7AB9BD422_84DFBE1: If I had to guess, I'd say there's a feedback loop between a low energy anteverse such as sixty-seven or eighty-two and ours, [10.9]causing a hemorrhage of energy from our side to theirs, and a completely inverted thermal gradient. [18.9]But I'll be damned if I feel like getting a closer look. I'll leave that to chancers like you.
Dialogue.896045D64F0B09E48DFF398137E9EF17_B10FECB: If I sound ... exasperated with Keystone, well ... just look around you.[5.2]All of this?[6.69]It happened because of decisions THEY made, and rather than fix it they're determined to make it worse.
Dialogue.5395A4BA412D9185EB5FB6B51FB18EAE_28A5EA9: If I tried to help, I'd just get in the way, wouldn't I?
Dialogue.7DE413A04A3AB18BBC81939DC1B5A22B_F2E10BE: If I was any more tired I'd be comatose.
Dialogue.483CE92A40A72718F00AF99411CB8D09_08113E4: If Jager thinks I'm crawling through the vents to let him in, he's got another thing coming.
Dialogue.85DFE8D648849023331970A5506E98B3_EF8738C: If it gets any colder, I may have a problem.
Dialogue.641105744FC666A87B7EFA8449B8F116_84DFBE1: If it goes wrong, I better not receive any E-Mails about it!
Dialogue.9C146A344B5F99D8DF086D9BD47A2124_5D63EF4: If it's a choice between random portals [2.7]and risking my skin with whatever's lurking in Security Sector, [7.3]well, that's no choice at all. [9.8]I'm staying here.
Dialogue.E2E076284210D8BEEACF59828ADEE865_F5807AE: If our intelligence is to be trusted, the Order - [4.27]I forget their pretentious Latin name - [7.0]regard themselves as the only safe custodians of the anomalies we research here at Cascade. [13.53]Indeed, reports delivered to the Exec Committee suggest these zealots see themselves as protectors of humanity - [20.6]the usual alibi for retrograde behaviour through the ages. [25.23]Imagine what humanity could learn - how we could profit as a species - [30.25]from access to something like the Sun Disk! [33.74]We are sure they have it in their possession. [36.48]A reply from the stars, and they bury it like some shameful secret. [41.5]Superstitious idiots.
Dialogue.B308E71840A37B1E0AF9009E4A3C6D5F_09B430A: If that was the only option left, Abe,[3.55]I'd push you down first.[5.05]And besides, I've heard the plant portal is totally out of control.
Dialogue.5E630676492A888EEDF0AE853DA72B21_587DB37: If the Blacksmith can make the parts to fix the electron pumps, [3.0]we'll blow the synchrotron to kingdom come. [6.0]A little extreme, perhaps, but clearly the rules have changed and I don't hear any better plans.
Dialogue.4DFCB26241D5A814084B91B2AE5BE64A_A783C72:
If there's anyone left in the Electrical Station, maybe they know to get
out of here, but this isn't my sector. [5.5]As long as that trigger-happy
asshole's out there, I got nothing!
Dialogue.BCDD81BA41DA82DCC89B2E85D02AB328_1FF8065: If there's something in your way, 'cuz I put it there... [3.4]There should be a tool down there. [5.3]Something you can smash the crate with. [7.6]You might have to look around a bit. [9.2]Don't worry about smashing stuff, we got a lot crates [14]A lot of crates.
Dialogue.1966EAF0472B57E5B957DCB98BC8AA18_84DFBE1: If this is what it takes to get home, maybe we should all just get comfortable on this forsaken rock.
Dialogue.64B754394EEF0C1D2D5FECB9A905F9F3_52045D4: If we don't, who's gonna do it? [1.55]Bridge gonna build itself? [2.83]That's crazy talk. [4.11]Only an IDIOT would try any other way. [6.13]Ropes? Hah. [7.2]Jetpack? Fools. [9.03]You'd kill yourself even trying! [10.9]The bridge. The bridge is the way.
Dialogue.EBA0313946EB6134E80B6F80A068B8A0_EF8738C: If we escape from this, would you like to collaborate on a research paper?
Dialogue.2FF3E7CC4C7063132FBD198206D5A8AD_D5875C8: If we ever make it out of here, I'm moving somewhere it never snows. Like Miami.
Dialogue.D47B688B449CED5AE954E6A4BE927BC6_98535A7: If we had a piece of software that was sufficiently advanced, [3.2]perhaps it could navigate the blocks those fanatics have put on our communications, [7]but where would we get something like that?
Dialogue.46AEF59543625625977C9C983A808CAF_08113E4: If we miss the neutrino burst, it'll be months of work wasted.
Dialogue.9284196D4CFBC92BB1FB899FB558534D_08113E4: If we miss the neutrino burst, it'll be months of work wasted.
Dialogue.6BB8E4234A0D4027039E6080E44FA061_1E8E4DD: If we survive this, our high energy research will been set back months, maybe years!
Dialogue.79C18BC7405BD39515F072AE3B81748B_28A5EA9: If you can force the creature back to its realm, [2.86]the rift should reground itself locally - and provide a way out of this purgatory they've created for it.
Dialogue.DCCAF0164C761D7BF4713F801C3DCA3D_B19337C: If you can get out of here, send help ...
Dialogue.DF970568444E4039433876BF75865A1D_28A5EA9: If you could find a way to disrupt their lesser shields, [3.33]dispensing with these fiends would be that much easier - but you may have to get ... creative. [10.54]Maybe they're carrying something we can use against them. [13.95]Fight hocus with pocus, as they say.
Dialogue.F6A0931748C577EF2377EDB74BDDC8BA_28A5EA9: If you decide to leave this world, or seek another plane, please do tell me.[5.5]We've been through a lot, and I like to keep in touch.
Dialogue.D5DB68C94F21128C343AC0B03EDA7DA2_27E759D: If you ever visit Synaptic Labs, please do not mention me to Dr. Lewis.
Dialogue.FC4434CE4967D189F64F3CA884C986CE_27E759D: If you ever visit Synaptic Labs, please do not mention me to Dr. Lewis.
Dialogue.3E5CF76046C1141C126CF7B7FB144C3F_28A5EA9: If you find a way out of here, tell me.
Dialogue.19D6031A41D5A35745F6B190A855B8E6_0630D2E: If you find any open terminals, tell me![3.4]But be careful - it can hear everything!
Dialogue.6398C1E242ABBB44C56A3F89729B2C67_9D66FB2: If you gotta go, you gotta go, I know, I know, and the way to the control center's clear now - [4.68]just head up there, open the door and the world's your oyster ... [8.6]if you don't mind your oysters flambéd by eldritch fire from the abyss.
Dialogue.ACBD08E348503BEDD5EAF8A243FB15F3_AD7A481: If you remember one thing from this moment, let it be this: There is no return from unknowing.
Dialogue.7FBA8BB74CFF04084807BEB34A374BC7_98535A7: If you say so Janet. [2.0]I think the Shopping District looks like a giant snowball. It's kind of fun. [7.7]But yes, it also probably spells our inevitable destruction ... Much like a mushroom cloud.
Dialogue.5F7581F748EE1D564154C0B5B2AA7A08_27E759D: If you see Dr. Wakeman, please tell him I have been tending the office plants, just as he wished.
Dialogue.1AF27DA84A8C608108994F8400929F7D_587DB37: If you see any of my team, tell them you've found a way out.
Dialogue.900DEB1C4F2136F80A91F7B1F6EB1995_F609D41: If you think I am taking one step out of there so long as les connard are here, think again.
Dialogue.0434C73144EBA940621F04A6F34E8D1B_0508B95: If you want to reach the portal in the neutrino detector,[3.55]you've got a rather long swim ahead of you.[6.95]I wouldn't try it without equipment,[9.6]and the sub's out of action ...
Dialogue.841C319348B1B1094D2029B80F13BD56_0508B95: If you want to reach the portal in the neutrino detector,[3.55]you've got a rather long swim ahead of you.[6.95]I wouldn't try it without equipment,[9.6]and the sub's out of action ...
Dialogue.DD191F104D470A2AB185A5938BEA959D_84DFBE1: If you were wondering what the end of the world looks like, I'd say it looks a lot like this.
Dialogue.E2BF62E14EAA90A1A7E6EB92A9FD44B6_58FA765: If you're in the area, I got some new gear, could help you right now.
Dialogue.CE567DE44ABCD3D5AA83FBAED33C0973_4AE005C: If you're looking for the spillway mainframe,[3.5]it's on the bottom level of the Waterfall Apartments,[7.8]if you can get in there.
Dialogue.0A5667BD47C4FA532305B4AC1BEBE9CB_587DB37: If you're not going to press that button, I will.
Dialogue.51E19EA24F3A525655096CA4B7D3D841_09B430A: If you're not sure, Abe, then it probably doesn't matter that much.
Dialogue.9CE48C2E4EEC584900EF418E2EC98081_4AE005C: If you're serious about opening the spillway flow control,[4.5]I can tell you two things:[6.7]Start with the power system over there - these quakes triggered a shutdown, but should reset easy enough.[16.3]The next part's NOT gonna be so easy.[20]You'd need to reboot the spillway computer,[23.7]unlock the flow valves,[25.67]and bring the central network transmitter back online somehow.[31]It could be done ... but ...[35.77]How desperate are you?
Dialogue.0EA5FEB141162D5D56C5BC9FE0D49ED4_23ED69A: Imagine the horror, the chaos, no, I must keep going, no matter what, [5.3]no matter who ... or how ... it must continue, never cease ...
Dialogue.A97FF0624A3624B6B5FDBD862A1A2C3F_28A5EA9: Imagine the most savage mercenaries on Earth, add paranoia, black magic, a technicolor rainbow of cruelty ...[8.84] and Gatekeepers would eat them alive. [12.17]They're human cruise missiles, if 'human' is even the right word.
Dialogue.0D9003B54C8B4576B7A46082F79C5ED7_D66552D: In silence, was safety. Now, no longer. You must adapt. As we have.
Dialogue.36EA937E455C4B52C5EAC9BC1C4AA5B5_7D797E7: In the end, the science is all that matters.
Dialogue.AC860827430282B05CF82698CAD4667F_6D94EB0: In the face of the wind, Atum turns where it blows him, [5.2]knowing nothing more than its soft hand upon his back.
Dialogue.89CC61C74A5601E3749D02BA0E24ED9F_F5807AE: Increasingly, we believe I.S. Oh-Six-Four - the Composer - is not an individual being at all, [7.29]but the extension of another entity entirely. [10.33]We have not been able to reach this entity, nor open another perforation to its original domain. [16.31]We achieved close contact of a sort, but now it seems to be almost ... hiding from us. [23.32]We are unsure how it managed this, but if I am right, [26.91]and it interpreted our first intrusion as an attack, this may have consequences we cannot forsee.
Dialogue.4D488E7A4D5DFB47DFA524953A6654D2_98DBDC4: Is it done? [0.2]I don't feel anything ... [0.4]Wait! I can feel ... a way out ... opening! ... [5.0]Thank my you friend! ... [8]Take me with you ...
Dialogue.67ED8EF74C875033945F07854A7030F8_B7CAC62: Is it your first day too?
Dialogue.2E70E9D64D8C8B4C2B4887812945C4BF_EF8738C: Is it your first time dealing with this sort of thing?
Dialogue.4A20595040D1498E40EE75BF0E4F89D4_EF8738C: Is that all you have to say?
Dialogue.9681DD1D41EBBE1E6FED4788C0054FEE_D5875C8: Is there a human out there?
Dialogue.919BC1D34663A663613F9ABC913A66CE_EF8738C: Is this the end of something, or just the beginning?
Dialogue.089C013040EB57235D9C96862BDF7687_C8E28C6: Is this your hive? [3]It smells strange? [6]How we came to this cave? [9]The brightness then a new smell? [12]New flavors everywhere? [15]The old scents are gone? [18]We cannot see paths? [21]How will we spawn?
Dialogue.496888194597A4F6432A428EB3CC3013_EF8738C: Isn't there something you should be doing?
Dialogue.E748F6CD4969A40EBA008C995F4CD9FE_98535A7: It appears Manse and his team were doing something in the Athletics area to alleviate the storm problem,[8.3]but had to abandon their work before they could finish it.[13.0]I plan to go investigate as soon as Ela warms up a bit.
Dialogue.2B375FF24F4DFC65357B08857C20CDC8_4D54ED2: It could always be worse. You're probably hearing that a lot, though.
Dialogue.7C8B2D93417712D1867124B91A37D8FF_84DFBE1: It could be hotter, but I'll take it.
Dialogue.D040E8B74FEBD9392DFA06AB59DE97DE_1E3C2DE: It feels like ... my thoughts are climbing up ... [3.2]like a ladder, higher and higher! It gets harder to answer them all. [8.3]Isn't that strange?
Dialogue.5E6ED41B43C67590C6EDDC9280A33831_98535A7: It is a little nippy, isn't it, Janet.
Dialogue.01D44A8E4CF696C9A7B40AA49491A210_AD7A481: It is not how, or why, but when.
Dialogue.3E4587B244926663DDEB9083F5E320D1_98535A7: It knows we're here, Janet ... [2.3]There's nothing holding it back ... [5]Flathill is open.
Dialogue.330F2A79426ED0E31F2434BC0D443878_98535A7: It looks to me like you're entirely capable of doing just that.
Dialogue.FE09925D47DFF77B263C8F982EC445E6_23ED69A: It never stops, it never ends, it goes on, and on... [6.0]Haa...wait ... no, I must not stop ... it must ... I must ...
Dialogue.985FC564458ABD3666307BB27AA957E0_6B614EA: It seems our research is not as secret as we thought. [3.0]I believe they have been watching us for years,
Dialogue.F8C67FCB4FADF0A10EF777B62E5CBD31_9D66FB2: It takes four nuclear reactors to ignite the central fusion generator - [3.48]but then you've got basically all the energy you need ... for anything! [7.39]It's why we built this thing. So let's work on that, shall we?
Dialogue.872CE875400D458878E64A8076405B62_AD7A481: It was ever so, that we struggled at the edge of the light, [5.0]knowing not whether we stepped towards darkness or day, [9.7]and soon enough, darkness will rise.
Dialogue.8072128D4E3EF126758F26BD0576B201_B10FECB: It was my job to protect us, but ... there were too many, too fast. [5]We were underprepared ... and I admit, not very subtle. [10]I know exactly what Derek will say.
Dialogue.992E8F8A484C64380DA1F8AD17E163BB_F980962: It was never meant to exist here ...
Dialogue.DED228CD4A5EE5ABA509FC9AC53F90C2_98DBDC4: It will take ... time ... to grow accustomed to this.
Dialogue.E28270664FF3518690E2FA8ADEADF644_F5807AE: It would seem that IS Oh-Two-Three is quite averse to the high energy EM spectrum. [5.78]Coming from Anteverse 42, I'm aware it may become too large to contain. [11.24]Dr. Feltman suggested releasing it to the Hydroplant reservoir. [15.4]I often struggle to know when that man is serious. [18.71]Anyone who would do that should not be allowed anywhere near this Facility or its erudite accomplishments.
Dialogue.2CD177434350D3F66EC50DB979BA912E_52045D4: It'd take more than a few quakes to shut the surface tunnel down.
Dialogue.649123B041C7B600AF26C3A50B59775A_EF8738C: It's Arctic, or is it just me?
Dialogue.D5DB8F294486397A89EEBCB1A5035329_F5807AE: It's Manse. <catching his breath> [1.39]My prediction has come to pass. [3.58]The Order have pierced our defenses. [5.94]At several points, if the chaos erupting around me is any indication. [10.10]They come seeking anomalies, immurement subjects... and to end our perforation research. [16.10]They're rifling through Ordo Storage as we speak. [18.79]Treasure hunters with a savior complex. [21.7]I fear they will only be content when this place is reduced to ash. [25.7]We failed to close the perforation above us, and have no choice but to abandon the site. [30.3]I leave it to the Gatekeepers, who have been given full authority to contain... [35.15]and I hope, preserve. May the fates pity all who remain.
Dialogue.09EE41374950DA67B991E9841D7BDFEB_98535A7: It's a bit of a long shot, but some researchers were conducting experiments in their spare time, with very little oversight.[9.4]I should know.[11.0]If there's anywhere we might find useful equipment, it's Wakeman's dormitory in Residences,[17.8]but unless we can fix Manse's device, that storm remains a bit of a nemesis, I'd say.
Dialogue.C7A901B0431C6D7198CAF89FB63E8217_28A5EA9: It's a bit of a long story.
Dialogue.8B73A9014CD1B39C57B20392BD8D04AE_84DFBE1: It's a terrible plan, but no-one cares what I think. Least of all a rogue I.S.
Dialogue.550DCBFF4CAC379113D3FDA379F529D6_28A5EA9: It's actually rather lovely here, in a way ... [3.86]A dark, sinister, occult kind of way ... but a way all the same.
Dialogue.3EDBEED4454A88DBF2B933B67191CD2B_28A5EA9: It's all older perforation technology down here. Tremendously energy hungry, as I'm sure you're aware. [7]I can't possibly imagine what they would need FOUR nuclear reactors to power. [11.95]Maybe we can get away with just the one for now.
Dialogue.C35D668F4FFCEFFB47B61F8CCA0F66F6_5D63EF4: It's almost like they knew our system's weakness ...
Dialogue.AABF823B4B96921DBC5B14B6B34DEA1B_28A5EA9: It's always so exciting, reaching a new world.[3.68]The kind of thing that only happens maybe 2 or 3 hundred times in a lifetime.[9]I never get tired of the feeling.
Dialogue.3D31A764499B7E2B0582E5B0E6525CD5_28A5EA9: It's been a long road, but I truly think we're nearly there. I've grown accustomed to our friendship.
Dialogue.B4C455DE4DF23B4B444D52B55E9F9252_9D66FB2: It's been real, it has. Really real. No more realer time than this. [4.75]Except if the bulk universe is true and the past and future equally exist, then these are all just platitudes.
Dialogue.5E7AF59449F39A52C7730580B42896BD_98DBDC4: It's dangerous,[1.6]Stewart never pretended it wasn't, but ...[5.7]if you leave me here ...[7.6]my chances are zero ...
Dialogue.E161AC0E48328714E917E4B0D248923C_9D66FB2: It's fine. Everything is fine. This is fine. I'm fine. We're all fine.
Dialogue.E2ECBA9D4856DB0C4A980B9F43969089_EF8738C: It's hard not to feel slightly responsible for this, don't you agree?
Dialogue.C85760304E48611BA201DCA33590B3A2_4AE005C: It's how the Dam systems talk to the facility's network.[6.17]It's on top of the Hydropump building. [9.5]It's got a big H on the side, you'll know it when you see it. [14.5]But something's messing with the signal ... interfering with it ...[18.3]radiation maybe?
Dialogue.0E2804894D6733C9520FFF89032D701F_09B430A: It's just walls, tiles and some weird drinks machine that nobody except you ever uses. [7.5]But I know what you mean.
Dialogue.B48BE8AD42485454B398EFBA0F4C271B_09B430A: It's like standing on Olympus Mons.
Dialogue.839C4EF9446811AAEDCC209EA7605AAF_F609D41: It's not so bad here, for now.
Dialogue.46571C5D4FB9FB25270949BE12CE95AB_5D63EF4: It's not the worst idea I've ever had, but ... um ... here we are.
Dialogue.A786618C4F732CF67B8C5EAF8FB43A3B_587DB37: It's safe, you can come up!
Dialogue.A4F43807499C7BA9945D7993A22AA103_EF8738C: It's worrying, but also fascinating, don't you think?
Dialogue.AAB6767444AE83C53AC6339941249B85_3FC2161: It’s not my fault!  I work on power cells! Not portals! [4]They take them into Silo 3 and I never see them again!
Dialogue.24E603044211C38DE82D869E3249AEFC_98535A7: Janet got us back into Labs, and we had a plan ... [4]although it didn't quite work out. [7.8]Now, we've got a NEW plan ... [11.0]But first, we need to get into the Containment Block and access our equipment ...
Dialogue.4ECB74FA43213E275F22E98146909A36_98535A7: Janet! I've got it![1.6]What if we opened the spillway[3.08]and rode it down like a waterslide to Reactors!
Dialogue.AB07CAE94CC5E0C9992E979BF757A417_98535A7: Janet, I have a bad feeling.
Dialogue.7AB456F049362D169E55058851A70778_98535A7: Janet, I think we're nearly there!
Dialogue.31C3151B464FFB217A3EC0B217F0C187_98535A7: Janet, do you think this was wise?
Dialogue.EB844CEE4576A3A5532F8D85D3EF8031_98535A7: Janet, we've been through ... quite a few portals now ... and I was thinking ... [6.5]how do we know, like, really know with absolute certainty, that this is the same world we left from?
Dialogue.F11B5585446273D89867A8BE71785FDD_98535A7: Janet, you know, I don't think this is the way out of here.
Dialogue.C64B7E4E4A28E10985FB2B9D7E1B1B62_78497A6: Je fais partie de l'équipe scientifique!
Dialogue.C203817A462ECC1366E4D884E2B1029C_78497A6: Je pensais qu’on était en sécurité ici,[2.1]mais à te regarder, apparemment pas.
Dialogue.387EABBB4AF2C5111E72B5AE24437EC3_78497A6: Je peux pas revenir en arrière,[2.0]qu’est-ce que je suis censé faire?
Dialogue.96B40AE044EF3D57C0D7229B5E0AFA9D_78497A6: Je suis passé par le portail depuis Voussoir.[2.6]Les soldats n’étaient pas ceux qu’ils semblaient être.[5.0]Ils tuaient tout le monde.[6.6]Je me suis échappé de justesse.
Dialogue.E08D21FF4C6B88F21CA6A1B115DD85F7_09B430A: Just breathe, Abe, we'll get through this just fine.
Dialogue.8A355B894AF97110BB74099FF063BFAE_96C2A83: Just chuck it on your head, and I'll let you through.
Dialogue.9A65FCCB4F5F9898811285A7D7FD0AF3_58FA765: Just don't go asking for no hot air balloon.
Dialogue.E7B016CD4005F9BC2F8D4998BD00A011_EE2A79A: Just keep your head down, okay?  [1.8]The only reason I haven't been barbequed by these maniacs is I blended in ...  [6.8]Good luck with that.
Dialogue.1DC100BA4C3C5356FED9B48F3FB99987_09B430A: Just to be clear, you found an experimental power cell in some dead guy's bedroom, [6.0]used it to make a flamethrower, then used that to burn through the hyper-frozen residue of an interdimensional portal storm, [13.7]and now you want to chase down some psychotic mercenaries through a fairly severe fracture in the cosmos and take their toys away?
Dialogue.476BF7EF4CF284B03AE0F0ACFB20BB95_84DFBE1: Just when I thought today couldn't get any worse.
Dialogue.3BD8C0CF4D4D37E2A8AC9D8E70D083C3_D5875C8: Keystone only cares about the Dark Lens. Everything else can burn. [5.3]If they've got the Lens, they can replace it - start again ... create a whole new mess.
Dialogue.3E93F33541E910A5776B25866B814EAB_B10FECB: Keystone want this hushed up, of course they do[3.7]They didn't even try to help, just sent their attack dogs in and wiped their hands.[8.98]Which gives us a free hand, I believe.[12.20]Because we owe them nothing. [15.4]Well, except our jobs, I suppose - but a lot of good that does us now.[21.3]I don't see myself ringing up accounting, which I imagine is floating somewhere over ... there.
Dialogue.E3318DE84C21D87556ECD2BF60B5196F_08113E4: Kinetics were running a perforation experiment, I know it. [5]Dr Verenkov is too impatient, and look what's happened.
Dialogue.00D848364569310F29FBD88F9B2CBEC5_09B430A: Leave 'belief' to the Order, Abe. [2.5]Gatekeepers use whatever works. [5.5]You remember that silver stake 'alloy' incident? [9.0]Or when Da'at came to us to get his Wolfsbane fractionated? [12.9]That's just how they do things.
Dialogue.900DA0EA43A6A0F2FA79A9A2DCEB912C_6D94EB0: Leave me to this vigil. ... We observe... A wake... for the world.
Dialogue.A7EFAE0D401A9EA5A126969475AB0553_B19337C: Let me know if you change your mind.
Dialogue.3065EEB0446B5CDE86EC2D91D040CED6_9D66FB2: Let me preface this by saying; I'm no biologist. [2.9]This radioactive waste all over the place, this stuff is perfectly safe, ah, normally ... [8.25]However, it looks like some of the A2 specimens may have interacted a little intensely with some of the nuclear byproduct. [15.1]And hey, I'm not trying to point fingers, I know they were just trying to help, [18.74]but if the Gatekeepers hadn't deactivated the fusion generator, I think a lot of this could have been avoided. [24.37]Again, I'm no expert. Well, I am, but with the ... radioactive stuff, not the ... um ... monstrosities from countless anteverses stuff.
Dialogue.FC137D36489361F7737021B9B061BF72_28A5EA9: Locked myself in here! Two PhDs but you'd never know it!
Dialogue.86E0B601463B65993D1917B5CF05B386_09CA50D: Look just talk to Frake okay?
Dialogue.8218F6DF40902D3863F968A5596E3631_18C7EC2: Look, I dunno what's going on. [3]They don't tell me squat on a good day, and this ISN'T a good day. [9.5]But if the big voice says get out, I'd do what she says.[14.7]Elevators are dead, so head for the main tunnel in Manufacturing, on Level 2.[20.6]There's maps over there. [23.7]But me, I'm stayin' right here.
Dialogue.BF706CC44A0E59809E75C3A69BA7F8D8_B10FECB: Look, as utterly awful as this is, it's hardly the only universe around here.
Dialogue.F90EBCE04340B9910750BEB02287C8E9_D73DE1F: Look, just find a way to let me in.
Dialogue.4DDF48B341EA0D49A4209E953952ECDF_52045D4: Look, this place ain't healthy. [3.0] I'm keeping an eye on it, because someone's got to, and Frake'd kill me if something went wrong. [10.0] Things are bad enough already. [12.7]But you, you need to head for the Surface Tunnel, up the roadway. [16.5]There's no reason to stick around here.
Dialogue.BD0AD77C41CE7D552EB4C0B7B6A6E501_58FA765: Look, we don't got a lot of time. [2.7]Radio's out, Frake's gone AWOL, and the place is crawling with gunned-up psycho cowboys. [10.9]They ain't shut me down yet, but folk like you need to be gettin' to the surface tunnel. [17.0]Roadway's locked up tight, so you needa find a way through the security doors up there ...  [22.5]Maybe you can hack through somehow - [25.3]they don't exactly leave the codes lyin' around, if you know what I mean. [31.0]If you need somethin', though, I can help - equipment, gear, whatever - [37.3]I can make it, if you got what I need.
Dialogue.CE52512541F2844E8D36F3A0D7D66137_9D66FB2: Looking to get that door open? [1.82]Sure, why not, I get it, but ... here's the thing: [5.32]Careful what you wish for. Just saying.
Dialogue.A7C097F949965CD794DA7B86AC96B209_9D66FB2: Looks like the Gatekeepers have got their hands full right now, so, ah, let's make that work for us, yeah? [5.86]Normally, they do good work - Synaptic Labs don't mess around - but they've gone a little off the grid this time. [11.97]I'm not saying you have to kill a few of them [14.23]but I'm also not saying that you don't not have to not kill any of them, either.
Dialogue.F544A67C487A2D6C32662DBAC6D1B990_587DB37: Looks like you had a similar idea, eh? Great minds. Sure.
Dialogue.A15F809F4F037F4BEC380698E9AB3E4A_D280DA7: Man, Sharon better pay me overtime for this.
Dialogue.9FF6D9994EB784F82563A4A93BC645C4_F29F31E: Man, it's been a lonnnng few days. Oh well, we'll figure it out.
Dialogue.5AA5ADC34371D5F814CA45806239832C_F5807AE: Manse reporting - emergency protocols in effect. [3.1]Since these invaders disturbed the Dark Lens, the entire system has destabilized. [7.42]A perforation has opened in the cavern above Residences, drawing every ounce of energy from the air around it. [12.95]We are attempting to close it, otherwise - in a few hours - [16.46]transluminal shedding will turn this place Arctic - or worse ... [20.7]I will report again, once we are successful.
Dialogue.9F2C998A42AF836784434B8AD5EB0D76_98535A7: Manufacturing? It's huge. We'll never make it. [4.8]I'm 83% sure we're doomed.
Dialogue.7036A6424E735956F528EA8BE9905396_F29F31E: Maybe later. You know where to find me.
Dialogue.06BA8E9B47A5C6346E7B3E80F1DB9753_1E8E4DD: Maybe the Blacksmith knows what happened to Frake and her team ... [3.5]Last I heard, there were down in the mines ... then the radio died ... and ... all this started ...
Dialogue.C751E1994ACB6A3054E24E9505AF894B_D5875C8: Maybe we deserve this. Well not me, specifically. I'm a victim here! You? Not sure about you.
Dialogue.C552204C47669230D1FB719E10E88099_96C2A83: Morning. Lift's down there. [2.5]But first, you need a hardhat. [5.3]Health and safety and stuff. [7.4]Grab that one, and chuck it on.
Dialogue.F1554D9F48A225DB3AAD318AC9BD9C70_58FA765:
Most of what I need's round here somewhere, but you might needa go a little ... further ... afield. [7.1]There's places that ain't on the map, if you know what I mean ... [11.7]So look around the tram station, 'cause it's more than just a bus stop.
[16.8]Best'a luck.
Dialogue.7C5BD9E2413A95A18C5776BEF48D22D5_500EBB0: My bretheren relay word of Gatekeepers trapped in your pitiable cavern. [4.53]A bloody fate befell their vile facility, and now they must engage their dreaded Dark Lens to escape that grave. [11.64]If they succeed, there will be no opposing them. The floodgates to other realms will open and pour through our existence! [18.62]It cannot be permitted.
Dialogue.29790B1E4159D5410A7E658B7524E4DD_500EBB0: My bretheren removed the Dark Lens, to prevent yours from unleashing further chaos, [4.8]but the Gatekeepers - monstrosities, terrors, treacherous tormentors - have taken it from us. [11.5]The apostates retreated to the Residential region. [14.35]They seek to craft an egress, then abscond with its power for their own unmortal ends, their selfish ends, to the end of us all! [22.77]They believe we cannot endure the frozen aether that persists therein, but they are mistaken! [28.04]For WE have the disk! Do you fathom? [32.03]No matter, you will fathom soon enough.
Dialogue.5D623D904A6E0697D49B1F9CA3288B1D_500EBB0: My brethren hid the Sun Disk from a world unready for the knowledge that lay within. [4.24]Wisdom from another world aflame, a civilization within a star. [8.6]The time may come when we share its secrets, but for now, you, I, we need the power it grants, [14.64]to survive in the extremes which have infiltrated your forsaken Residence Sector.[20.48]Your path lies through the Great Library! Proceed, Promethean!
Dialogue.5ECF2D904F9B6A0471230D8E3A2643A9_F5807AE: My concerns about our experiments with temporal perforations are increasing. [5.03]Causality is even more fragile than we imagined. [8.51]Unless someone can assure me that they know what they are doing, [11.66]I may have to put GATE efforts in this direction on hiatus.
Dialogue.44396AEE4A698C6F5F9ECAA6F6723D09_28A5EA9: My friend! This is the most incredible day![3.87]Not what you were expecting, I know, but rather more significant, wouldn't you say?![9]You look a little shocked, but I'm sure it will pass.[9.01]What a DAY![11.3]I'd be remiss not to thank you for all your help.[15.4]You've really been an incredible asset - a little unwitting, yes; ignorant to the point of absurdity, perhaps; but we couldn't have done this without you!
Dialogue.DE4272D74E70B1513C1A408BCD0F10BD_6B614EA: My friend, this is no place for the careless. [4.0]I need to get to the Surface Tunnel, but the soldiers are waiting, I'm sure of it. [9.4]I heard screams from their camp, a slaughter, but they are not done for yet. [16.0]Somehow, they knew this chaos was coming - how?! [20.5]There are spies among us. [22.4]Must we become spies ourselves? [24.5]I must disable the security doors. [27.5]No system is perfect, there will be a weakness, I am certain. [30.0]I will not be left down here to die
Dialogue.E8683C0A417E69F587204E9E115C1BB6_500EBB0: My legates would anull me if I return, but I will find a way from this limbo. [4.9]Frake's fortress is not impregnable. [6.7]She knows the secrets of this sarcophagus, and she will be made to reveal them.
Dialogue.18E9AF46461B632E417F50AB487F35EB_28A5EA9: My master sends you this message of approval:[3.24]Een-ka ben deer, ka ben doss.[7.80]It's a little hard to translate, but roughly it means,[11.55]'Wherever in the universe you may find yourself, rejoice, for the only true home is the grave.'
Dialogue.C3C9188546344188D470BFB21921EEF0_EF8738C: My mouth tastes like the Sahara
Dialogue.CD7CF685400A151AF0390F90D90F7EE5_B7CAC62: My name's Siobhan ... Dr. Siobhan Houston. [8.0]I'm a materials chemist. [13.5]I remember ... Torii ... the transfer ... then ... what happened?
Dialogue.A975635B465F4F1B5AEA5FAF0C32BAF8_B493B93: My notes better be intact if I ever get to my office! [3.15]There's months of work on trans-temporal bosons in there, months!
Dialogue.DB126E814E00D23ADE0BCD8366CAD90E_F5807AE: My personal disinclination towards firearms in general leaves me largely underprepared to record anything of value surrounding Oh-Nine-Nine. [9.51]I am not what you might call "a gun nut." [12.58]I can tell you it's antique, I can go on about its material makeup, and even tell you how it functions on a chemical level. [21.03]The answer is: mundanely. [23.94]This shotgun shows no anomalous properties when held or fired, but it certainly did, at one point in time. [31.67]We've tried different personnel, brought it back to its place of origin, and tried several types of ammunition. [38.28]At present, it bruises your shoulder when you fire it. [42.48]Testing is... ongoing, for now.
Dialogue.415B29D84600393E0772A6A97B976B89_58FA765: Need me to make you something?
Dialogue.63BEAC8C474B2DC33D26CE868F7B98FE_1FF8065: Nice. You've got some athleticism in there, somewhere. [5]Now, real creatures might wriggle outta that one, [7.9]but that's not a real creature, so ... [10.6]Next step is ... special containment, isolation, wash hands, innoculate ... [17.3]You know what, just, just stomp on it.
Dialogue.3BC4CF3F408D4BA80DB2D0947F60390A_1E3C2DE: No penguins allowed by order of Bigogi, the biggest, coolest Lamogi! And this Royal Crown is mine! MINE!
Dialogue.954883DC49B09F5A0425A0B92F685A07_F29F31E: No problem. Just doin' my thing.
Dialogue.426A804D4DF19DC1787ACDB16AF7852C_09B430A: No-one said science was easy.[2.2]Or safe. Or even smart.[5.05]But ... we always learn ... something.
Dialogue.411F74A542A5046EE34102A89FB09349_9D66FB2: Normally, we, me, the Gatekeepers, we take care of this place, I swear. [4.84]We keep the old perf' gear running so they can use it for ... well ... [8.42]you wouldn't believe some of the things they bring through that portal - the one you're locked out of, you know. [13.68]Seriously, if I described them, you'd be like, 'Dr. Hill, you're drunk, what are you doing in charge of all these nuclear reactors?' you know.[21.04]Anyway, since Newman did her thing with the ol' Dark Lens, the transit down here's been all-GK, all-the-time. [28.57]They don't trust the Lens, and they've got their reasons, sure. [31.6]Personally, I gotta say, the safety measures on that thing are ... well, uh, I wrote a lotta e-mails about it.[37.66]It's worse than Synaptics! But don't get me wrong, the GKs did get a little carried away this time ...
Dialogue.B7554C674E9C534CA9D7DDB597B61EEC_18C7EC2: Not bad, if you like that sort of thing.
Dialogue.2835C7DF4E85B021DFCD49B00D0000DE_D280DA7: Not in the mood for tacos, eh.
Dialogue.F4528C534F721EB120ED7E958D7B09C3_28A5EA9: Not to pressure you, but if I sound hopeful, it's simply because your track record so far has been rather ... extraordinary.[8.38]I don't know what I would have done without you, friend.
Dialogue.A2861E1543E7B55F6AE63B82AF69FE01_F5807AE: Note on IS-102. [2.83]We have determined the bacterio-phage recovered by Lenora's team from Anteverse 16 is a form of symbiote, [9.88]used by local species to assist mating. [13.35]You could almost call it a 'love potion'. [16.35]Preliminary tests show the affects on mammalian biology are extremely traumatic. [21.94]I have suggested Dr. Tengku NOT include images in her first report, [26.68]if she wishes to continue her research.
Dialogue.D225B78A4BBE4169B8556F94F0F6D357_28A5EA9: Now that the guns are deactivated, we've got a clear run through the Containment Block. [5.0]But I hate to think about what else might be on the loose in there ...
Dialogue.A88366664D03C62C65E06DBF5FA30D27_C8E28C6: Nyth seeks nourishment but stays strong.
Dialogue.7534E96A4D1C890568033EAAAE1E158E_98535A7: Of course not, Janet ... Not unless we had no other choice ... You can trust me.
Dialogue.038B78B548171A8FF1893A8817569CE8_09B430A: Oh ... hi.[3.4]This looks bad.[9.4]You haven't seen Abe, have you?[9.41]I don't suppose you've seen Abe, have you?[14.5]I didn't think so.[17.30]One moment he's muttering about submarines, the next he's vanished.[24.0]I'm fairly confident he wouldn't just abandon me, but I haven't heard a word from him, and ... well ...[33.4]I suppose it could be worse, I'm just struggling to imagine how.[39.0]Oh, Thule made it here? AND the shapeshifter? [43.0]Well, there you go, it's the worst it possibly could be.[48.0](Sigh)[51.0]I wish Abe were here.
Dialogue.3C662139439AB57BF392AD998F5C2040_F2E10BE: Oh dear, I don't feel right at all.
Dialogue.EBEEA19E42B7F5E84277EE95EC80C76A_F2E10BE: Oh dear, I don't feel right at all.
Dialogue.BCD227734CAC0DB2CED5478D0B8A7A9B_F2E10BE: Oh dear, I really must use the bathroom.
Dialogue.349DAC8E42491C96EAE7869464B74F6F_AF4702B: Oh hey! I'm over here, in the crane! [3]Glass is bulletproof, but these guys don't know the meaning of 'give up'! [7.2]I keep hearing 'em talking some kinda code, sounds like. [9.8]Whatever, I figure the best thing I can do is distract 'em, so they don't notice poor suckers like you. [15.8]I'm guessin' you're lookin' for a way out ... [18.0]but first thing those trigger-happy assholes did was lock down the crossroads. [23.0]You could push straight through, if you got the guts ... [26.8]Or you could get smart, and work your way round 'em - head for the garage ... [30.6]try'n touch base with the blacksmith - he ain't going anywhere. [34.5]I know what I'd do!
Dialogue.28ECB92E4D8041E8255698B46F664552_D280DA7: Oh man, what's happening? [4.6]I was just making tacos, next minute I'm over here and the pub's in space, [8.99]everything's freezing, there's portals everywhere and ... what the hell happened, man? [13.99]When I signed on, the manager said, well, she said stuff might get a bit weird sometimes, but that's okay, it's normal? [23.01]This look NORMAL to you? [25.82]But when you touched me, just then, what was that? [28.75]I don't feel cold any more ... How'd you do that? [32.4]Well, whatever, thanks man. [35.0]I'd ... offer you a taco, but ... you know ... it's ... in space ... and stuff.
Dialogue.492371BC485E9813585C30A89F34453A_08113E4: Oh my God. What happened to Jager? [3.9]He didn't deserve that. I mean, not really.
Dialogue.F09F77544F0C6F0B88A3C58DDB11B1B2_D73DE1F: Oh … you’re new. [3.0]Looks like that little … pest damaged the power system. [7.00]Can you get someone to fix it? But hurry, would you. [10.0]I’m not enjoying standing around out here. [13]It was hours last time. I don’t feel safe at all.
Dialogue.7A2ED4084BB27A6ED8A2B88220D94C6E_EF8738C: Oh, I can't wait much more.
Dialogue.9E52E9D14C1E4A6403D338BDBA58AF7B_EF8738C: Oh, I wish I had time to investigate this properly.
Dialogue.CAAC30784BFDF212298CAE83078741B6_09B430A: Oh, I'm sorry Abe,[1.45]I left my tap shoes in FLATHILL.[4.29]REMEMBER FLATHILL?
Dialogue.BC30E7CC499B8AE55C803A90E153FAE0_4D54ED2: Oh, don't mind me, I'm just taking a moment.
Dialogue.985916414C1CD58A65E4CB91C041204B_28A5EA9: Oh, he'll be glad when this is all over and done with! [3.23]All you have to do is activate the altar, and we're home free! [7.25]It was intended to activate when the sun aligned precisely with the telluric meridian[12.55]but thanks to the Sun Disk, you're the next best thing.
Dialogue.F1A2443E4D91460EE5C48DBC8223DBF8_F29F31E: Oh, hey there.[2.0]...[2.0]We need to help each other here, right?[5.3]Cause it's ... rough out there.[8.4]And we all have to eat, right?[12]If you wanted to ... trade something, maybe ... we could totally do that?
Dialogue.0A7004F844047DD21C1AEFA60FC4ACE3_1FF8065: Oh, ho ho, brutal. [2.3]Okay, so next uh - uh, what's going on with your leg there? [6.4] Looks to me like you're bleeding. [8.2] Uhh, look, we'll call this training - basic first aid. [12.8] Find some cloth and make a bandage. [15] And uh, just keep this between us for now. [17.3]I'll buy you a beer in Residence later. [20.3] Sorry about that.
Dialogue.61224E684BCFCE3AE6B2269B0DFB97DB_84DFBE1:
Oh, it's you. [2.9]I came through the hole some maniac blasted in Manufacturing.
[9]Obviously, I was planning on getting through the Vacuum Chamber to the Surface Elevator. [15] But it's covered in some  muck. [18.30]Typical. [19.90]I suppose they'll have something to deal with that in the Containment Block, but the place is completely locked down. [28.0]Ugggghh, it never ends. [31.6]I really need a coffee.
Dialogue.2AE1B9FD4EB2A462904A3F92019ECE69_1FF8065: Oh, okay, I was just thinking I would grab like a plastic bag for you ... [3.5]You know what ... this... [4.7]This is why we do the jobs we do here at GATE. [8.6] Go ahead and throw your ... fantastic net on the dummy.
Dialogue.BCF63BCE46B6D4BB89EB35A38E05B013_9D66FB2: Oh, this baby? First of its kind. [2.9]A Flowing Liquid Lithium Plasma-Facing Component Torordial Tokomak reactor. [8.8]Developed in total secret. Took seven years, sixteen PhDs and one Anteverse you do not wanna visit. [15.9]I'm telling you, say 'no'. [18.6]And look, maybe Garrick planned it this way, maybe she didn't, but building a facility in a disused lithium mine? [24.6]Smaaart move. More Lithium 6 than you could shake a breeder at. [30.0]That's a joke. Don't shake anything here.
Dialogue.E6DE1E40418EDD3FE0A6A3972DB1CFC4_98535A7: Oh, you made it! Excellent! [2.94]I'm glad you're alright, so to speak. [6.87]This place does seem to have rather gone to the dogs.
Dialogue.23C74F504FABC7E3D230BD88EC8EA6EC_0508B95: Oh... I didn't see you there.
Dialogue.288827DE432848F54CD86394F9DDFE42_F2E10BE: Ohh... When did I last sleep?
Dialogue.A545943348CE38DB96F5BE8CBEF437E6_9D66FB2: Okay man if you keep talking to me I'm gonna start telling you about orphaned sources ... ah ... They're liked abandoned babies ... but worse ... and more dangerous.
Dialogue.63D300F44DBFE591E0E420BF2C375CC6_9D66FB2: Okay, amazing. [1.47]All four reactors online and fusion ignited! ... I knew that you could do it, totally, zero doubts. [7.8]Now, I'm guessing you want in there, and sure, maybe the GKs have an exit, a portal to you-know-where, so I don't blame you. [15.03]But honestly, I wouldn't - um - whole mess of trouble, that one. I'd just stand back, enjoy a job well done. [22.01]And anyway, looks like something's gone slightly ... um ... south with the ... ah ... substation - you couldn't get into the control room to open the reactor up even if you wanted to. [32.65]It's just a minor short, nothing serious, happens all the time. [36.83]Uh, well, not under my watch, but unless you're a certified electrical engineer, I'd be focused on how you're gonna get this place back to normal. [44.26]I mean, aside from the ... ah ... war. [47.03]I'm thinking long-term here.
Dialogue.1FD871234FAFA3B7722398B837C850CB_9D66FB2: Okay, color me impressed - you fixed that electrical fault. [3.5]I mean I shouldn't be surprised, you've got a great attitude, real 'can do' person, I admire that, I do. [10.54]Seriously, if you're ever looking for a new role, we've got space down here. [14.27]Lot of open roles right now, actually.
Dialogue.3B0CBA0440CAD78FC1ABE4BB6D6BFF5F_09B430A: Okay, so the barriers between worlds, we just kissed them goodbye.[6.3]Which means two things. [8.6]One, we're screwed. [11.9]And two, Abe could be almost anywhere.
