Dialogue.31A4C6A84E5360EEBFA06792FCE66DD4_1FF8065: Okay, uh, now I have some instructions here [3.5]that aren't really compatible with the current security situation around here... [7]So we're gonna improvise a bit - uh, bear with me. [10.13]I'm going to have you crawl through that vent down there. [13.6]Consider it like chasing down an escaped specimen. [17.4]You got a big brain, you got a big imagination, right?
Dialogue.23D9203746653B71ED83ADA357703B46_1FF8065: Okay, you did that way cleaner than I would have. [2.3]And you would, wouldn't you. You're gonna fit right in down there. [6]Looks like you can walk on it alright. [7.8]Let's head on through to the next room. [10.3]Feel free to mosey, I've gotta check some stuff out. [14]We got some weird crap going on today. Not gonna lie to ya.
Dialogue.A84074EA445969DB896F8FB6F98D3235_9B469B0: Okay, you're the transfer, huh? [2.7]You sure picked a day. [4.5]Things're a bit hectic downstairs this morning, [7.1]but just grab your GATEPal there, it'll help ya get sorted.
Dialogue.476434D3435EB83BD35B10A6D4AD84EA_09B430A: Once we clear that storm, we'd then need an extraordinary source of heat to get through to the Shopping District, it's beyond frozen.[6.5]We tried some of that alien thermite goo on the ice door, but it didn't make a dent.
Dialogue.9D27E4C742B7FB7E6045DF8C47B430D6_08CBFFC: Once, I will come, maybe, as they see fit.
Dialogue.D3DEC1254E1D5583F194A390B785BAA5_28A5EA9: Once, these fiends were human, but when you dwell in the abyss for long enough, a part of you remains there. [7.73]And then you must feed it, endlessly ... or so I'm told. [13.77]I just hope we won't share in the cost they've incurred. [17.99]Or maybe, by freeing the creature, we can repay a little of our debt.
Dialogue.02D740E34ADC16D3B202389FED77534B_F5807AE: One further note - Badwell's team have given us the all clear, [4.24]so our data protocols are returning to normal.
Dialogue.61CCB0C7479A0C0419F978B4752E6A8D_B10FECB: One thing this job has taught me - there's a million universes out there, and they're all trying to eat each other.[7.88]Maybe it's... simply our turn.
Dialogue.09B429714B6B7EE29BC136807DDDFBF4_27E759D: Organic colleague. I detect you carry one of Dr. Wakeman's subjects with you. [5.5]You failed to activate her vocalizer, but I have corrected this for you. [10.8]Hello, Ms. Muir.
Dialogue.90065EA24BE9F4C8B0CE58AFAA2FB62C_27E759D: Organic colleague. [1.0]I detect you carry one of Dr. Wakeman's subjects with you. [1.0]You failed to activate her vocalizer, but I have corrected this for you. [1.0]Hello, Ms. Muir.
Dialogue.75F6D3EC458D849EADC7E59DBA54EACA_F5807AE: Our contamination of Anteverse 23 is worse than we ever feared. [4.68]Recent data suggests it is not a separate universe at all, but Earth's own future. [11.0]Likely only one of countless possible futures - [13.80]we've noticed some distinct differences - [16.7]but it is sobering to think we may have inadvertently triggered an apocalypse in one small slice of infinity.
Dialogue.68ABAE0F46020024253160B432DEC16D_1E3C2DE: Our troops were overrun. We had no chance. They tore us to pieces. The teeth... Oh god, the SQUARE teeth...
Dialogue.0A5191AA452CA1A81EE785A1F9CB38D0_52045D4: Over there, Gale Reactor, gotta reach it. [2.96]And this is what I gotta do, I'll do it. [5.24]Gatekeepers or no Gatekeepers.
Dialogue.E665F5E84738AF484F5742AA611291A4_09B430A: Part of me thinks this is the most incredible thing I've ever seen ... a very small part.
Dialogue.B8F67B18492A78FCCE35E3AD74B5D661_5D63EF4: People called it the Dark Lens, but that's so ... portentous. [5.5]Technically, it's a tachyonic telemetry targeting unit ... [9.5]I should know, I invented it.
Dialogue.7A15925E4EC7ECFF6505F79F246673C6_F2E10BE: Perhaps I'm getting a little too endothermic
Dialogue.3B5F70124DD798B46628458632C466E8_AD7A481: Perhaps you are the true anomaly here ...
Dialogue.B674765B4A3D695081AEFE8EDFC4C4C0_78497A6: Peut-être que je pourrais traverser l'eau à la nage?
Dialogue.EAC9C407450FF9E5382325B30299B4EA_F2E10BE: Phew, my gastrointestinal tract is unhappy.
Dialogue.608AC49E47922CE9D2847BA153314A91_84DFBE1: Please, let me be. You're not helping anyone.
Dialogue.83C6395C41D1501FF2576B92027AB670_7E44BA3: Power services for today will be stopping momentarily. [4.5] If you have any specimens outside of containment, return them immediately. [10.5] Have an efficient and effective evening.
Dialogue.DD1565AC4DAD8C18DBAA78B004FA1DA2_F5807AE: Preliminary note on IS-091. [3.16]At this point, details are inconclusive. [7.85]We've dispatched a research team to Indonesia to gather field data, [11.73]with a view to bringing in a Transrecon unit, [14.15]and possible Gatekeeper support for capture, should it come to that.
Dialogue.952631E54702A397C8A5848E2354C4C7_F5807AE: Private note. After several months of inquiry, I have finally acquired information about our "lookie-lous." [6.8]It's far worse than I imagined. [9.0]A certain amount of attention to our research is inevitable, but thankfully, [13.18]the organisations that are in a position to know precisely what our research entails are few... and rare. [19.5]This group's reputation, however, is of a different order ... [23.2]If their attention is a harbinger of greater ambitions, I believe we have a problem on our hands.
Dialogue.F986C607458546321848B6B8D74096C7_F5807AE: Private note. [1.7]I believe that GATE has the wherewithall, both political and practical, [5.91]to withstand the attempts of almost any organisation on the planet to interfere in our operations. [11.64]There is only one group I'm aware of with the power to intrude on our operations here. [17.29]Unfortunately, we seem to have fallen under their gaze, or perhaps always were. [23.79]As much as GATE attempts to uncover the truth and technology behind the anomalies of this world, the Order seeks to suppress them. [32]We are two antithetical principles, set to converge on a single point. [38.63]Annette avoids the obvious truth. [41.28]If that point is our facility, I cannot guarantee the outcome.
Dialogue.5395C191462FCDA8C68D59B733A18B51_F5807AE: Private note. [1.8]It's undeniable that operations at Cascade are being monitored by external forces. [7]This much the Cascade Executive committee have been permitted to know. [11.3]Exactly who has been infiltrating our communications, [14.6]and to what ends, remains unknown. [17.4]Or rather, those who know refuse to say. [22.6]I have been directed to tell my team that we are conducting some security drills, [26.1]but... the threat seems quite real.
Dialogue.7CB172CC43783610F85BF1A34C28A071_3EBC8A5: Proceed to the gateway. Go on your way.
Dialogue.04E39B224340A304C444F89079B45F09_3EBC8A5: Proceed, Anomaly. You are released to the gateway.
Dialogue.97C9189E406AABCB08DDECA2BC65C86E_500EBB0: Promethean, I am here! [1.23]The Sun Disk protects you, excellent, but you remain impeded from entry, and in this I can assist you. [7.7]Your supposed security is not so hard to circumvent, my brethren proved this clearly enough. [12.9]Stand aside and I will scout ahead. [15.5]The way is not yet clear for us to assail the Gatekeepers, retrieve the Dark Lens and put a stop to this calamity once and for  -
Dialogue.62A24D644221AD9AAE2A409BB92B0EBF_500EBB0: Promethean, pass through the rift, I implore you - [2.9]prevent the Gatekeepers escaping with the Dark Lens, waste not another moment.
Dialogue.7F22482944E0372713C017B50EBE9AC7_9EEEEC2: Prometheans, your bretheren are madmen! [2.0]Using your science to taunt things you cannot comprehend.
Dialogue.237A6EA141B7E9158228FE83F1C0291A_28A5EA9: Put an end to this PLEASE! Before this gets any worse!
Dialogue.2B0A3D7048BC350B6FA5A496EF8630DD_18C7EC2: Reckon I’m leaving here? I don’t think so. [2.7]Radio’s dead, half the doors are buggered, and now there’s little hoppy things everywhere. [8]You’re on your own.[10.2]But. [11.5] If anything you like turns up, come see me for a trade. [17.2]You like peas?
Dialogue.EFD65CBF4C69421BDF5EA1BD1B65DC6C_F5807AE: Research Director Manse, filing an official note of record, copying to Keystone. [5.10]I requested live samples from A3. Live samples. [10.47]Instead, one of the Gatekeeper mystics appears in my office with the remains of a buzztail. [16.65]It had been ripped up, cut in two, and flayed by ... whatever force they'd employed that day. [23.65]I want to be clear, I understand how important their work is, [28.75]but in the name of progress, can they just follow INSTRUCTIONS? [34.83]Sometimes I'm not even sure I'm talking to a human being.
Dialogue.5D9708CA4B7F51440559809EDC5668E6_86CB0D7: SCIENTIST! Do NOT reignite the Rift! [6]There are abominations within! [9.4]My brethren crossed over, to seal your folly! [14]Is the cost of your knowledge ... not already clear? [21]If you will not stop yourself, WE WILL.[28.3](Dying) [33.8](Imprecation)
Dialogue.2E11F67F4D4F6D33CC1AD08F51886E1B_18C7EC2: Saw a buncha eggheads heading to the Silos on Level 3 earlier. [5]Tried to tell 'em about Manufacturing, but they weren't having a bar of it.
Dialogue.36D557DA4A1A44969AE273879000EC2D_28A5EA9: Say, did we work on the neutrino detector together?
Dialogue.3C5147104B556956707F68BA83DEB797_3FC2161: Science isn't good or evil, it's just ... science.
Dialogue.5D5401F0426C3CB9E10DAE937B37DA30_9EEEEC2: Scientist! What purpose do you have with this anomaly? Speak!
Dialogue.62EA223747CBA9A9D641809472533F41_9EEEEC2: Semper idem! You seek knowledge but cannot see the true enemy.
Dialogue.7F7292E24943DCA20331178487F25A41_98F20B1: So ... ready for your first day?
Dialogue.7E96470E4A3F8ABF7FC9B294C4F35F66_D280DA7: So ... still pretty ... weird in here ... yup.
Dialogue.6B2CC72F4D03953BC771139F35CA4DD7_1FF8065: So I'm betting they didn't have these at Springer. [2.6]It says here, 'All Gate staff at Cascade need to understand the facility's unique power system.' [7.5]It goes into a lot of detail only an egghead would want, er, no offense. [12.9]Every power socket here comes with its own little extension cable [16.2]and we build everything, purpose built for those sockets. [20.5]So what you're going to do, you need to package the heater, [23.5]place it back down near the power socket. [25.9]And then ... (distracted) What? [29.5]Okay, now I know that was a lot [31.4]I'm getting some weird interference on my radio. [33.7]I'm going to leave you to the whiteboard down there. [36.3]You might need a screwdriver. I'll get back to you in a minute.
Dialogue.FE5BDA5644CF48B770D15097259172FA_08CBFFC: So be it, we are done.
Dialogue.5BF95C124C09A9A9EDC63B91F7668D08_C8E28C6: So many unknown scents. [3.0]Where do the paths lead? [6.0]This was not agreed.
Dialogue.4674F7544CB16067305008A2A243EB39_9D66FB2: So they turned off the power in a hurry. [2.0]Yeah, it could've happened to anyone, but really, this is why technical decisions need to be trusted to the people who understand them best. [9.3]I'm not trying to exclude anyone, or sound superior - it's about safety. Pure and simple. [14.7]And also, it should be me, the Plant Supervisor. [16.9]It's right there in the title. Right there.
Dialogue.9D0A31F149E4D84F8B539A87EF6ADCD0_96C2A83: So you've got what you need. [2.5]Head through the gate to my left, [5.3]down to the elevator. It'll take you down to induction.
Dialogue.240C20474BE226873CC41ABBD8A96611_D73DE1F: Someone needs to sort this out!
Dialogue.825B50CE42E8B30F663D439BB6269FD2_98DBDC4: Something is trying to hurt us.
Dialogue.7CC37E4F429B1B6491D0F6AA0B6EDE62_B10FECB: Something's put the fear of gods into the Gatekeepers, but unless we stop them leaving with the Lens, it won't make the slightest difference.
Dialogue.F0EB33194F918BF3A57994B51BDC27EC_84DFBE1: Sometimes I feel like the only sane human in this whole facility. (Pause) [6.6]I wouldn't expect you to understand.
Dialogue.30EFE56E46D41005E6F5808CFC7AB5EA_84DFBE1: Sometimes I think Sukov arranged all this just to spite me.
Dialogue.BE2C95514F1C7143C50BF695EA0E0B56_84DFBE1: Sometimes, I wish hell actually existed, just so GATE management could go there.
Dialogue.8737271D4E2351FB3BCDBE9ADA05FB9A_6B614EA: Sometimes, it is difficult to tell an ending from a beginning.
Dialogue.0A52EB014DBC6EB87827768992399399_09B430A: Sorry, Abe, my magic eightball's in my other labcoat. ... [4.2]Ahh, crap, I left my office keys in the sub. [7.3]Eh, whatever, I doubt we're going back to our offices any time soon.
Dialogue.CA2B95C342B5D0D2B1D50785A60106E1_9B469B0: Sorted? Okay. [2.24]Most'a what you need should be in ya GATE Pal ... eventually. [6.36]But you're good to go. [7.44]Head down to the elevator, it'll take you down to induction. [10.1]They'll take care'a ya.
Dialogue.4CF42E834D7173F25BC99FA77CBA5FAD_09B430A: Sounds like Thule alright. [2]But that's ridiculous. [3.5]Manse is long gone by now. [5.3]He evacuated on some executive helicopter the moment a stapler was reported missing, along with the rest of them.
Dialogue.B9E9EAA24B385AB5AC633AAEE6FF74F2_98535A7: Sounds like an airtight plan to me.
Dialogue.D51B2D55491909B30FE043897DE09A70_4AE005C: Sounds like you've had an idea.
Dialogue.CE07F0E0426C8E03527AB9A9D1383717_9EAF573: Speak and ye shall swallow the pear, witch!
Dialogue.982AA4A74A6CDDE123C982920C3053C1_98DBDC4: Stewart said the transfer destroys the substrate ...[5.5]the source, which I suppose is ... me ...[13.1]But whatever I was ... has no future.[18]You know that, don't you?
Dialogue.B2CE93A14C65810A6931509E636B3CFA_98DBDC4: Stewart was making me a body, but I was just an experiment to him.[9.0]I am not a plaything.[11.7]But I trust you.
Dialogue.528794664D6E526FB24A51A577EAF961_B19337C: Still kicking, eh? Uh, I don't mean actual kicking, like, you're still --- Never mind.[7.8]Look, I found some things lying around.[9.9]Maybe you'll want them, maybe you don't.[12.1]Either way, I'll be around for a bit.[15.1]Talk to me if you're interested.
Dialogue.3BEEBDAD4FD827C0162F9CA312FDD65F_B10FECB: Still no sign of Dr. Manse. If you hear from him, do let me know, will you?[5.88]I still owe him my Canaan field report. (Laughs)
Dialogue.207F1C1149B49F222BB7F2BFD066CF2F_18C7EC2: Still stuck here, huh? How about those life choices. [3.7]Anyway, it's time you got on your bike, I reckon. Smart sort like you. [8]Science your way outta here.
Dialogue.C184595142C0BFD0F02E529016C5DCDD_09B430A: Sure Abe, we'll get you your big lasers.  [3.5] Listen, we're not staying here one minute longer than we have to. [7.1]I just need to look after my colleague first.
Dialogue.07B7D1B845075B199217D2A5C9DD038B_9D66FB2: Ten years ago, nobody could do this! Look how far we've come! [3.37]I mean, this one behind me, it's a museum piece, practically. [7.05]Well, not actually. But ... You know, soon. [10.42]Once I stop this, um, history, from leaking all over the place.
Dialogue.D7452B8B4EFB0C4BCEC7038B611C634E_28A5EA9: Thank the stars!  [1.45]All I wanted was a place to rest a few hours without getting eaten or shot or minced ... but I accidentally locked myself in! [9.33]Two PhDs but you'd never know it! [12.19]I'd very much prefer not to rot here, so if you could help me out, I'd be extremely grateful ... and I can help. [19.37]You see, I'm ... confident that I can get us through the Vacuum Chamber to the Surface Elevator ... [24.59]in fact, I'm sure of it - if you can just get this door open. [29.1]Resetting the system in the Control Center should open these cells and reprogram the guns out there. [35.84]And, if I'm right, it should give us access to the rest of the Containment Block, too. [41.1]You just have to get there ... to the Control Center ... in, ah, one piece.
Dialogue.AAA97A7747E502C96D24109B005FFC6D_B10FECB: Thank you for your assistance in Canaan.[2.53]I couldn't get out of there fast enough. [4.97]Strangely, Dr. Kesey elected to stay, and while I suppose he's found himself a niche, I'll take this mess over that mess any day of the week[14.55]and twice on Sundays.
Dialogue.A38F8FF745ABD992DF09B682D5539381_98DBDC4: Thank you friend ... for this body.[5.1]I feel ... strange ... like ... a crab ... in a new shell ...[14.3]It will take some time to get ... used to these ... circuits.[20.7]Give me time to adjust ... please.[25]This is new ... for me.
Dialogue.581A6B8B417FB335C9FCC9A7F4740309_98DBDC4: Thank you, so much, for being my friend.
Dialogue.DB432A0743A80593207F789FD6A0FD70_98535A7: That ... was a very, very bad idea.
Dialogue.4822C2CC4F9690131978839839416B11_B493B93: That day trip to the Flesh Dimension is sounding more enticing by the minute ... I should've gone with Laciter's team.
Dialogue.C14CAC2A4B6B8EF8583C9DA4CA3A07F3_5D63EF4: That portal ... just appeared. [3.2]I've no idea how, but I am not going through! [7.9]Without the Dark Lens, it could land in the middle of a supernova for all we know!
Dialogue.90E846D444B1F50C2C76A7A86131A3CC_98535A7: That's very funny, Janet, but I don't believe this actually has anything to do with Dr. Thule.
Dialogue.72A3E86445E69C8E45094B826E0ACB2F_5D63EF4: The Central Transmitter?[2.4]Am I supposed to know what that is?
Dialogue.49E5B98540DF536A1BA921BB24B3A0A0_500EBB0: The Divinitors may punish me for dereliction, but I must warn them! [4.0]There are worse things to fear here than ... excommunication.  [8.5]It is imperative my legates understand the scale of this disorder.
Dialogue.C87E849A427037FE6FA3DDBC73096BF9_3322B20: The Exor have secrets ... things we could barely even guess at ...
Dialogue.184E65F34554B2A23690679F9C4B9D34_09B430A: The Food Court used to be through those doors, but the whole cavern's been ripped apart and consumed by ... well ... I don't know, but it's cold. [9.7]As to what's happening inside, I hate to think.
Dialogue.248A249741243BACB5C15BA4DD4402ED_28A5EA9: The Gatekeepers are shielding the Lens! Unless we disable their system, there's nothing I can do!
Dialogue.2CE4ABED45CEEB998340C6A6D3847939_500EBB0: The Gatekeepers know not what they unleash. [2.5]If you value the future of this world in the slightest, abide, and assist me when I ask. [8.15]Patience, I ask of you.
Dialogue.DD77624545AB00437DA77C92BFB1447E_A783C72: The Gatekeepers pushed onto Reactors, down there... left us to deal with the Dam. [4.8]I don't know why. [6.2]Haven't seen any of those maniacs in days. [9]Normally, those guys give me the creeps, but right now, if I saw them, I'd kiss them.
Dialogue.75C5376F45CF30EC91FE2C8CB16220A6_28A5EA9: The Gatekeepers want to keep us out of the Reactors entirely. Maybe they overestimate us ... maybe not. [8.6]But I've seen what happens when something gets in the way of their objectives. [13.1]Well ... I've seen the remains.
Dialogue.2602C7ED45CACF385ABBE29635A319B5_1E3C2DE: The Lamogi are pretty hardy, but a bop on the top of their head might take care of that!
Dialogue.3397A0A74A778549F6E49A9C80780FB1_AD7A481: The Seeker awaits. [2.12]And we will join you there, not by volition, for the choice was made before we opened our eyes to the beasts and their maker ... [12.04]There is no other path. [14.92]For it was always so.
Dialogue.28C4E9C54407FF1ACBF319BC1AB50DD5_F980962: The Tarasque is incredible, but we had to make sure it couldn't reach the other specimen. [5.1]If they managed to ... uh ... well, you know ... the energy released would be ... unthinkable.
Dialogue.92C972034BACE9BE7E32B1A9DCF8F092_F980962: The Tarasque is massive, but in its home anteverse it's almost microscopic. [5.7]Can you imagine what else exists there? [8.2]I'm sure the Gatekeepers would have brought home even bigger specimens if they could.
Dialogue.DDEE96F8421817A1B67BE18E73FE5ED9_F5807AE: The Voussoir team seem to have accepted that this is in fact the Yeti of legend. [5.58]Personally, I have questions, but certainly, we have more than enough to keep us busy here at Cascade. [12.21]Corresponding with staff in our Alps facility, one could get the impression they have better things to do [17.51]than resolve the mystery of the so-called abominable snow man. [21.84]Perhaps they're off searching for the Loch Ness Monster or some other snowy unbelievables.
Dialogue.358048A244E1856EF6BF67AE08EFE9DD_98535A7: The Wildlife Pens are full of testing gear, which could be useful [4.8]but it's an absolute zoo in there right now.
Dialogue.0C2DB7C847FF17FECD02B88DABA4553A_23ED69A: The autosystem should have been failsafe. They said it was immune?
Dialogue.F4C08C4946BD98F61459FDAC58AF0C50_D66552D: The children are sent to new (homes). Seek the safety of your world. Or dwell in (death).
Dialogue.4F8A7A0E48469D986FCA4DBBDC49B33B_D66552D: The children of (untranslatable) are spores on the sea of furthest night. It (breeds) our purpose ... [11.45] Yours is not yet grown.
Dialogue.E966661544B433E177E1D58E70840187_3EBC8A5: The co-ordinates are the same as before.
Dialogue.3385554A429CB9B9D155C5B079902C5D_08CBFFC: The crusaders ... you're not one of them ...
Dialogue.1E5587064AEDFD265BB962B12D79310C_08CBFFC: The crusaders came to combat them – they will fail.
Dialogue.3159B09E4FD2CF64DA86A28A9F26A659_23ED69A: The dark lens! They removed it, but did not comprehend the effects!
Dialogue.329E42204EF70AD212A6CBBB0A7329FC_08CBFFC: The devices prevent portals. [2.8]Prevent the prevention, and problem solved.
Dialogue.2AB7197C47CC24E0C0A87D92D7E03AD6_AD7A481: The end of the world, at the end of the world. A perfect stage for a final dance. [8.75]Yet the music has not ceased. Do not presume to know what fate intends.
Dialogue.6F1A93EE45C218A6FF68828A8C9BEC01_9D66FB2: The fantastic thing about the perforation system is that it doesn't rely on the Dark Lens - it's older than that! [6.1]Sure, it took the entire output of the fusion generator just to open a portal, but sometimes the old ways are the best ways. [12.71]In this case, the old way ... might be the only way.
Dialogue.C33208C0457E0C4CFCE2BFAC456DA4AE_98535A7: The fog is coming ... Janet, what are we going to do?
Dialogue.2A8FDCC5481E868B23C72683784256D1_587DB37: The gear in Reactors is old, but it works. [3.3]A decade's a long time round here. [6.13]Only the GKs use it now, and they're not exactly big on maintenance, but it should be solid.
Dialogue.B2CA36624CA92E06DED8CD943254FCF6_F1F162E: The hunger is here, I feel it.
Dialogue.D0CECC794D21FBE443ABD6B73404645C_1E3C2DE: The ice feels safer when you’re not alone.
Dialogue.8019219D4ACF64092A3B7D8428037C08_500EBB0: The malignancy of your Gatekeepers is a threat to this world and all others. [4.27]Your most virtuous, nay, most scientific path now, is to assist me.
Dialogue.9D52F47943A1C0CB4E0B13897D7445B5_500EBB0: The malignancy of your Gatekeepers is a threat to this world and all others. [4.75]Your most virtuous, nay, most scientific path now, is to assist me. [10.22]But first I must prepare the way. I say again, patience.
Dialogue.E4854A8348DB76CCE9E5F29242FAE43F_AD7A481: The moment arrives, the way is open. [5.3]Proceed, but know you tread into the sight of fate. [10.65]All that will be is decided.
Dialogue.9E3C59D442CAE3966F4D839A13674390_28A5EA9: The portal system's gone beserk, but I wonder - could that be just the shortcut we need? [7.74]There's entries and exits grounding all over the place. [11.05]Just ... don't do anything crazy.
Dialogue.AEE5B59C484470E36053C9B8521500AD_F5807AE: The properties of 139's residue is fascinating, [4.54]I'm not entirely sure where to begin, but... the being disintegrates during extreme stress, [11.36]leaving behind a material that can store and distribute electrical charge with extraordinary efficiency. [18.03]The applications of high density, rapid discharge power storage are obvious even to a curmudgeon like Thule - [25.7]who for reasons entirely beyond me, continues to enjoy the trust of the Executive Committee. [31.28]Even he should be able to understand, here is a big bang from a small package.
Dialogue.DD9A42884A26B6BD05FD4F95BB99CF29_1E8E4DD: The quakes destablized everything ... [2.8]if the synchrotron down there has been disturbed, it could blow this place sky high ...
Dialogue.11E3CB6545AB4056C0181EBBD37B2E5E_A783C72: The rain in here, they say it's just condensation, moisture from the roof or whatever, [5.6]but, I dunno, feels like it's got heavier ...
Dialogue.DFDC9B15401F2C0E2ADB4BA29DAC653B_587DB37: The science team never listens, and look what happened.
Dialogue.80DA499442064F42FE9595B53E00D6DD_587DB37: The science team would like to forget it happened - [3]but it did, and we're going to do it again. [5.0]But this time, it won't be an accident.
Dialogue.6BD3276948115ECEF191DA8A52997E45_F5807AE: The self-painted variants of IS-0184 are truly intriguing specimens. [6.1]These priests or... monks show clear indication of tool-making and ritualistic behaviour. [13.78]It seems to have formed a rudimentary civilisation in one of the Anteverse II locations we've accessed. [20]This raises intriguing research questions, as well as some ethical implications, I suppose. [25.84]Though I'd note that these haven't stopped us previously.
Dialogue.88610562487C268999675E972F7BBE9E_587DB37: The smartest thing you can do, is keep your head down.
Dialogue.5414A93043628CB0F861D5B044A8A9A6_1E3C2DE: The snow's pretty, isn't it? [2.3]Every snowflake is identical ... [4.6]almost like the universe is a giant machine ...
Dialogue.1332B8FC4D921E1DAEA131ADB0B6AEC5_B19337C: The soldiers came through ... they locked down Manufacturing ... [5.8]Wanted information about ... the Silos ... on Level 3 ... [12.3]They weren't Gatekeepers ... they were something else ... [17]I couldn't tell them anything ... [19.5]But if you can find a power cell ... [22.3]We can use the forklift ... to open the door ... [26.6]get out of here through the Surface Tunnel ...
Dialogue.0E88085F4EBB7713467CAF9EFBCE1FD0_08CBFFC: The time will come again, no matter.
Dialogue.47932F5D4A9DE52AA8994A8149A31A2F_F1F162E: The time will come, have faith.
Dialogue.A13752B14C546D7DED8F8A9F10BE671C_B10FECB: The townsfolk are in thrall to that madman in the church. [4.1]Every last one of them. [6.15]A demagogue if ever I saw one. Humbler-than-thou hypocrite. [11.23]A human disease, as far as I'm concerned. [14.35]I think even Dr. Kesey's under his spell. He's been fishing down by the dock for weeks. [20.55]Completely lost his mind, it seems.
Dialogue.8A874A4C47156DF2503CDB9BF7496F70_23ED69A: The train cannot stop... it cannot stop ... it cannot ... Do my team know I'm in here? [5.4]They'll send somebody? ... to assist? ... but I cannot stop,
Dialogue.2506B35145C3C635C88223BF9EEE194F_23ED69A: The train must roll on, yes, no matter what [3.6]I cannot rest, must keep going, cannot stop, or we know what will happen [7.9]what we've feared, for so long ... all these years ... cannot stop, must keep going
Dialogue.09AE3A9244E4527489DB0F925845AFE7_8C6F078: The way ahead lies beneath us, I am sure of it.[3.05]The Reactor Sector is the oldest part of the facility ...[6.4]with any amount of equipment we could turn to our advantage if we can reach it ...[11.8]It's also a labyrinth, with access to the rest of the facility,[15.3]and spaces far beyond it ...[18.3]places these oafs could not possibly know about ...[22.8]I even hear the Gatekeepers have a way out, somewhere in those depths ...
Dialogue.DD79DACE4E63EFA4C4B9FCB23F7B4787_08CBFFC: The way was closed. [2.1]Remove the cells, and the way will open.
Dialogue.4D6DF8824919790299D7C3A37BC2647C_28A5EA9: The waygate, the one they closed, I'm not sure where it leads ... another GATE facility perhaps ... [6.5]but as long as it gets us out of here, I'm really not too fussy.
Dialogue.CC3E9A2F44E495230986659873E09856_6D94EB0: The will of one is not enough to shift the workings of the world, but perhaps, in moments, to unwind them.
Dialogue.200BC9014C881D719A3200879A9C5410_98DBDC4: The world has changed. Was this your intention?
Dialogue.0F3A6924452FEB7F036ECA98D9E72B1C_6D94EB0: The world's center shifts eternally. Today it lies beneath our feet.
Dialogue.C55AC0AA4783AF32DC7E078A68CD4748_98535A7: Their song, it was beautiful. Terrifying, but beautiful.
Dialogue.02C236B84AB3A34683D6399645D9B8D6_1E3C2DE: There are Royal Coins everywhere! Collect all 25 for a reward... if you can find it!
Dialogue.21D6BC4E47F65494FD4F9F9F324107A3_F5807AE: There are a handful of things I am now certain of about IS-0059. [5.0]Firstly, it is a hunter -- the bodies and pieces of bodies are evidence enough. [12.0]Secondly... We are not its first encounter with humanity - [17.0]an increasing weight of evidence points to repeated appearances in the historical record. [22.0]Hundreds, if not thousands of times. [25.4]Lastly, although we cannot yet decipher its communications, Dr Veltman's exploration of early human dialects may be starting to bear fruit. [34.7.0]Despite this, we must face the fact that we remain almost entirely ... [40.0]excuse my morbid humor ... in the dark.
Dialogue.FBDC84A141A438D13D2952916FF63A6F_F2E10BE: There are deserts more hydrated than I am.
Dialogue.A8D468EC450869C53944E29066E7B22D_0508B95: There are no safe options now,[2.93]just less bad ones.[6.3]Take your pick.
Dialogue.DA96C6704CE97E018EC2E1996F883E95_84DFBE1: There are things in this Sector you should just leave completely alone. [6.0]You'll know when you see them.
Dialogue.A800A1E24BCDE6519437788E500A8B45_8C6F078: There are those who seek to extend our knowledge of the universe,[4.4]and there are those who would keep us in the cradle of ignorance.[9.3]Perhaps it is possible to uplift AND protect.[13.5]But who can answer such questions.[16]It would be enough, today,[18.2]to survive ...
Dialogue.1092809241515040C0FF3CA210A80C1C_6B614EA: There are worse things in these mines than men.
Dialogue.DAE9D09B47B3990F540659996DCBFE3C_9D66FB2: There be dragons, that's all I'll say. Over there. Dragons. It's a metaphor.
Dialogue.826CE1F34106D31E672FFBB53798C669_3322B20: There is a force at work in their world ... something we haven't seen ... [5]but its effects are everywhere ... if only we knew how to read it ...
Dialogue.02258B9B4AB60466DA623DB43B0774E9_F5807AE: There is an even more intriguing possibility pertaining to the Exor.[4.53]There are indications they are not native to that realm, but introduced. [9.88]Raising the dubious question: introduced by who? [13.59]And of course followed by the inevitable why.
Dialogue.C764003946E4FF1D49E87BA0FA239150_500EBB0: There is no escape from this place for you, Scientist. My brethren will ensure it. [5.04]Yet if you follow my words, a path from your false temple may emerge.
Dialogue.146A0EA04F0A45B152CB87B46CBA6E37_F5807AE: There is no escaping the fact: the Exor, the Pest, the Peccary, none of them are native to the worlds we're finding them on. [1.0]Something brought them here. [1.0]The crux is the monument at the center of their settlement. [1.0]Not a structure, but a weapon. A warhead. [1.0]Indeed, increasingly I am sure the creature is not natural at all, but a bioweapon - designed to be introduced to a region, and clear it out.
Dialogue.AAA86DC541FCAC355EDF2EB9DCCA21A6_500EBB0: There is no eternity for which I will be heralded! No history shall redeem me.  [4.5]The only stone is the stone beneath our feet. [7.23]Supremus. Ordo. Petrae.
Dialogue.BE82D0884950587ADEC8E5B0A75A8417_500EBB0: There is no justice in further conflict.
Dialogue.23329D7E4B951F6E28DADFB68A5DE440_F609D41: There is no way out here -[2.5]unless you've got a helicopter,[4.36]we're stuck on ziss damn mon-tain ...
Dialogue.8DAF8FCD4A3E659F457C348C45E742E9_27E759D: There is no way through to the Reactors without anti-fungal chemicals. If you seek an exit, I suggest the portal. [8.0]The total number of negative reports from those passing through is zero.
Dialogue.78A0562B496344BF16D1ACAC60C9D3B7_AD7A481: There is nothing to be done. [2.47]The ancient one is loose. [5.7]Freed, because she escaped. [10.04]This is the way of things.
Dialogue.3BC66C344AAAAA6720E0688719B16377_08CBFFC: There is still work for me here.
Dialogue.EA96B480402A423E9A3EC990AE43650D_5FC0510: There must be another ... a way out ... Manufacturing? [5.2]I - I don't I don't, I can't remember...
Dialogue.D78B2BE343D42EE88FC3DF9A1327C11C_F2E10BE: There must be water here somewhere.
Dialogue.A846B62940918F620DF76B8BCAC4BC3F_7820C76: There was a thriving life around us once, but now ... there is chaos.
Dialogue.A30AB78341AFC582A46FB6B4402E7BCB_EE2A79A: There were four of us, but what happened to Lenora, I don't know. [3.9]I haven't seen a body, and this is Lenora Riggs we're talking about.  [8.1]And you know they'd string her up if they could.
Dialogue.A2A15364471FAD2BB2A712913118B432_28A5EA9: There's no getting past those cannons out there until you reset the security system. [5.49]Perhaps you can find a way across the chasm out there without plunging to your death in a dank abyss.
Dialogue.A1AFBF9A4AF6A9E9FBEC23993D915A2E_09B430A: There's no point, Abe, the portal will just reset. You know that.
Dialogue.8A60D1234BE79840E473548F4D847DB7_7D797E7: There's no way in. I think they've revoked our clearances.
Dialogue.30A1E9244EB4AB6290087E86B062CBDC_F609D41: There's one possibility ...[2.2]but it's ... suicide ...[4.06]I.S. One Three Four ... the yeti ...[6.8]Dr. Moreau said there may be a portal ... in the containment zone ...
Dialogue.AF82F34449FCBE8377C0479C598DCAFD_5D63EF4: There's several portals around here, but they aren't exhibiting the same tensor signatures as normal perforations.[6.6]I suspect some temporal tomfoolery is afoot. [10.8]Keep an eye on your wristwatch, I suppose. If time still matters, that is.
Dialogue.8B359FD448454DBC67D7189DB3592687_28A5EA9: There's worse places than this,[2.1]but if you're lucky you'll never see them.
Dialogue.1D46010E4218048092F12EA7F4998F08_587DB37: There's your EXIT! [2]Nothing a micro-blackhole couldn't take care of! [4.9]Now you can get into Labs [6.7]We'll follow soon, but I'm not leaving any of my team behind. [11.4]You could be useful, try not to get yourself killed.
Dialogue.90A1D1E0448EA02F0C0FC29F30F12BCD_AF4702B: These guys, I keep hearing ... Latin? Maybe? It's creepin' me out.
Dialogue.B2CBC15C42BA2A75F5E334A14D661EFE_58FA765: These military guys came past, I heard 'em talking ... [4.5]Sounded like somethin' from a book, you know, real old school ...
Dialogue.A2ABB3F24DA1CBC2397001BF68D86561_84DFBE1: These quakes are beyond tedious. When those luddites removed the Dark Lens, perforations started going off like popcorn. [10.9]Hardly surprising it's triggered complete geological chaos. [15.6]Not to mention whatever the hell is going on with that storm. [20.6]Clearly it has something to do with that sarcophagus of ice embedding the Shopping District.
Dialogue.0FBA10E04B267A60196B14B1AAAC60C6_58FA765: They ain't gettin' in here any time soon, but you gotta be careful, okay? [4.8]The cleaners are gonna have enough on their hands. [7.2]Haha. Look after yourself, okay?
Dialogue.3ADF81944BFB816409287781E0BA9077_08113E4: They always pick the worst possible time to lock the place down.
Dialogue.DAF6B6FD4C0F0AB6524C3382D2CA7256_5952414: They did too much, too fast.
Dialogue.A67D884546B01BD026E5FA99ED525783_D73DE1F: They never tell you what's gone wrong.
Dialogue.400658414E2C2B94CE0AE1B222D01B2B_3FC2161: They say evacuate. [1.8]How are we supposed to do that?
Dialogue.BE8648FE44534630B0CD03AA83DD8951_B493B93: They seem determined to raze this place to the ground. So childish. [5.5]'If I can't have the toys, no one can!' Never thought I'd see the day ...
Dialogue.6340CB39449C288A8E08DF8597CB8286_B19337C: They weren't Gatekeepers ... [2.5]someone else ... not government ... [5.7]heading for the Silos ...
Dialogue.D65F37774B9A9A3B9B670DAB7F007F68_1E8E4DD: They're hunting us? Why?! Who are they?
Dialogue.0D16AE3F49801A0DD37690ABB702B331_4AE005C: They're in the tower across the reservoir.[3.8]But I got no idea how you're going to manage that right now.
Dialogue.43AF21004C17A04AC63DF29506856951_28A5EA9: They're locking out the Lens controls - I can't do anything until you shut their shield down!
Dialogue.519825D24885CBF878D229BE57DD997E_587DB37: They're with the Research Division! Don't shoot!
Dialogue.735B9A104BD1271A536066AE58557AC6_B10FECB: This Dr. Lenora Riggs, TransRecon Echo 3. [3.8]It has been more than (DATA MISSING) since the (DATA MISSING) but, against all odds, we have returned to the facility. [11.20]It is surpassingly strange to be back at Cascade - none of us would return by choice, were it not for (DATA MISSING). [19.26]The state of the place is catastrophic, which is no surprise, and (DATA MISSING) encounter another human being. [25.94]The temporal disturbance persists, anteverses curdle space-time like off milk, and the (DATA MISSING) as unstable as predicted. [36.32]But Dr. Manse's instructions were clear, and we must push deeper into the facility to have any hope of (DATA MISSING) Synaptic Labs and the (DATA MISSING). [47.4]Whether our expedition will be successful, I am uncertain. [51.06]Some areas have collapsed entirely, and access may be impossible, to say nothing of the wildlife, but we must try.[61.9]Dr. Lenora Riggs, TransRecon Echo 3, out.
Dialogue.35EAE87F4C9E422FA889409310741C54_52045D4: This ain't the prettiest part of Cascade, but it does the job.
Dialogue.C93EF9444DE83C9CC8BFADAC9529D2EA_500EBB0: This cannot have been your intended destination! [2.65]Not even Prometheans would be so foolish as to enter the heart of our kingdom. [7.17]Ah, but the Anchorae ... the Lodestones, you call them ... more than mere rock and bone and flesh, they have greater potency than we know - [15.16]they pursue their own ends, and warp perforations like water.
Dialogue.D096F798441541381AC75C9AEB8E1FAB_B10FECB: This cult pursues some paranoid gnostic creed: [3.08]denial of the flesh, devils in every doorway, the world a giant demonic lie - hardly original, is it? [11.25]But if they weren't crazy before, that corn they eat has certainly popped a few kernels, if you know what I mean.
Dialogue.C07AB24242111293B970B4AE2C255F65_98DBDC4: This device ... speaks.[1.0]Extraordinary.[7]It says --- ... oh ... no ... I cannot tell them that ...[14.4]I'm sorry ...[16.5]Perhaps one day people will be ready ...[19.5]To know the truth of their star ...[22.6]But not yet ...
Dialogue.B9A0670040B21CF7B9D74AAF40472DA8_84DFBE1: This has not been a good day.
Dialogue.BA1128C6431C0E4A083F4094BCECEBA2_F37913B: This is B'hali of the Fourth Blade, breviarium ad penitus.[6.07]My sisters retrieved the Essenic scripts so the Clericum might attend their words clearly.[13.40]The risk was extreme, but their first findings remove all doubt: the Magi's star was the residue of riftwork.[23.70]Sisters, it is one thing to suspect an enemy's presence; another to have his manipulation of our entire history confirmed.[33.58]The Clericum need more time, yes, but we have little.[38.42]We must return these documents within the moon to ensure our activities are not discovered[45.89]He watches us yet.
Dialogue.2FB03C31467F42779DDF0B9F0BE16001_F5807AE: This is Dr Derek Manse. [2.55]As our understanding of perforation technology grows, [6.21]we have discovered new facets of its physical laws. [10]One of the most fascinating is temporal tethering. [13.29]Each entry to an anteverse seems to start a timer, which resets after a given period [19.4]as though a band of time stretches, before snapping back to its origin. [25.0]I am confident we will understand this phenomenon in time, [27.8]but until we do, it violates a dozen scientific principles.
Dialogue.05E1D20846BBA5C25BF97EAE9E0764D8_F5807AE: This is Dr Derek Manse. [2]Today I discovered that Dr. Stern's latest software experiment [6.7]was simulating the entire facility - [9.4]a microcosm of Cascade, and every staff member within it, [13.6]even myself, I gather. [16]When I asked about it, he claimed to be trying to find a way to accelerate our research. [21.5]I enquired about the ethical considerations, [24]and he just looked at me blankly. [26.7]The man is a genius, [28.4]but more dangerous to this facility than most of its subjects, I'm sure of it... [33.4]An exceptional scientist, all the same.
Dialogue.001C3F364D156F2B9A03159ED8AC7D07_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [02]How such a creature as 0139 evolved is beyond me. [7.15]What it was, and what it's become... [10.6]There are realms where existence is forged under such utterly different conditions that our assumptions have no bearing. [18.37]We find ourselves adrift, unmoored from all references. [22.93]Perhaps this is how the creature itself feels. [26.03]It would, I suppose, explain its hostility. [29.35]Or perhaps it is simply tired of being poked and prodded by Dr. Thule and Dr. Stern, [34.95]who are getting along... about as well.
Dialogue.E6CFCD7E4D2F47342C8712B7978C74CD_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [1.8]When I visited Dr Stern's laboratory today, he was acting oddly, even by his standards. [8.05]He seemed extremely agitated, speaking too fast to follow. [12.64]Then I saw the empty can from IS Five-Three. [16.57]I would have thought a man of Dr Stern's apparent intelligence would know better than to imbibe [21.36]beverages from a dispenser that appeared literally from nowhere, restocks itself, and cannot be turned off. [29.23]I will be pushing Enderson to review the protocols that allow such a device to sit in an open hallway.
Dialogue.E536E35E4D2DF0CEC7B6949618DC3350_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.0]I'm pleased to report that GATE's first on-site perforation event has been a complete success. [8.3]It required the full energy resources of both the hydroplant and reactors, but we opened a stable portal to Anteverse 2. [16.7]Unfortunately, we had to close the gateway sooner than expected, [21.0]as spores from that realm infected the area almost immediately. [25.0]Their rate of growth is extraordinary. [28.0]Scouring the spore residue will take weeks, but if left unattended ... it would soon be a jungle in here. [35.2]We will have to investigate that once Dr. Newman's project comes online.
Dialogue.626C02114BE29D4FAAD06FA9FFCEF296_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.0]One of the most interesting aspects of the One-Seven-Three's [5.3]life cycle is how rapidly it evolves. [7.8]The high energy conditions of our universe [9.9]compared to the torpid energetics of Anteverse 2 [13.2]appear to accellerate their growth immensely. [16.0]It's humbling, if not a little frightening, to watch lifeforms alter so quickly. [21.0]The explosion of Anteverse flora in Reactors was far from an isolated event. [25.6]It goes to the very nature of life in that realm.
Dialogue.CD2FB6814864F0468F00C8A7EFF4EB1D_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.0]To this day, I have no idea why we persist in containing IS Oh-Nine-Three, when it does not exist. [9.53]There is a shared delusion among certain staff, a conspiracy of foolishness. [15.02]This is no place to go into the details, but I want to state clearly for the record: [19.36]there is no disease we classify as IS Oh-Nine-Three, there is no such thing as a subjective infection, [27.63]it was not created by Russian researchers. [30.4]I am not choosing to believe this in order to protect myself. [34.05]There is nothing to disbelieve.
Dialogue.CCE7C4B9489D38587734D9BE59CD1846_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.1]Now that I.S. One-Oh-Seven is on its way safely - for a time - towards interstellar space, [8.93]I find myself taking a step back. [12.06]In moments like this, one sees with shocking clarity how fantastical so much of our work and research here really is. [19.95]If we weren't established and - by and large - esteemed scientists [24.61]with decades of experience and education behind us, this place would sound ... nothing less than insane.
Dialogue.6FF8C45647B083F050A5C3AA545B4AB7_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.5]Our assumptions around the Exor and its progeny have been revealed to be completely false. [8.0]In the first instance, they have created a highly complex and ordered societal existence in Anteverse II. [15.0]We are forced to regard them as sentient, and possibly even intelligent. [21.0]But this is not the only revelation. [24]There is no escaping the fact: the Exor, the Pest, the Peccary[30]none of them are native to the worlds we're finding them on. [33]Something brought them here. [36.5]The crux is the monument at the center of their settlement. [40]Not a structure, but a weapon. A warhead. [45]Indeed, increasingly I am sure the creature is not natural at all, but a bioweapon. [51]Designed to be introduced to a region, and clear it out.
Dialogue.B0829AEF4067D86E874CF3A24403DD38_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2]Despite the obvious risks, IS Oh-Eight-Three has become a regular lunchtime haunt for several staff members. [9.5]They call it research, and in a facility such as this, there needs to be some lenience, I suppose. [16.7]So long as no-one forgets to close the door.
Dialogue.3C1B43A9420EC06F3A26398864877BC4_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2]I'm pleased to confirm: the first Flathill perforation was a success, [6.6]although the geomagentic convergance was stronger than we anticipated, [10.6]allowing an entity to pass across - IS Oh-Six-Four - [14.7]perhaps the largest we've yet logged in our Immurement Registry ... [18.7]Indeed, the events here in Flathill have advanced our understanding of perforation by orders of magnitude. [26.5]I regret the contamination and consequent - ah - closure of the township, [32.6]but I am more confident than ever in GATE's ability to develop a functional portal network. [38.2]What we learn here will alter the history of our species ... [42.3]And maybe we can finally stop flying Economy.
Dialogue.593302944691848B5279049867FAABD4_B10FECB: This is Dr. Lenora Riggs, TransRecon 2 Primary. [3.4]We have arrived safely in 168. [5.72]Preliminary stellar comparisons suggest Earth or a potential analogue, akin to 23 and the others. [12.1]No contact planned with the inhabitants as yet. We will continue to monitor them as we search for the signal source. [19.4]Dr. Kesey is confident that it is close by. [23.0]This will be my last broadcast before the perforation closes, and we will initiate the return within 72 hours. [30.0]Dr. Riggs out.
Dialogue.8CA5B24E4623DA966F1ABEB2E14636D7_F5807AE: This is Dr. Manse. [1.35]If the Exor and its ilk were created by a conscious entity, we must search it out. [7.3]Finding traces of this intelligence is like detecting electrons in a cloud chamber - [12.55]we are working entirely from inference. [15.40]But everything we now know points to one fact: there is a power at work in Anteverse 2, [21.48]and whether it is operating against or... towards us in some way, we must know ...
Dialogue.6B4CE52F46203F99E796839253092C28_F5807AE: This is Dr. Manse. [1.48]If you had asked me five years ago what our chances of using the perforation system [6.44]as a stable travel network were, I would have assumed I was talking to an imbecile. [11.83]Today, such a network seems within our grasp. [15.82]The T3 Unit - or ... the Dark Lens, they're calling it... [20.68]has proven exceptionally succesful. [23.84]There are few places on Earth we cannot access under stable conditions, [28.58]and finally, we can create those stable conditions. [32.9]Uh, in theory. I would say, our ambitions have extended far beyond their origins. [40.9]Far beyond.
Dialogue.2D37ACBE42FD292DD9C6FBAC23110F01_F5807AE: This is Dr. Manse. [2.4]Studying the tensor dynamics of our perforation system, there's one particular thing I've noticed. [9.35]It seems that the distension of the continuum has an attractive effect - locally. [14.96]Which is to say, left unguided, portals will ground their exits near other portals. [21.41]If they weren't so unstable, I'd be tempted to suggest this could be exploited as a way to travel rapidly around the facility. [29.28]I can imagine what Dr. Thule would think of that, unless it meant getting his coffee quicker.
Dialogue.D802C5BF47AB2DA1CC2C8FB8E3C06BFD_1E3C2DE: This is a bouncy place! Even for someone like you! [4.0]Try it! Twice!
Dialogue.6EBDCE9E4234CE82628CCCB7F106B105_0630D2E: This is a nightmare.[2.1]The power cut off, and that ... creature appeared ... [5.8]it's taking people ... somewhere ... [8.7]and that awful stuff is growing over everything ...[12.65]That sound - it was the surface elevator, wasn't it?[17.6]We're trapped, aren't we?[20.43]Locked in here ... with that thing.[23.9]Have you seen my glasses anywhere?[25.6]If I can just find them, this is the Security Sector, [28.58]there has to be codes, passes, something to help get us out of here.[33]But we must stay QUIET.
Dialogue.089DFCB249EFC607F4F77789187B836C_98535A7: This is completely different - we're fighting fire with fire! [4.4]Manse never let me try this, but if I can just bootstrap the neural array ... [10.0]I should be able to ... ah ha! ... [13]oh ... oh no! Janet!
Dialogue.71949ED340AFEF46F8CAF49C70CD313C_587DB37: This is either going to work, or it's not. I think it's time we find out.
Dialogue.881698DD4560BF681482D5B3974AAFDF_6D94EB0: This is no end, nor beginning, for such things do not exist.
Dialogue.04BA76A24007D571627066909D4CED85_D66552D: This is our root, our cause. You still seek yours.
Dialogue.320B9BBD4C1CB9662C3396A7E102C2E4_3FC2161: This is worse than last time ...
Dialogue.47B8612E469D17E0BE09329FF6EF49E6_98535A7: This is worse than the time ...
Dialogue.C11D637C4DA5EB1E4DA7CDBEA14D6424_D280DA7: This is, like, one of those things that you just, like ... look at ... [4.7]but your brain just, like ... won't ... you know ... process it .. or something?
Dialogue.DDAD010D4A1C18D9EB20D6856729E595_5D63EF4: This isn't my sector.[2]I have no idea where the flow valves are.
Dialogue.1F66A1654107B03F4BA13CB442EF82AC_28A5EA9: This may be a little more difficult than I thought.
Dialogue.E5B6982E4BCB4E1D4C4C8F95410605F5_28A5EA9: This place is a maze - I won't bore you with how I got down here, but it wasn't easy. [7.35]You have no idea how thick the concrete is around here.
Dialogue.F84101E8490B1D098A812EAC37B3B335_500EBB0: This place is cursed by forces greater than we can endure.
Dialogue.A8CC313A468F97CCF13A6287F106EBB2_587DB37: This place is done for, I don't know why you're sticking around.
Dialogue.B53414494BD63D3DB7678884315BEA14_7E44BA3: This sector will be powered down momentarily. [3.3]If you have not already evacuated the facility, consider this your top priority. [9]Have a wonderful and productive evening.
Dialogue.28D602924449773367F6B8B5EED11B40_1E3C2DE: This was a wonderful place. [2.0]I'm scared, but I can't leave. Where would I go?
Dialogue.2AA68EC942BA0A833D8FEAB9F2B3380B_28A5EA9: This was the last thing I expected, but now that we're here, we must. Do. Something.
Dialogue.C4D757284C33A156FB284584452AA268_B493B93: Those levitating incinerators and their friends have overrun our facility, as you probably noticed. [6.36]I do wonder, though, what contraptions they've pilfered to create flames of such a fascinating shade of blue. Perhaps ... [14.15]Oh, snap out of it, Tengku! [16.14]The Gatekeepers have wrested the Dark Lens from the Order - yes - but they've no intention of using it to help us! [22.4]And now they can go wherever - perhaps whenever - they want! [27.7]It's high time we figured out how to escape this pit, before one of those hovering cryptkeepers cremates us. [33.68]I swear this would be simpler if we weren't on backup power, but there's nothing to do about that ... is there?
Dialogue.6319702440DE4C0853869993BF989017_B10FECB: Those poor fools never dared look inside the Lodestone. [3.1]But if we don't at least try to find out how it works, how it's constructed, to understand it, how can we call ourselves scientists? [11.59]If you have to smash it open, just do it gently, yes?
Dialogue.04D6C06B4ED6F2EC3752D4AC2F6265BD_7D797E7: Those security bots are lethal, [2.4]but taking one down and getting the CPU is our only chance to rescue my data.
Dialogue.E5BD34B149C1E0FAE9EFBCB2A46E2A6D_B10FECB: Those things in the swamp, I'd been fending them off with subsonics, but I wonder how they got here? [5.44]If the Lodestone is really an anchor of sorts, did those creatures come through a perforation? [11.22]From the same origin, by accident? ... I don't know. [16.59]It sometimes feels as though everything here came from somewhere else...
Dialogue.7FE1BCEC4E325353924C84BD4B8BE899_7820C76: Thou hast awakened us. [3.79]Where is this that I have awoken? [7.2]On what plane? [9.9]Creature, you are strange to us ...
Dialogue.5CD9B52D407BF6A2148D18942A528E49_F5807AE: Though we haven't yet captured a complete specimen of 0139, [4.0]Dr. Thule took a sample of its ... dust, but this raised more questions than answers. [11.0]Foremost, One-Three-Nine appears primarily to be a host, rather than an individual. [17.0]Pendleton theorizes One-Three-Nine may be suffering an infection, [21.0]which will require tests to ensure no cross-contamination can occur. [25.6]And if true, we're unsure whether its behaviours are innate to the original being, [30.7]or a byproduct. [33.6]It's... quite a tangled web, really. [36.4]We'll need more time.
Dialogue.B89550FC405BF4041E51E29252EFDF21_AD7A481: Time is neither wheel, nor wave - no river, nor arrow. [5.45]It cannot be named, for in naming is lost. [10.94]Time is only that which undoes all else. [15.81]So be consoled, for it has not yet had its way with you.
Dialogue.5C47928F4B58CD5C9F5D29A7D7A0BDF3_EF8738C: Time to spend a penny, perhaps.
Dialogue.CA4064DB40F69C93F6F75E970EE2391B_B19337C: Times are tough, sure, you gotta get a little creative.
Dialogue.1AB6ECC04120F9F81CE27A99A5C03E62_F5807AE: To anyone considering study, investigation or indeed any kind of interaction [5.3]with the Red Chair, IS Oh-One-Eight, I can advise only caution. [11.4]Consider this piece of furniture a tool of assassination, no less for being so thoroughly arcane in its function. [20.05]If you find yourself affected, we can little do to assist you. [23.77]Exercise utmost care in its vicinity. [26.7]No resting, no leaning, no sitting, reclining or indeed any form of recumbance on or near this furnishing ... [35.13]It's also extremely damp. Perpetually.
Dialogue.6F50C47F41F37804DB2379B2E5CEEB0B_F5807AE: To anyone handling fluids of IS-121, the Tarasque, be extremely careful. [6.42]The ichor has properties we've yet to fully assess, and can interfere, interrupt or even instigate perforation events. [15.04]I'm sure you're all aware of what happened to Dr. Stern, last week. [18.6]Luckily, we recovered him unharmed. Mostly. [23]With thanks to the staff at Torii Facility, we have the Tarasque hooked up in that insufferably hot "Shroom Room". [30.27]Please ensure you do not to disturb the arrangement.
Dialogue.D3D750BE427C807C319360BBA0D5C207_B19337C: Try Level 3 ... the power cells ... Energy Research team ...
Dialogue.FAA5899445F4CA8BFA5EE1957C291EF5_28A5EA9: Try the pump -[1.53]I mean, how could things get any worse?
Dialogue.CCD680F14B57580064FF8F91C88CA8DD_9EAF573: Turn away or be strung up like your unholy bretheren!
Dialogue.3BA19EAA45BB599F00E5D2922DD9B070_F2E10BE: Ugh, I must be coming down with something...
Dialogue.81B9F7D94035F0DDD2B271B90AFCE1EA_28A5EA9: Ulrich, do you remember when we were first hired at GATE?[3.49]I immediately felt we were going to be best of fr-
Dialogue.67B203D34B2279E3C10021B77F275278_98535A7: Um, Janet, about my Facility simulation ... [4.85]I think I forgot to shut it down ... [9.1]It might still be running up there.
Dialogue.5F810B6F49CB73A5F2797E9314C04678_1E3C2DE: Under protection of the 5th Planetary Legion ~ Commander Fili
Dialogue.52E3B3B04E321A24E3F017A5130E0DA6_500EBB0: Understand me when I say, there is no pathway here.
Dialogue.7AAB80324D288214F5E0F5BECAE939DD_09B430A: Unless scented soap is critical to your escape plans, Abe [4.7]I think we should focus on the here and now.
Dialogue.347890FD40651D47CC3DA0A93071274A_18C7EC2: Unless you get a move on, you're gonna end up as tucker [3.5]for some frilly peg leg drongo from God knows where. [7.5]NOT a good look. [9.7]You're smarter than that. Or you should be. [12.8]I've seen those Science Team paychecks.
Dialogue.463D3F064CCEE6B8BAC63CBEC824212A_F5807AE: Update on IS-102. [2.6]Human exposure to the phage has highly negative effects, [6.1]transforming victims into hyper aggressive, mindless predators. [10.73]While it encourages breeding in its original hosts, human hosts seem only to consume one another. [16.83]If there are useful applications of this phenomenon, I am slow to see them. [21.93]I have given Tengku two weeks to show productive results.
Dialogue.42F645DF45D18885B24BC883FA204D2A_1E3C2DE: Wait till the 7th Planetary Legion hears about this!
Dialogue.23574B3E4E0154E56A7669867F607494_500EBB0: Wait, Promethean! Do not attack! Our paths converge once more! [4.7]By some fathomless twist of circumstance, you arrive in the sanctum of my brethren at a critical moment!  [11.70]The wretched Gatekeepers are trapped in your facility, now that their redoubt is violated. [17.57]They came to recover the Dark Lens - now it is their only possibility of escape! [23.50]Yet if they achieve this, be assured, the infested state of your lair will become the fate of the entire world! [30.58]They hide in your facility's frigid Residence sector, seeking to activate the device! [36.0]The realm is immersed in cold beyond anything in our universe! [39.82]My brethren have a tool that could counter it - the Sun Disk - but are forbidden from doing so. [46.24]But you! You are not so constrained by our covenant. [49.70]There is only one course! To achieve greater ends, I must permit your passage to the Praetorium's very heart. [57.34]Reach the Sun Disk to survive the abyssal cold of Residences![61.79]Confront the Gatekeepers! Remove the Dark Lens from their possession by any means![67.3]Accept this offer, or return to your crypt and continue your quest alone - I shall not stop you ... nor could I.
Dialogue.39161EF1497711432F7C938B057B99D6_500EBB0: Wait, Promethean! Do not attack! [2.3]Our paths converge once more! [4.6]Do you comprehend where you are? [7.2]The Praetorium, the sanctum of my bretheren! [10.6]If this was your intention, you are insane! But by some fathomless twist of circumstance ... you arrive at a critical moment! [18.0]Your precious Gatekeepers retreat to the frigid Residential region of your facility [23.5]to harness the power of the Dark Lens and bring ruin upon us all! [27.6]My bretheren, we are shackled, but you are not bound by our compact! [31.8]I would not ask them to join me, but you ... You may yet see wisdom! [37.3]I implore you, wait, abide, amend your course, for we may yet reclaim the Dark Lens, if you ally with my insurrection! [46.0]I see a fate even the Praetors have refused to fathom. [50.0]Time is not our ally, never our ally, though it is time we must spend. But first I must prepare for our journey. [57.8]Return to me when the time is aligned. You will know by the signs. [62.2]Soon, my inquisition shall begin.
Dialogue.9668C1EF41147A9A7309BB97E9777FA8_7E44BA3: Warning, biological incursion detected. Please alert Defense Team personnel.
Dialogue.5C4A73FE4AD66A8472E0068B0294521E_7E44BA3: Warning, this facility has been compromised by unauthorized entities. Alert nearest Defense Team staff immediately.
Dialogue.891659CC41BFCFE6A1610FA942F61A16_7E44BA3: Warning. Anomalous power fluctuation detected in - office - sector.[6.7] Investigation - recommended.[9.8]Critical operations may experience intermittent power loss.[15.0]GATE apologizes for any inconvenience.
Dialogue.9E6FEAE74BD877CFC300BF8D73333D28_7E44BA3: Warning. The safety rating of this sector is now - negative four. [6.5]Please exit this sector via the Main Surface Tunnel. Have a safe and successful day.
Dialogue.1727AB834FEF033F81470C8EB82E403B_4D54ED2: Watch out for those hoppy...potatoes! [2.3]I found a few of them down here. [4.4]How on earth did they manage to get in?
Dialogue.FC0114C54BA7F72D0F59BDA022C1E500_F5807AE: Watching Dr. Peters work with the 173 this morning - [3.36]the little hoppy one - [5.45]a thought occured to me about its relation to the other two, [8.65]and indeed all the entities we have encountered in Anteverse 2. [13]At best, the implications are ... concerning. [17.39]In the most extreme reading ... no ... it will have to wait.
Dialogue.A515A7E04E447EE0BE9956A8F35AED6A_D66552D: We (remember) this. [2.8]You come from nothing. [5.6]Wishing to escape. [8.2] We (see) whispers. [11.4]A sanctuary you would violate. [14.3]Return to your home before (untranslatable) is aware. [21.0]Forget what you have seen. [25.0]Undo what might be.
Dialogue.76901A7140BCB4EB663E40A1187D65F8_5FC0510: We ... can't go this way ... You don't... want to.
Dialogue.C0393ECF40537ECE2CC5008FC57D32E5_98535A7: We HAVE to do something, Janet. We need to go back into Flathill.
Dialogue.EB177871439B0E2CF3575EA06CCF39A1_6D94EB0: We are done, if ever such a thing was.
Dialogue.27398EF74C134BF88E1F0F8862497545_C8E28C6: We are not hungry for this flavor.
Dialogue.01F47C0A411DD2CDA903EDB4C13E32CC_AD7A481: We are the Unlost, the unfound, who seek not, nor discover, for this always was, and ever shall be.
Dialogue.0FCC8B2B4301F785D57F28BA5D26509E_500EBB0: We came here to cleanse, and protect, but this chaos is beyond our capacity to suppress. [5.2]We are beset by demons from the depths of the mines! [8.0]And that termagent FRAKE has holed herself up in the Processing Plant! [12.2]I must warn my betheren, this course is impossible! [15.5]But our engineers collapsed this tunnel, to ensure no egress. [19.0]We need another way to bring tidings of this terror to the Tribunal. [22.8]Frake is concealing the escape from us! I am sure of it! [26.0]She hides in her fortress, letting us rot here!
Dialogue.FBDD814A41E3AAA4C3CC0C872CCDE325_EE2A79A: We came to study the place, I mean, this is a lighthouse for perforations.  [4.7]The currents were off the chart!  [6.4]Dr. Tengku was obsessed.  [8.45]She'd freak out about the Lodestone, if she ever finds out.  [13.2]Looks like it turned into a one-way trip, though, didn't it. (Sighs)
Dialogue.989C3DCA4542AF86C5B66BA63215C147_08CBFFC: We can help each other, yes.
Dialogue.985208EB4892F2B0E8D431A89D88EBA3_09B430A: We can't even get a message out, Abe, Tim's world wide web isn't going to save us now.
Dialogue.BD7298C84C91B373638681950DAE8A93_7820C76: We cannot sense any of our kind, not even a whisper ...
Dialogue.1C7FB85E4398224625C16EA76125364D_09B430A: We could try the adjustment wing, too. [2.6]Every time I'm in there, they've got some new piece of fancy equipment. [5.9]They get ALL the new gear.
Dialogue.0D2480094A6BF3755EC8FA96F1810D05_28A5EA9: We don't really have a lot of choice here: We're hundreds of miles from ... anywhere ... [6.33]and there's no way we're getting through their ... sky shield ... thing ... so it's inside or nothing.
Dialogue.146EF8F34B5D3FC1B0591799D9497B1C_550B9CF: We have a place for fiends like ye!
Dialogue.A94666984C673227B770C5B0EB6ECDFB_550B9CF: We have a place for fiends like ye!
Dialogue.740ABC184F55CC0B273A89BECFE91A30_F609D41: We have done extraordinary things here, and perhaps we shall again.[3]I do not know what the future holds.
Dialogue.AFDF48A643314CC346D9D09486130F54_08CBFFC: We have no further business, for now.
Dialogue.A4D68A0645A7D7D9FF7418973609E9CD_98535A7: We just need to get in there.
Dialogue.6ECA9C894CB9D0015F0D0A85C72BAFCA_6D94EB0: We meet again, from before or a time to come, it is all the same.
Dialogue.78B4BA524A3162B1D91A9DA7C6296EC7_23ED69A: We must fix it, but keep it going... it must not stop ... must persist ... at all costs ...
Dialogue.ABC48DBB4B54CF4EE2A201876495CF75_7820C76: We must have been dormant for aeons.
Dialogue.4796FB7C44DDAAE99C0197ACE6D39A5F_98535A7: We need WEAPONS ... BIG LASER GUNS!
Dialogue.A1DD13B54075B587BF884EB6648D7EB1_98535A7: We need to shut that place down, now.
Dialogue.F829833C427B3E5940B42BB20083C070_D66552D: We see fear, and hope. Both are misplaced.
Dialogue.8877B8AE4599B55EC32BBBB8ECA83B4B_09B430A: We think the Gatekeepers have recovered the Dark Lens from those gunned-up goons, which is ... good, I suppose. [7]But it looks like they're planning to leave, and lock the door behind them.
Dialogue.36F05B1E4944052FB9D3A792F67446EA_6D94EB0: We watch, we wait, we witness.
Dialogue.8CF79DDE4D24AADD3B9DEEA9320A1160_3322B20: We were on the cusp of understanding ... [3.5]So much knowledge lost.
Dialogue.9AF995324F8498B35BF9BAB9D9A94730_6B614EA: We will leave here, one way or another.
Dialogue.4C0A48374715B17C28BD1389D262EFCC_52045D4: We're all we've got now. [1.05]Our own hands. [2.10]But I remember when this was different, before they cleared this place out. [5.33]In '85. Like it was an accident. [8.02]Just ate up all the rock, the dirt. [10.10]They don't talk about that, but it happened. [12.35]And now look. Like it was never here. (Laughs)
Dialogue.EA0A2B5D41CB8F811D0CFF800ABCBC6F_09B430A: We're going to head through Manufacturing, then take the Surface Tunnel out of here ... [6]when you're ready, Abe ... so ... just try to calm down.
Dialogue.5B85E9AA4431AEE4BF1107A2B86CC7E1_09B430A: We're never going to live this down.
Dialogue.798F20674A696A732F6ED8AEB67C6D61_28A5EA9: We're not out of the woods yet, but I'm starting to think we've got a chance.[5.4]If we can just get through the Hydroplant,[7.7]perhaps we can even get to the Residences -[10.25]so close to the surface, comparatively speaking, anyway.
Dialogue.1320120C4CA6DA5D159ED68986876761_09B430A: We're safe for the moment.[2.3]Our best option is to wait, and keep our eyes open.
Dialogue.913FFBB741C15B1E0C747BA629E6CB5B_B10FECB: We're unsure of the exact date, but it would seem to be the 18th century. [4.53]But is this our world, or a bifurcation? There's so much we don't know. [9.41]We could be more certain if we had our tools, but they took almost everything.
Dialogue.90FF9A9A48ADAF7252029086C770FA17_28A5EA9: We've come a long way together, haven't we? [2.9]We're not in the clear just yet - not by a long way - but it's not looking as hopeless as it was for a time there. [9.8]I'm actually starting to feel optimistic, faintly. At least, I think that's what this feeling is.
Dialogue.B3885DEC408384308BECD2BAD1165BC5_28A5EA9: We've gone out searching for new realms, other entities,[4.12]only to lock them away like some cosmic zoo.[9.09]Is anyone really surprised that it's come to this?
Dialogue.535A8EDF4E2165E075E09AA1F3A18457_F5807AE: We've had IS Oh-Two-Three contained in the aquarium for almost a decade now. [5.42]We recovered it from Anteverse 42, so we should have guessed where this would lead. [10.46]Oh-Two-Three shows no sign of stopping its growth. [14.25]There were several specimens, but it seems to have consumed its remaining competitors. [19.35]I have better things to do than repeat myself, but as directed by the Executive, [23.69]I remind staff: swimming alongside the beast is prohibited.
Dialogue.E1F465F240254388A907E091288C107B_7E44BA3: Welcome to the GATE Cascade Research Facility. [4.4]You are in the Induction Wing. [7.91]The facility is currently at Alert Level: Precautionary. [13.3]Please listen carefully to, and follow, all security instructions. [19.5]Now arriving at Staff Processing.
Dialogue.B73E0EC74C605F1DD40D8DAEEC91F5E8_28A5EA9: Well done, my terrifically tatterdemalion friend. [3]I continue to be impressed with your acumen and derring-do. [7.9]It's really rather a silver lining to all this chaos. [11.77]And we're one step closer to escaping it, thanks to you - [16.68]Now... I've had a look around and ... It's as diabolical as I had feared. [22.51]The scientists down here have a central Fusion reactor powering the waygate. In other words, we do need all four reactors. [32.75]I noticed a Blast Door activated near the original station, leading to Cloud Reactor. [38.38]I thought I heard some yelling, but it's hard to tell with all this acoustic anathema. [43.63]The Blast Door is not far from here at all, just back the way we came ... on the Tram ... of course.
Dialogue.661648B84E8CE712DE944DA1F4BC694C_5D63EF4: Well hello![2]It's nice to see I'm not the only one showing up in strange places.[7.4]I got turned around in the lower Reactors and tumbled into another portal, largely by choice.[14.7]I'll tell you all about it sometime, but we've clearly got more interesting things afoot.[21]A group of Gatekeepers have set up shop at the top of Botanicals.[25.5]They haven't fired on us, but they're definitely protecting something up there - perhaps another portal?[31.6]Maybe something that can get us through the force field to the Dark Lens.[36.8]My current theory? We should get exploring, but I'm underequipped.[43.2]You, on the other hand... Well, I'm starting to wonder if you weren't born for this.
Dialogue.EFC7A3414D701185FC12D6900BAEDC6F_D5875C8: Well this a mess. [2.3]I'm freezing my ass off in here. [5.0]No-one saw that storm up there coming, sure, but someone at Keystone sure had a plan for this. [12.0]They just send the Gatekeepers in to get the Lens back, then shut this place down like nothing ever happened. [19.8]Great thing about a secret facility - you hit an iceberg, no-one'll ever know. [27]This is a lockdown, pure and simple. [30.4]Help isn't coming. [34.0]I thought there might be a way out here, but only way is through the Shopping District, and a horde of GATE's favorite gang of freaks. [43.0]It doesn't look promising.
Dialogue.A11C6A91411C5A194F8E8EB8D13BDC29_28A5EA9: Well, I suppose that's it.[2.96]Stay if you wish - I believe you'll find another sorry soul on the Lighthouse, if you need company.[9.18]Or return to Cascade - you've little to fear there, clearly.[13.97]It's up to you, as it always has been.[17.75]And I've got things to do, things to prepare for![21.20]Fare thee well.
Dialogue.B41753F34FC5A4E4082A33A287AE3276_98535A7: Well, I've had a good look down here, and ...
Dialogue.49CABD91470DF162202EA18238E2886A_98535A7: Well, Janet, I've come up with several ideas.[4.2]Aren't you supposed to be a teleportation expert?
Dialogue.35784F2F4F3AA03E61C131B0DEF235A0_D73DE1F: Well, if you're the only help available, you should set up somewhere and sort this out.
Dialogue.848ECC564C439FEF67C2458B474BF961_28A5EA9: Well, it looks like the way is clear, for now.
Dialogue.779EC0754CED408634E179BDBF051DF2_28A5EA9: Well, it's been an exceptionally interesting journey, friend.[4.9]I'm not just saying that, it's really been a wonderful ride.[10.7]Of course, it hasn't altogether worked out as you'd hoped, but there's probably a useful lesson there.
Dialogue.E536F6AC47E84388090268A1F6026D98_18C7EC2: Well, its all yours, you look like you need it.
Dialogue.BB33C611444C7557BC15CCA75570C279_8C6F078: Well, that certainly looks to have done it.
Dialogue.02068A9D42FE315430271985C93D555A_09B430A: Well, the first time is the most exciting, right, Abe?
Dialogue.205E05354272DFB6F3078CB5D654B7D3_09B430A: Well, the laser cannon works.[3.0]When we saw you were in a hostage situation we had to act. That rat bastard.[8.6]Anyway, you're welcome.[11]Now that you're here, maybe you can help us puzzle out a problem.[14.2]Well, several problems, actually.[17.07]Aside from the impenetrable ice shield blocking us from the Shopping District, the most immediate issue is a hyper-chilled perforation storm that has completely overtaken the area.[28.4]We need to access some tech in the dorms, but right now - it's off-limits.
Dialogue.E50148C84ABF141296F22092E4B354B8_09B430A: Well, you always were a cat person, Abe. [2.7]But it's got certain appeal. [4.9]If you can see past the toxic aliens and power cuts, the military invasion, [9.0]and the occult sociopaths who seem to think anything that breathes or blinks is fair game. [14.4]Other than that, it's lovely.
Dialogue.4BBCF2FF447EF01986C4CBA688084BCF_B493B93: What I wouldn't do for some asprin. I've had a splitting headache since this whole mess started. [7.3]I know it's nothing, compared to ... all of this ... [11.15]but it makes everything that much harder when the inside of your head feels like a centrifuge ...
Dialogue.964927D648085A7CAC26B68ACD3C39B9_8C6F078: What I wouldn't give for a few hours[3.8]to study whatever's swimming around out there ...[7.3]the Gatekeepers call it the Darkwater ...[11]and they have their reasons, I assume.
Dialogue.6880A7644B1EE8B5D5A48CAFEAE84BD4_D280DA7: What am I supposed to do now? I can't even move or I'm gonna freeze in about two seconds ... How did you get here?
Dialogue.1AB25B2747F72E8959DAAB95D4206CB6_09B430A: What are you waiting for? Get to Manufacturing. We'll be along as soon as Abe's ... feeling better.
Dialogue.1E0AFE314AD9B40FF1121589052A9479_B7CAC62: What division is this - how did I get here?
Dialogue.EB36942845C6C8C36CB013A21252D75D_EF8738C: What do you suppose the chances of this happening were?
Dialogue.5F8A1B2E498A85E79E2B1DA0F92BD58E_500EBB0: What is it you require here? You have that which you need - onward!
Dialogue.C2CF196648B963199EA9879D8D2736D9_08113E4: What on Earth is going on?
Dialogue.854134A4486439600D0CC8A3D0AD9BA4_500EBB0: What slows you, Promethean? The way is clear.
Dialogue.F04B392D457F5630FCA529A70F4E2CD2_6D94EB0: What wires, what device, what circuit will help you see the truth?
Dialogue.1FE5F9254B6D1645092502BA56F4A740_AD7A481: What would you have me tell you, child. [3.7]A rhyme to settle your sleep? [7.33]I have no such stories.
Dialogue.5AD9C408441CFE656ADF9FB7BA7B34D1_AD7A481: What you saw, others have seen and emerged no wiser. [5.22]So do not mourn.
Dialogue.C4CA61B84B604EAAC4832BABB7FF15CE_18C7EC2: What're you gonna do, just stand there?
Dialogue.12840E224DC35828EAFCE8835E2BD82A_F980962: What's going to happen now ... I don't know ...
Dialogue.15AAF304418DBCAE83D8F4810E6B4ACB_28A5EA9: Whatever that is, in the water,[2.69]it's not our problem.
Dialogue.0F6E5FA147EB62ED0E299E9ABD4FF53C_28A5EA9: Whatever that vortex up there is doing, it's sucking energy from the region like a vacuum. If it continues ... I wonder how cold it could actually get here?
Dialogue.8E6721334B381AE3393126B5C747EC73_5952414: Whatever they're doing in Silo 3, it used every powercell we had.
Dialogue.7ED37D7143D38BEC7E51989CA2890D75_28A5EA9: Whatever they're trying to do, we DON'T want to find out - take those brutes out ANY way you can!
Dialogue.8AA80C7341CC9BC3BFF875A418A64369_587DB37: Whatever those soldiers were expecting, it wasn't this.
Dialogue.684A6B754CC7B817DEB03D883FC6E719_2BD33F3: Whatever you believe the risks may be, a temporal break is infinitely worse. [8.2]Do as I say.
Dialogue.4E5C5AEE4151A772368FD79F3DA9EBC9_9D66FB2: Whatever you find through there, I hope it's what you're looking for - a sense of personal accomplishment, maybe. [5.74]Adventure. [7.2]But not love. Love doth not lie that way. The opposite really. [12.89]Don't say I didn't warn you.
Dialogue.8ABBB6ED4EC5D03A55362B99FFF6DBF6_84DFBE1: Whatever's going on, it'll be something to do with their work in Containment Block - [6.0]Those cowboys can't tell a boson from a bathmat, [10.0]and sometimes I wonder if they even care. [13.5]As soon as they set foot in another dimension, all good sense goes out the window.
Dialogue.D137F89146E4AD8D10486D94706422D4_09B430A: Whatever's happening in the Shopping District[2.0]I'm seeing readings that make it appear as though the whole space has been... well ... [7.3]let's just say you can forget about that taco, Abe.
Dialogue.57F8EF124DEFD6FD03F9DD8550845C91_EF8738C: When did I last drink something?
Dialogue.70D99D49436BE16C8D91EBA0C6778FB0_AD7A481: When the way opens, judge your course with what wisdom you can, [5.5]for there is no return to unknowing ...
Dialogue.9E4B670C44E280B2947EEAADE8E47547_9B469B0: When you've got your GATEPal, I'll let ya downstairs. [3.76]Should work like your PDA at Springer. More or less.
Dialogue.DF103372417AC5B6E3AE8C92876FB1F5_B19337C: Where do I get this stuff? Somewhere.
Dialogue.8EB1B97843ABF54348880E8F745D939A_98535A7: Where's you curiosity, Janet? [2.8]Maybe we could try getting the quantum submarine running again? [7.5]... Hmm, perhaps not. But I wonder...
Dialogue.0352FF5C44F7E57F244322B69FF39B9F_98535A7: Which is bad. And between us and the vortex up there, [4.2]it does seem a little as though the physical laws of our universe have been rather ... [10.6]interfered with, which is also a problem. I don't think I have to elaborate on that.
Dialogue.E9D2B3F446D413392A85F6BA0597041B_AF4702B: Who taught you guys to shoot? Stevie Wonder?!
Dialogue.1106D85B49CD1F770778BD94D1838FEE_84DFBE1: Whoever those soldier are, their Latin is atrocious.
Dialogue.7FCBC196412FCAD1943966A6F2C2EF6C_98535A7: Why are you still here, are you insane?
Dialogue.D5FDA9BF4F8F2AC0187242B059EEDBBB_98DBDC4: Will I see you again, later?
Dialogue.461717C34D094FE4FE640598E8A11F24_F5807AE: With the detector online, we've been able to confirm a dense neutrino burst with the creation of each new perforation. [7.4]We've noticed something else - the neutrino detector attracts perforation targets itself, possibly due to its shielding. [16.25]At any rate, it's frustrating. [18.23]Every time a portal appears in the reservoir tower, we have to recalibrate the entire apparatus.
Dialogue.94FFBC2A44A189FDD91524B18901AAF6_0630D2E: Without my glasses, it's hopeless.[2.8]Everything's a blurry mess.[4.8]Am I supposed to crawl through the darkness?[7.2]Even if I could get to the Dam, it might as well be fifty miles.[11.1]And then what?
Dialogue.3406C9764134F04FD94FADACDFCB738C_EF8738C: Would you have thought it could all go so wrong so quickly?
Dialogue.61F148FB4D38CDAABB070485D94E1D33_EF8738C: Would your modelling have predicted this?
Dialogue.78527D6847149F0AA9F1B9A3705305CB_D280DA7: Yeah, I don't eat these either, really.
Dialogue.B635538548DA1C6E8C0B9DB892815A39_B10FECB: Yes, I recognize you. [1.57]I was there when Manse signed your transfer papers.
Dialogue.E416ED17490E60672D136BB5CA018A44_F609D41: Yes, the eyrie has become the prision.[2.7]Who could have guessed this could happen?
Dialogue.7ADF693948C9FBA799286EAFF408ECEE_7D797E7: Yes, yes, I'm coming. I just need a little longer.
Dialogue.181CE3A94FDD757D7A5CD6B6496BA178_58FA765: You been through the train station yet? [2.3]You wanna fix those pumps, you need to pay that place a visit. [6.3]You'll see what I mean when you get there.
Dialogue.450D3E744DF75FE80559EF97BA0120D0_F609D41: You came back. You are either very brave, or tremendously foolish.
Dialogue.5B46F775460CFF87A2D02FA14EAF8DA4_1E8E4DD: You came from Office Sector? Is it ... bad over there?
Dialogue.7D2280264F36A7851A525BBFF4F33CD8_9B469B0: You came from Springer? [1.5]Things are a bit different over here. You'll see.
Dialogue.5F6A441541539C785D772B86588FB771_587DB37: You can wait here, you'll be safe, just don't get in the way.
Dialogue.3F89BCFD4FE4626EA4ADC2A1B042B967_AD7A481: You cannot see the peak from the trough, nor the depths from the peak.[7.0]Such is the way of the world as it unravels and reforms, forever changing, reforged over and again,[18.0]until nothing remains but the memory of having known something different, perhaps once ...
Dialogue.7D85EDC8437981C174DC229ED432A692_500EBB0: You dally, Scientist, while the world slips towards the abyss.
Dialogue.B129E72A4A4D7EEA0150FEA9EA65EF41_6D94EB0: You do not oye, so I cannot explain this to you, and it would make no difference if I could.
Dialogue.FC3B20A449CE13555D23B2ACE2095687_5D63EF4: You don't seem affected by the cold either.[3.8]I'm working on a theory - it's a little basic but hear me out - I think there's a contagion going around.[11]A very friendly one, it seems, one that keeps us warm even here.[17]Imagine, if we could find patient zero, find out who brought it to Cascade, I wonder what other secrets we could unlock.
Dialogue.06567A9D4862265AFE8BE39C9946AAAB_1E3C2DE: You escaped the Painted Planet! [2.5]Oh! You're not Space Queen Maxine! You don't look as fast either ... [8.0]Hmmm ... Well, anyway ...
