Setting this to a harder difficulty than Normal will also override dynamic difficulty, which will automatically increase aspects of difficulty when more players are present. If you want a harder challenge when alone in combat or playing singleplayer, increase this value. This can be changed later in the Sandbox Settings of your world save.
DT_SandboxOptions.HardcoreMode_DisplayDescription: If enabled, characters only have one life and difficulty is forced to Apocalyptic. This is for those looking for a greater challenge. If a scientist dies, they can spectate other scientists or quit the game. Admins can choose to revive scientists if required.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowPagers_DisplayDescription: If false, Pagers will not be useable in inventory or via the emote wheel. Setting this to false will make it harder to find other players.
DT_SandboxOptions.StorageByTag_DisplayDescription: If false, containers will no longer be restricted by item type. Some things, like refrigerators, can only accept food-type items when this option is true.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowTransmog_DisplayDescription: If false, players will be unable to transmogrify their armor to look like other pieces of armor using a certain piece of base equipment. This will limit customization but will not allow players to disguise their equipment as different equipment.
DT_SandboxOptions.ShowDeathMessages_DisplayDescription: If false, players will not be notified when someone is killed by something.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowRecipeSharing_DisplayDescription: If false, this will disable the ability to share item recipes with other players.
DT_SandboxOptions.PlayerFurnitureDestruction_DisplayDescri: If true, player-built furniture will be destroyed when it reaches zero durability. If false, it will simply package, making it easier to rebuild after an attack.
DT_SandboxOptions.RadiationDealsDamage_DisplayDescription: If true, radiation will actively deal damage to health. This will greatly increase difficulty.
DT_SandboxOptions.InvisibleRadiation_DisplayDescription: If true, radiation will not show any sort of screen effect, requiring scientists to use Geiger Counters to track radiation in an area. This will increase difficulty.
DT_SandboxOptions.LootRespawnEnabled_DisplayDescription: If true, resources will spontaneously respawn around the Facility. This will not respawn Furniture, however. This is a good setting for public servers, but can cause objects to intersect or float, and will make some resource gathering aspects of the game less important and very unbalanced.
DT_SandboxOptions.TaintedSinkWater_DisplayDescription: If true, sink (or similar) water sources that would be clean, drinkable water, will instead be tainted water. This will increase difficulty.
DT_SandboxOptions.DisableResearchMinigame_DisplayDescripti: If true, this will remove the Research Minigames when unlocking new recipes and simply unlock the recipe right away.
DT_SandboxOptions.SinkRefillRate_DisplayDescription: In the world, sinks will passively refill over time, allowing players to drink from them. This value adjusts the time this takes. A higher value will make sinks refill more quickly, and a lower value will make them refill more slowly. Setting this value to zero will disable sink refill, making the game much more challenging.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowIronMode_DisplayDescription: REQUIRES HARDCORE MODE. If true, players will have access to a starting job called Iron Mode, which will make the game much more difficult, including few perk points, less perks, no health regen and cannot receive recipes from other players.
DT_SandboxOptions.BaseInventorySize_DisplayDescription: Set the default inventory size when no backpack is equipped. This can make low-end backpacks less useful, but weight reduction from backpacks will still apply.
DT_SandboxOptions.DayNightCycleSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDesc: Speed multiplier for the Day and Night cycle. A higher number will make clock time pass faster. This will NOT affect the speed of other cooldowns, respawn times, and so on.
DT_SandboxOptions.AllowCharacterReset_DisplayDescription: There are some methods in the world to allow players to reset their jobs, skills, and traits later in the game. By disabling this, you remove the ability for scientists to change their mind later on.
DT_SandboxOptions.ItemWeightMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This is a multiplier affecting how heavy items are in your inventory. If an item normally weighs 5, a value of 2 would make that item weigh 10, or twice as heavy. If you want items to be lighter, set this value lower than 1.
DT_SandboxOptions.ItemDurabilityMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This is a multiplier for item durability. If an item normally has 10 Durability, a value of 2 would make that item have 20 Durability, or double durability. If you want items to break faster, set this value below 1.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyHealthMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This is a multiplier of enemy health. Lowering this value will make enemies easier to kill, and a higher value will mean enemies will take more damage to kill.
DT_SandboxOptions.ItemStackSizeMultiplier_DisplayDescripti: This is a multiplier of how many times you can stack items in an inventory slot. Items that are not stackable are excluded from this. If an item stacks to 5 by default, a value of 2 will allow the item to stack up to 10.
DT_SandboxOptions.DetectionSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This multiplier will determine how fast enemies detect players. If set above 1, enemies will detect players faster than normal.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyAccuracy_DisplayDescription: This setting determines how accurate enemies are, on average. Higher accuracy primarily means the enemies will tend to group their shots tighter on their target.
DT_SandboxOptions.DayNightCycleState_DisplayDescription: This setting will allow you to disable the Day Night Cycle. Time will continue to pass as normal, but there will be no transition from day to night or night to day. As some things only happen during day or night, this may cause unforseen consequences, such as an inability to acquire certain items. Change at your own risk.
DT_SandboxOptions.RefrigerationEffectivenessMultiplier_Dis: This value determines how effective it is to refrigerate items. This also affects how effectively hot items (e.g. a cup of coffee) maintain their heat if the item prefers staying warm and are kept in a warm location.
DT_SandboxOptions.FoodSpoilSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This value determines how fast food spoils. By default, most food will eventually decay and turn into rotten food. You can slow, speed up, or stop this function entirely with these options.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemySpawnRate_DisplayDescription: This value determines how frequently enemies respawn. A lower value will increase enemy respawn timers, whereas a higher value will cause enemies to respawn more quickly than normal.
DT_SandboxOptions.ContinenceSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescrip: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Continence drains. A higher number will mean players have to use the toilet more often.
DT_SandboxOptions.FatigueSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescriptio: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Fatigue increases. A higher number will mean players get sleepier more quickly.en.
DT_SandboxOptions.HungerSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Hunger increases. A higher number will mean players need to eat more often.
DT_SandboxOptions.ThirstSpeedMultiplier_DisplayDescription: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast Thirst increases. A higher number will mean players need to drink more often.
DT_SandboxOptions.PlayerXPGainMultiplier_DisplayDescriptio: This value is a multiplier and determines how fast XP is gained by players. Above 1 will cause XP to be gained at a higher rate, while below 1 will cause XP to be gained slower. Setting this to 0 will disable the ability for players to level up skills at all.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyPlayerDamageMultiplier_DisplayDescr: This value will determine how damaging enemies are, as a multiplier of their damage. The default value is tuned for a fair and balanced experience. Lowering this value will make survivability easier, raising this value will make combat more challenging and enemies more lethal.
DT_SandboxOptions.EnemyDeployableDamageMultiplier_DisplayD: This value will determine how much damage enemies do to deployables, as a multiplier of their damage. Setting this lower will make bases more resistant to enemy attacks.
DT_SandboxOptions.DamageToAlliesMultiplier_DisplayDescript: This value will determine how much damage players do to other players, as a proportion of normal damage. If a weapon deals 10 damage, a value of 10% will mean players receive 1 damage instead. If you want to allow players to engage in player vs. player combat, this value will need to be 100% or higher.
DT_SandboxOptions.DurabilityLossOnDeathMultiplier_DisplayD: This value will determine how much durability is lost on weapons and items in the player's inventory when respawning.
DT_SandboxOptions.StructuralSupportLimit_DisplayDescriptio: This value will determine how much furniture and other deployables can be stacked until a limit is reached. There are key balance reasons for this, but a lower number can limit some structural creativity. 0 will remove this requirement entirely.
DT_SandboxOptions.BonusPerkPoints_DisplayDescription: This will determine how many additional perk points are available on top of the points given by each selected job. Negative values will deduct available points.
DT_SandboxOptions.WeatherFrequency_DisplayDescription: This will determine how often weather events are triggered. Even frequent weather still requires the correct progression to trigger, however.
DT_SandboxOptions.DeathPenalties_DisplayDescription: This will determine what penalties the player receives for respawning after death (or by using the Unstick option.)
DT_SandboxOptions.FirstTimeStartingWeapon_DisplayDescripti: When spawning into the world for the first time, this is the weapon players will receive. This is in addition to starting items from their selected Job.
DT_SandboxOptions.GlobalRecipeUnlocks_DisplayDescription: When true, all players will share the same recipe list instead of unlocking recipes individually.
DT_SandboxOptions.HostAccessPlayerCorpses_DisplayDescripti: When true, the host will be able to access the inventory items found in Death Bags, which are typically dropped by players on death. This may vary depending on other Sandbox settings.

DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fastprepper_DisplayDescription: All cooking-related recipes take half the time to craft.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fastfood_DisplayDescription: All food you place on a cooktop or in an oven cooks 25% faster.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_bonesetter_DisplayDescription: All splints heal bones faster when applied by you.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_lightspeed_DisplayDescription: Along with your passive gains, you sprint 5% faster overall.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_aimdownsights_DisplayDescripti: Alternate Fire while aiming with a ranged weapon will zoom your vision.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_battlecharge_DisplayDescriptio: Attacking with a blunt or heavy weapon during a sprint will result in a driving power attack.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_assassin_DisplayDescription: Attacks on unaware enemies always deal double damage, even when standing.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fish_freshwaterfriends_Display: Certain underwater creatures will no longer feel threatened by your presence.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_superiorgains_DisplayDescripti: Due to your extreme strength training, all items in your inventory weigh 25% less.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nosurvivors_DisplayDescription: Enemies killed by your Sharp melee attacks will outright die when they otherwise might have gone DBNO.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_reflectivemantle_DisplayDescri: Enemies who contact you with melee attacks will have a chance to have some of their damage reflected back at them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_crusher_DisplayDescription: Enemies with resistance to Blunt... don't.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_terminalvelocity_DisplayDescri: Hitting enemies with a thrown weapon has a slightly increased chance to stagger large enemies, a high chance to stagger medium-sized enemies and always staggers small enemies.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_eyefordetail_DisplayDescriptio: Items you craft have temporary, bonus durability.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_radremover_DisplayDescription: NEW RECIPE: Pentetic Acid Syringe, a syringe that prevents radiation buildup and removes existing radiation.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_entangled_DisplayDescription: Plants planted by you have this perk attributed to them. The more plants in an area, the less water each individual plant consumes.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_straightarrow_DisplayDescripti: Projectiles (like crossbow bolts) have a lower chance to break on impact.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_stoppingpower_DisplayDescripti: Projectiles and bullets fired from ranged weapons have a small chance to stun the target.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_groupeffort_DisplayDescription: Resting (sitting on chair or floor) within 8 meters of other resting scientists doubles the resting rate.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_squint_DisplayDescription: Secondary Fire while aiming with a ranged weapon will zoom your vision some.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_eviscerator_DisplayDescription: Slice through Sharp-resistant enemies as if they weren't resistant at all.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_boomstick_DisplayDescription: Smaller creatures have a chance to run in fear when you fire a loud weapon.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_looserounds_DisplayDescription: Sometimes you find a few spare rounds when reloading. You are also an expert at reloading, with a bit of flair too.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_servingseconds_DisplayDescript: Soups, pies and similar foods cooked by you have 2 extra portions in them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_outofmyway_DisplayDescription: Sprinting speed increases over several seconds. At max speed, you can stagger any medium-sized enemy if collided with.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_castledoctrine_DisplayDescript: The cost of building fortifications, like barricades, walls, and ramps, is reduced by half.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_surpriseattack_DisplayDescript: The first attack on an idle or unaware enemy has a 25% chance to deal double damage.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_repairaccesscontainers_Display: The player can access nearby containers when repairing items from the Repair & Salvage Station.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_spontaneousfurniture_DisplayDe: The universe is a strange place and your meddling has certainly made it stranger. You have a chance to receive double furniture when successfully packaging an item that wasn't placed by you or a fellow scientist.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_quantumdisplacement:_DisplayDe: Thrown items and weapons sometimes split into 2 additional projectiles.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_hazyrecollection_DisplayDescri: Weapons thrown by you are highlighted to you for 30 seconds.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nerdrage_DisplayDescription: When bleeding near a hostile enemy, your melee attack damage and speed is enhanced.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_tinkerer_DisplayDescription: When crafting throwables (such as grenades) you get 1 additional item.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_precisionengineering_DisplayDe: When crafting, you have a small chance to use 1 less item when a recipe calls for more than 1 of the item.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_razedwithcare_DisplayDescripti: When dismantling furniture with a hammer, you have a 50% chance to receive double resources.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_prudentplucking_DisplayDescrip: When harvesting wild plants you receive 1 extra harvest.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_refreshingtouch_DisplayDescrip: When healing a teammate with a medical item, they also gain +5 hydration. This effect does not occur when healing yourself.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_brinkofdeath_DisplayDescriptio: When reviving a teammate that would otherwise be on "Last Legs" instead grant them "Extra Down" which gives them one additional chance instead of dying outright.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_aftercare_DisplayDescription: When reviving teammates they get a short healing buff and if reviving a teammate with a healing item the healing is increased by 20%.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_beautifulblueprints_DisplayDes: When sharing recipes with others, they don't have to complete the research phase.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_smash_DisplayDescription: When using a blunt melee weapon, you have a chance to instantly explode enemies that are human-sized and smaller. Chance increases based on Strength level.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_chefsense_DisplayDescription: When your food has finished cooking, your acute chef senses begin to tingle, even if you are not nearby.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_redshift_DisplayDescription: While sprinting, enemies are more likely to miss when targeting you.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_photosynthetic_DisplayDescript: While within 15 meters of garden plants, they grow 10% faster. (Does not stack with multiple players.)
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_combatdoc_DisplayDescription: You apply all medical items to yourself and to others twice as fast.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_basicgeometry_DisplayDescripti: You are less clumsy at reloading all weaponry.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_heavymeleeweapon_DisplayDescri: You are strong enough to properly wield heavy melee weapons, and you can now smash open Vending Machines, which will permanently break them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_projectilepickup_DisplayDescri: You automatically pick up projectiles and weapons you've previously thrown, if you have room in your inventory.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_craftingbenchupgrade_t3_Displa: You can access the final tier of Crafting Bench upgrades.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_craftingbenchupgrade_DisplayDe: You can access the first tier of Crafting Bench upgrades.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_craftingbenchupgrade_t2_Displa: You can access the second tier of Crafting Bench upgrades.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_soupsmith_DisplayDescription: You can cook soups by filling a pot with water and adding ingredients.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_toss_DisplayDescription: You can do a gentle, underhand toss with all throwable items.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_bluntmeleewindup_DisplayDescri: You can do heavy windup attacks with blunt melee weapons. These attacks can not be performed with a shield.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fish_sense_DisplayDescription: You can now detect fishing hotspots and craft Fish Traps.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_packyourdesk_DisplayDescriptio: You can package small deployables twice as fast.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_justincase_DisplayDescription: You can reload weapons you aren't otherwise qualified to use.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_bedsidemanner_DisplayDescripti: You can see all negative medical debuffs when up close to another player.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_throwcooktimer_DisplayDescript: You can see exactly how much time you have to cook an explosive before throwing it.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_motherknowsbest_DisplayDescrip: You can see other players' hunger and thirst when close by.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_throwingarc_DisplayDescription: You can see the predicted path of your throwable items before throwing them.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_stepaside_DisplayDescription: You can shake Vending Machines & stomp Carbuncles in 1 hit.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_speedloader_DisplayDescription: You can sprint and reload at the same time. You also reload weapons with a bit more skill.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_sharpmeleethrow_DisplayDescrip: You can throw sharp melee weapons.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_heavyarmor_DisplayDescription: You can wear any weight of armor without dropping into the heaviest weight class.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_ammocrafter_DisplayDescription: You craft ammo twice as fast.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nimble_DisplayDescription: You don't trigger Tripwires, Tripwire Lasers, or Carbuncles, even when not crouching.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fertilizer_t1_DisplayDescripti: You gain a recipe for Anomalous Compost, aiding in the growth of your plants.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fertilizer_t2_DisplayDescripti: You gain a recipe for Anomalous Fertilizer, aiding greatly in the growth of your plants.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fertilizer_t3_DisplayDescripti: You gain a recipe for Anomalous Plant Food, aiding immensely in the growth of your plants.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fish_luckyhat_DisplayDescripti: You gain the Lucky Fishing Hat and Mud Waders recipes.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_biofusion_DisplayDescription: You gain the advanced Bio-Fusion Imitator trinket recipe, allowing the use of all advanced and arcane firearms without the need for armwraps.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_armwrapsT2_DisplayDescription: You gain the advanced Bio-Mimic Armwraps recipe, allowing the use of specialized firearms.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_milspec_DisplayDescription: You gain the confidence to properly handle more advanced firearms. You also learn the Bio-Metric Armwraps recipe.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_cleancutter_DisplayDescription: You have a 25% higher chance to not end up with Bio Scrap when cutting up bodies.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_athletic_DisplayDescription: You have a chance to not lose stamina for an action that would normally use stamina.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_instantkill_DisplayDescription: You have a very small chance to instantly kill small and medium-sized enemies.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_spongey_DisplayDescription: You have slightly reduced fall damage and take less damage from environmental physics, such as vehicles.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_shadow_DisplayDescription: You move 15% faster when crouching and can perform a roll by sprinting while crouched.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_fish_baitswitch_DisplayDescrip: You now have a 33% chance to not lose your bait when fishing up junk.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_hearty_DisplayDescription: You regain extra health every time your health regenerates. You also learn the recipe for the Oven and Raw Dough.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_habit_DisplayDescription: You regenerate health a bit more frequently.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_expertgibbing_DisplayDescripti: You unlock an advanced knife recipe. This knife is capable of cutting up corpses with no chance of getting useless scrap.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_finedining_DisplayDescription: You're making the best of a bad situation. You unlock the recipe for Dinner Placement, a rather exquisite meal.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_powerhungry_DisplayDescription: Your Power Attacks use 50% less stamina per swing.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_interdimensional_DisplayDescri: Your extended universe-hopping has enhanced your strong sneaking abilities. Enemy attacks just sometimes... miss?
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_nightworker_DisplayDescription: Your footsteps are much quieter and your chance to get a Sneak Attack is increased 50% at night.
DT_SkillPerks.skillperk_sliceanddice_DisplayDescriptio: Your sharp attacks have a higher chance to cause Severe Bleeding to the target.

DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_kingsley_ItemDescriptionOverr: A drawn portrait of a man.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_rowan_ItemDescriptionOverride: A drawn portrait of a man.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_alexander_ItemFlavorTextOverr: A gentle "Alexander" is inscribed on the back.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_umbra_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A marine creature imbued with a tenebrous essence.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_0091_ItemDescriptionOverride: A notice poster from the GATE Cascade Research Facility.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_acahn_ItemDescriptionOverride: A photo frame of an inventor, a scientist and a friend.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_clock_ItemDescriptionOverride: A photo of a clock, mostly.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_cozycat_ItemDescriptionOverri: A photo of a cozy cat, just having a snooze.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_jim_ItemDescriptionOverride: A photo of a dog with a blue cowboy hat on.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_digby_ItemDescriptionOverride: A photo of a dog with a neckerchief reading "Digby."
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_jordog_ItemDescriptionOverrid: A photo of a fluffy white dog, sleeping while Dad is hard at work.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_hopia_ItemDescriptionOverride: A photo of a hand holding up some hopia on a beach somewhere.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_jacat_ItemDescriptionOverride: A picture of a comfy cat.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_zig2_ItemDescriptionOverride: A picture of a happy dog.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_zig3_ItemDescriptionOverride: A picture of a happy dog.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_zig_ItemDescriptionOverride: A picture of a happy dog.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_ela_ItemDescriptionOverride: A picture of a happy pest.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_alexander_ItemDescriptionOver: A picture of a one-eyed cat.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_USM_ItemDescriptionOverride: A poster featuring a game of deception, comedy, and space corporatocracy.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_TDL_ItemDescriptionOverride: A poster featuring the (metaphorical) corpse of an apocalyptic survival game.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_Detour_ItemDescriptionOverride: A poster from an obscure, poorly-written arcade game.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_2_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_3_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_4_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_a_5_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_eel_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: A unique sub-species of Gutfish Eel that transmutes its bio-electrical abilities into an arresting iridescence.
DT_TextureVariants.armor_helmet_wreathcrown_gold_ItemDescri: An exquisitely crafted wreath of purest gold.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_V_medieval_01_ItemFlavorTextOve: An older Italian painting. It looks genuine, but it's probably a reproduction.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_silk_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: As improbable as it is exquisite.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_ante_koi_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Dr. Kale's research into this specimen's alluring but inexplicable gosanke patterning was influential on the early development of viral gene transfer theory.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_jimmy_ItemNameOverride: Employee of the Month Photo Frame
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_hopia_ItemFlavorTextOverride: How did that hopia get so far from home?
DT_TextureVariants.fish_reaper_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: If the Night Realm is neither a world nor an anteverse, then this precious denizen of the darkness is scarcely more than an idea given form.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_cozycat_ItemFlavorTextOverrid: It has some writing on the back that says "From, The Mad Doc"
DT_TextureVariants.fish_is98_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Like the Leyak, IS-0098 is believed to originate in the unspeakable depths of Anteverse XXXIII. Little else is known about this unsettling marine entity.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_moon_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: One of the most uncommon aquatic specimens documented by GATE staff, the Pelagic Moon Fish emerges from the depths only on the rarest of occasions, following ancient instincts known only to certain members of its strange species.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_portal_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Recent research lends more credence to the theory that this entity is directly related to IS-0184-B and its ilk.
DT_TextureVariants.poster_USM_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Remember: Space doesn't care about your feelings, but The Company does.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_rad_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Research into this unusual variant of the Radfish is still in progress, but early data suggests it may harness ambient energy and release it via its single eye. When feeding, it focuses this low power 'death ray' on its prey to incapacitate it.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_jim_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Some text scrawled on the back simply says "Jim".
DT_TextureVariants.armor_helmet_wreathcrown_gold_ItemFlavor: The ancients believed perfection offends the gods. Clearly not all the ancients.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_portal_rare2_ItemFlavorTextOverride: The creature's extraordinary and extremely difficult to document ability to teleport itself to new bodies of water has allowed it to find its way to the most distant of shores, where its new diet has allowed it to develop a dramatic new coloration.
DT_TextureVariants.painting_S_plague_ItemFlavorTextOverride: The painting artist's did not ask for credit. In fact, they insisted against it.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_kingsley_ItemFlavorTextOverri: The portrait has V+*!+ scribbled in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_rowan_ItemFlavorTextOverride: The portrait has V+*!+ scribbled in the corner.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_ante_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: The vastly higher entropy of our universe compared to Anteverse II has allowed the Antefish to evolve rapidly into a plethora of variants. However, its unexpected aggression have seen the ascension of the Oxidious Antefish at the expense of all other sub-clades.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_ice_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: The very existence of this creature raises serious issues with thermodynamics, but that itself is superseded by its inconceivable retrieval from point of origin.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_darkwater_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverr: Theorized to be an internal parasite of IS-0023, scarcely more than a microbe in its original ecosystem.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_eel_translucent_ItemFlavorTextOverr: This seldom seen Gutfish Eel was long thought to be a myth, and is regarded by the denizens of Canaan as bringing twice-seven years bad luck on any fisherman who reels one in.
DT_TextureVariants.fish_eel_goldentail_ItemFlavorTextOverri: This variety of Gutfish Eel foregoes the dun coloring that inspired its common name in favor of a golden hue. It is said to come with a secretive blessing, and a serious shock.
DT_TextureVariants.photoframe_ela_ItemFlavorTextOverride: Wait, is that Ela!? When did he take this?!
DT_TextureVariants.fish_fog_rare1_ItemFlavorTextOverride: When held in the hand, several personnel have noted a 'sense of yearning or sadness' overcoming them.

DT_Traits.Trait_Outdoorsman_TraitDescription: When not deep underground, you like to be out in the wild. You’re affected less by temperature changes.
DT_Traits.Trait_Feeble_TraitDescription: You are an exceptionally frail individual. You have 25% lower maximum health and break your bones more frequently from falls and blunt trauma.
DT_Traits.Trait_Inconspicuous_TraitDescription: You are meek and quiet. You attract enemy attention twice as slow as others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Dry_TraitDescription: You are naturally dry, getting thirsty 20% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Moist_TraitDescription: You are naturally moist and get thirsty 20% slower than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Hemophilia_TraitDescription: You are twice as likely to bleed from a wound, and potentially quite severely.
DT_Traits.Trait_Strong_TraitDescription: You can carry 15% more weight than other scientists.
DT_Traits.Trait_LeadBelly_TraitDescription: You can drink tainted water without getting sick. Gross.
DT_Traits.Trait_SteelBladder_TraitDescription: You can hold it for quite some time. Your toilet needs are reduced by 20%.
DT_Traits.Trait_WeakBladder_TraitDescription: You can't hold it very long. Your toilet needs are increased by 15%, and you have to sit on the toilet for a longer duration than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_Cannibal_TraitDescription: You crave human flesh. It's the only thing keeping you sane.
DT_Traits.Trait_NightOwl_TraitDescription: You frequently work late into the night, becoming fatigued 50% slower than the average scientist.
DT_Traits.Trait_Gardener_TraitDescription: You gain Agriculture-related experience twice as fast and receive recipes for basic garden plots right from the outset.
DT_Traits.Trait_Narcoleptic_TraitDescription: You grow fatigued 75% faster than others and never feel truly rested. This affliction is a constant part of your life.
DT_Traits.Trait_ThickSkinned_TraitDescription: You have a 50% lower chance of receiving bleeding injuries.
DT_Traits.Trait_Chef_TraitDescription: You have a love of cooking. You gain Cooking skill twice as fast.
DT_Traits.Trait_HeartyAppetite_TraitDescription: You have a wild metabolism. You get hungry 60% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_WrinklyBrainmeat_TraitDescription: You have more pliable neurological pathways. You gain 20% more XP than normal.
DT_Traits.Trait_SlowLearner_TraitDescription: You have very stiff neurological pathways. You learn skills 20% slower than normal and can't learn recipes via sharing nor by picking up things others have crafted.
DT_Traits.Trait_EasilyStartled_TraitDescription: You lose sanity 20% faster than normal.
DT_Traits.Trait_Asthmatic_TraitDescription: You lose stamina 40% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_FannyPack_TraitDescription: You never leave home without it. You permanently gain 2 extra Hotbar Slots.
DT_Traits.Trait_FearOfViolence_TraitDescription: You refuse to engage with most combat-related skill past Level 5. (Accuracy, Reloading, Blunt Melee, Sharp Melee, Throwing)
DT_Traits.Trait_LightEater_TraitDescription: You require 20% less food than others do.
DT_Traits.Trait_Conspicuous_TraitDescription: You stand out, to your detriment. You attract enemy attention 45% faster than others.
DT_Traits.Trait_FirstAidCert_TraitDescription: You took the GATE-provided First Aid Certification course. You start with 5 bandages.
DT_Traits.Trait_SelfDefense_TraitDescription: You took the GATE-provided self-defense course. You deal +3 damage with all melee weapons.
DT_Traits.Trait_Decathlon_TraitDescription: You trained for and participated in the GATE Foundation Decathlon. You gain all fitness-related skills at a faster rate. (Sprinting, Strength, Throwing)
DT_Traits.Trait_FormerGuard_TraitDescription: You're a bit more stalwart than most. You lose sanity at a 50% slower rate.
DT_Traits.Trait_SunDisk_TraitDescription: Your core is fueled by a warmth unlike any other.
DT_Traits.Trait_SlowHealer_TraitDescription: Your healing interval is 1.5 seconds slower than everyone else.

DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_MakeBandage_HintLongText: Craft a bandage to stop the bleeding!
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_HealthWheel_HintLongText: Hold the medical button to quick-use a bandage!
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Emote_HintLongText: Hold to open the emote wheel and wave or page to the guard.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Journal_HintLongText: Open your Inventory and navigate to your Journal to view objectives and notes.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Inventory_HintLongText: Pick up hard hat, then open your inventory to equip it.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_FishPull_HintLongText: Pull the opposite direction of the catch to tire it out, then reel it in!
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_InvincibleEnemies_HintLongText: Some entities can not be killed by your weaponry and should be avoided at all costs.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_LookAround_HintLongText: Take a look around, if you want to.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Crouch_HintLongText: You can crouch to access vents and sneak about.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_DismantlePipes_HintLongText: You can dismantle certain objects in order to find more crafting supplies.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_ExitVehicle_HintLongText: You can exit vehicles and chairs by pressing Jump.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Jump_HintLongText: You can jump over small obstacles.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Sneaking_HintLongText: You can sneak past certain enemies, or you can tackle them head on.
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_Waterways_HintLongText: You can use the waterways to travel the Facility. Jump on in!
DT_TutorialHints.Tutorial_MakeNets_HintLongText: You may want to craft some Throw Nets for self-defense.

DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_Crafting_Description: As a scientist, you find inspiration all around you! Gain new crafting Recipes and Ideas by picking up resources, interacting with items, packaging furniture, and the occasional email. Some Recipes are craftable right away, but Ideas must first be invented. You’ve learned the Recipe for THROW NETS - now craft some!
DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_PunchCard_Description: Check-In Terminals are places where you can return to if you die - a respawn point. You can only save to one Check-In Terminal at a time. This respawn will be available alongside other options, such as respawning at your bed or other starting area.
DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_Dismantling_Description: Many objects can be dismantled for resources - either broken with a proper weapon, or taken apart. Vents can be destroyed or dismantled.
DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_Radiation_Description: When you encounter RADIATION, you will see small speckles or dots in your vision, increasing in intensity with the radiation strength. A little won't hurt, but long-term exposure will harm you without protection.
DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_DumpSoup_Description: Whether you've got a liquid container you no longer want, or you've made a bad soup that isn't worth eating, you can pour it on the ground by accessing the context menu on the item in your inventory. In the future, you should use your Soup recipe book in your Compendium to figure out better soups.
DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_Movement_Description: You can move around and sprint. Sprinting consumes Stamina.
DT_TutorialPanelKeybindTips.Tip_PortalWorlds_Description: You’re about to venture out of the Facility for a while. You’ll be able to return through a return portal, but you may want to do a little preparation, like bringing some food and ensuring you’re well rested. If you die in a portal world, you can choose to respawn at the Portal World entrance, or at another spawn point in the Facility.

DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Crafting_Description: As a scientist, you find inspiration all around you! Gain new crafting Recipes and Ideas by picking up resources, interacting with items, packaging furniture, and the occasional email. Press 'C' to access your CRAFTING & RESEARCH menu. Some Recipes are craftable right away, but Ideas must first be invented. You’ve learned the Recipe for THROW NETS - now craft some!
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_PunchCard_Description: Check-In Terminals are places where you can return to if you die - a respawn point. You can only save to one Check-In Terminal at a time. This respawn will be available alongside other options, such as respawning at your bed or other starting area.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Dismantling_Description: Many objects can be dismantled for resources - either broken with a proper weapon, or taken apart by holding F. Vents can be destroyed or dismantled.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Movement_Description: Use W, A, S, D to move about. Use Left SHIFT to sprint.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_Radiation_Description: When you encounter RADIATION, you will see small speckles or dots in your vision, increasing in intensity with the radiation strength. A little won't hurt, but long-term exposure will harm you without protection.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_DumpSoup_Description: Whether you've got a liquid container you no longer want, or you've made a bad soup that isn't worth eating, you can pour it on the ground by accessing the context menu on the item in your inventory. In the future, you should use your Soup recipe book in your Compendium to figure out better soups.
DT_TutorialPanelTips.Tip_PortalWorlds_Description: You’re about to venture out of the Facility for a while. You’ll be able to return through a return portal, but you may want to do a little preparation, like bringing some food and ensuring you’re well rested. If you die in a portal world, you can choose to respawn at the Portal World entrance, or at another spawn point in the Facility.

DT_UIPopups.equipbackpack_PopupText: Equip the backpack by dragging it into your Backpack slot.
DT_UIPopups.equiphardhat_PopupText: Equip the hard hat by dragging it into your Head slot.
DT_UIPopups.weight_PopupText: If you are carrying too much, it will affect your movement speed.
DT_UIPopups.traitscreen_PopupText: Select Positive and Negative traits for your character. Negative traits will add some challenges, but will give more points to spend on Positive traits.
DT_UIPopups.jobscreen_PopupText: Select a Job from the list.
DT_UIPopups.research_brain_PopupText: THINK: Click the brain to check if the item recipe is a logical solution. You only have to do this once to learn an item's recipe.
DT_UIPopups.medical_PopupText: You can quickly use available health items by accessing your doctor bag. Your doctor bag can also be accessed by holding the Health Screen key.
DT_UIPopups.benchupgrades_PopupText: You can upgrade your Crafting Bench if you have the right materials.
DT_UIPopups.newperk_PopupText: You leveled up a Skill! This has granted you a new Perk! You can view these in your Stats Screen.
DT_UIPopups.journalnotes_PopupText: Your journal notes are stored by location. Click on a location icon to view notes for that location.

DT_VideoSettings.Resolution_DisplayDescription: Adjust the pixel dimensions of the game. This should typically match your monitor resolution.
DT_VideoSettings.WindowMode_DisplayDescription: Selected which window mode you want the game to run in. Fullscreen will give the best performance, but may be more uncomfortable with dual-monitor setups.
DT_VideoSettings.MaxFPS_DisplayDescription: This value will force the game to run at a specific locked framerate. Lower locked framerate may help with performance.
DT_VideoSettings.Gameplay_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how aggressive CPU-based gameplay optimizations are activated.  Lowering this can help performance but may cause characters to appear to move with slight hitching or other visual defects.
DT_VideoSettings.ViewDistance_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how close to the camera objects will hide or lower their level of detail.
DT_VideoSettings.PostProcessing_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how detailed certain post-process effects appear. The quality of refraction and particles may be affected.
DT_VideoSettings.AntiAliasing_DisplayDescription: This will adjust how sharp, jagged or blurry edges of objects appear. Lower values or off will increase performance but create a rougher look.
DT_VideoSettings.Gamma_DisplayDescription: This will adjust the overall brightness of the game, but brighter values may wash out the intended look.
DT_VideoSettings.Textures_DisplayDescription: This will adjust the quality of textures. Higher values may use more video memory, and lower values will reduce that usage.
DT_VideoSettings.ResolutionScale_DisplayDescription: This will adjust the rendering scale of the game. Lowering this will make things appear more pixelated but may boost performance.
DT_VideoSettings.Foliage_DisplayDescription: This will affect the detail of foliage in the scene, when you manage to find the one patch of grass in the entire underground Facility.
DT_VideoSettings.Bloom_DisplayDescription: This will determine how much bloom is around bright light sources. If you prefer less bloom, turning this down may also darken the scene a bit.
DT_VideoSettings.Reflections_DisplayDescription: This will determine the quality of reflective surfaces in the world.
DT_VideoSettings.Shadows_DisplayDescription: This will determine the quality of shadows present in the world. Lowering this will help performance, but may cause the scene to look brighter than desired.
DT_VideoSettings.AntiAliasingMethod_DisplayDescription: This will determine what method is used for anti-aliasing if it is active. Some anti-aliasing modes may look smoother, but could also add ghosting effects, and some methods are more processor-heavy than others.
DT_VideoSettings.Effects_DisplayDescription: This will effect the quality of particles and some other details in the scene.
DT_VideoSettings.GlobalIllumination_DisplayDescription: This will greatly affect the quality of lighting. Setting this too low will completely remove shadows and lighting and is not recommended, but may increase performance.
DT_VideoSettings.VerticalSync_DisplayDescription: This will lock the game to the refresh rate of your monitor. If you experience screen-tearing, this may correct that issue.
DT_VideoSettings.ShowFPS_DisplayDescription: This will show the framerate on your screen when active.

DT_WeatherEvents.ColdSnap_ChatWarningMessage: A cold snap has crept in.
DT_WeatherEvents.BlackFog_ChatWarningMessage: The Black of Night falls upon the Facility...

ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_bolt_lodestone_ItemDescription: A bolt with otherworldly properties, capable of igniting targets, even through armor.
ItemTable_Craftables.bridge_t1_ItemDescription: A bridge made of wood, used for traversing pits big and small, with enough structural support.
ItemTable_Craftables.stove_4spots_ItemDescription: A carbon-lined stove with four stove-top spots for cooking multiple meals at once.
ItemTable_Craftables.tacklebox_ItemDescription: A chair built for one purpose: fishing.
ItemTable_Craftables.PlantFood_T2_ItemDescription: A complex plant food used to fertilize crops and help them grow rapidly.
ItemTable_Craftables.lodestone_cracked_ItemDescription: A composite Lodestone, forged from many scattered fragments, requiring intense heat to reanimate its arcane essence.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_void_ItemDescription: A container with multiple instances yet a singular repository.
ItemTable_Craftables.tramkey_ItemDescription: A crafted key, one-time use, made for accessing stations and other areas that are prohibited.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_yellow_ItemDescription: A curious yellow pigment, good for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.cushion_ItemDescription: A cushion for dampening falls. This will not prevent all ranges of fall damage.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_military_ItemDescription: A decent-sized crate, hauled here by the military.
ItemTable_Craftables.ElectricFan_ItemDescription: A deployable fan with spinning blades. Extremely dangerous when powered on.
ItemTable_Craftables.teleporter_pad_ItemDescription: A deployable gateway that can connect to another gateway - just about anywhere - as long as it's powered.
ItemTable_Craftables.SeeSaw_ItemDescription: A deployable jump pad that requires downward force on the opposite end.
ItemTable_Craftables.JumpPad_ItemDescription: A deployable pad that throws the user up at high velocity.
ItemTable_Craftables.sync_ItemDescription: A device for transmitting data from one brain to another, capable of syncing all journals, Compendium entries and recipes between scientists.
ItemTable_Craftables.PowerTimer_ItemDescription: A device placed on Power Sockets to restrict power during certain times of day and intervals.
ItemTable_Craftables.tmog_ItemDescription: A device that allows scientists to change the appearance of their gear as well as their body.
ItemTable_Craftables.Noisemaker_ItemDescription: A device that emits a beeping noise to attract enemies, then a damaging detonation.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_void_ItemFlavorText: A device that harnesses Dr. Janek's superpositional 'network' theory, permitting new additions to an entangled system via a little adiabatic slight of hand.
ItemTable_Craftables.walkietalkie_ItemDescription: A device used for communicating with other walkie-talkie holders at long distances. Hold in your hand to enable long-distance voice communication.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_disc_plasma_ItemDescription: A disc aflame with charged up plasma, exploding on contact.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_disc_lodestone_ItemDescription: A disc from another world, capable of igniting targets, even through armor.
ItemTable_Craftables.soupbowl_ItemDescription: A drinking receptacle for holding a large portion of soup.
ItemTable_Craftables.PestTeleporter_ItemDescription: A fantastic device capable of converting resources into freshly teleported Pests.
ItemTable_Craftables.armorstand_wood_F_ItemDescription: A fellow scientist who will wear whatever you want her to wear, as long as you ask nicely.
ItemTable_Craftables.armorstand_wood_M_ItemDescription: A fellow scientist who will wear whatever you want him to wear, as long as you ask nicely.
ItemTable_Craftables.xmastree_ItemDescription: A festive tree made from bits, baubles, and just a bit of holiday magic. Er, holiday science.
ItemTable_Craftables.inhibitor_exor_ItemDescription: A fetish that Exor are highly superstitious of, preventing them from appearing in the area when powered. This will not prevent assaults or portal storms.
ItemTable_Craftables.armor_stand_ItemDescription: A friendly skeleton, useful for displaying armor and other equipment.
ItemTable_Craftables.Lantern_ItemDescription: A handheld light source with an area of effect rather than a directed beam.
ItemTable_Craftables.binoculars_ItemDescription: A handy gadget for gazing long distances.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_ItemFlavorText: A hastily improvised piece of security spoofery, but no less impressive for it.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_t4_ItemDescription: A high-capacity, low footprint powered storage system larger inside than out.
ItemTable_Craftables.megalight_turret_ItemDescription: A high-powered, stationary tower capable of turning away or suppressing x-ray sensitive entities.
ItemTable_Craftables.detcord_ItemDescription: A high-speed fuse used for sending heat from one side to the other.
ItemTable_Craftables.Tripmine_t2_ItemDescription: A high-tier tripmine that detonates with incredible force when things cross its path.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_rocket_ItemDescription: A highly explosive self-propelled rocket with a single purpose.
ItemTable_Craftables.TeslaCoil_ItemDescription: A highly-charged electrical device that will zap anyone and anything that comes near it.
ItemTable_Craftables.scarecrow_symph_ItemDescription: A horn-based stationary weapon to turn away creatures from the fog. When powered, this may also attract a misty trader from time to time.
ItemTable_Craftables.fishtrap_ItemDescription: A jury-rigged device for catching fish. Requires bait to function and must be deployed on the surface of fishable water.
ItemTable_Craftables.battery_carbon_ItemDescription: A large battery that can store incoming electricity and provide that electricity when none is available.
ItemTable_Craftables.cauldron_ItemDescription: A large cauldron that, when filled, can be painted to colorize the glowing ink within.
ItemTable_Craftables.cookingpot_makeshift_ItemDescription: A large cooking pot made from... well, it's close enough.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_makeshift_t3_ItemDescriptio: A large crate made of heavy carbon.
ItemTable_Craftables.autosalvager_ItemDescription: A large machine that automatically salvages any items dropped into it.
ItemTable_Craftables.shelf_l_ItemDescription: A large shelf, capable of supporting large objects and containers.
ItemTable_Craftables.Ramp_ItemDescription: A large slanted ramp, strong enough to support vehicle movement.
ItemTable_Craftables.bridge_t2_ItemDescription: A larger bridge, strong and wide enough for vehicles, with enough structural support.
ItemTable_Craftables.grimoire_ItemDescription: A leathery, ostentatious tome consisting of random illustrations, inane symbology, and some ink that occasionally plays a few simple tricks of the light.
ItemTable_Craftables.toilet_makeshift_ItemDescription: A less technologically advanced solution to an everyday problem.
ItemTable_Craftables.decon_shower_ItemDescription: A less-than-private shower that swiftly cleanses all dirt, grime, blood and radiation from an individual who stands in it.
ItemTable_Craftables.mugnade_ItemDescription: A makeshift, throwable fragmentation grenade that detonates on impact.
ItemTable_Craftables.battery_quantum_ItemDescription: A massive battery that can store incoming electricity and provide that electricity when none is available. This battery is also shielded and will block the effects of otherwordly parasites.
ItemTable_Craftables.lever_ItemDescription: A mechnical lever that can toggle whether or not power is allowed to flow through it.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_makeshift_t2_ItemDescriptio: A medium crate made of reinforced wood.
ItemTable_Craftables.storage_hazardcrate_ItemDescription: A medium-sized crate for storing hazardous materials without leaking any radiation.
ItemTable_Craftables.shelf_m_ItemDescription: A medium-sized shelf, large enough for bigger crates and objects.
ItemTable_Craftables.battery_industrial_ItemDescription: A mid-sized battery that can store incoming electricity and provide that electricity when none is available.
ItemTable_Craftables.mushroomfarm_ItemDescription: A mildewed and rot-heavy arrangement for the growing of mushrooms. Best placed near stagnant water and away from bright lights.
ItemTable_Craftables.beacon_ItemDescription: A nameable positional marker unconstrained by conventional occlusion.
ItemTable_Craftables.crate_charging_ItemDescription: A powered storage unit that gradually charges any battery-powered items within.
ItemTable_Craftables.beehive_ItemDescription: A quaint little home for a hundred or so busy little friends. Requires nearby nourishment to function.
ItemTable_Craftables.inhibitor_order_ItemDescription: A radio scrambler that confuses Order troop communication, preventing them from appearing in the area when powered. This will not prevent assaults or portal storms.
ItemTable_Craftables.238_ItemDescription: A radiological compound of foreign alien metals and otherworldly shavings from arcane instrumentation. There's a lot of fissile energy contained inside of this small package.
ItemTable_Craftables.healingkit_ItemDescription: A re-useable, throwable healing device which provides healing in a radius. Requires charging between use.
ItemTable_Craftables.cart_aquarium_ItemDescription: A robust, illuminated Platform Cart which will preserve fish for a much longer duration.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_rocket_cluster_ItemDescription: A rocket filled with a chaotic cluster of explosive grenades.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_rocket_penetrator_ItemDescription: A rocket that trades explosive power for unmitigated penetration through multiple targets.
ItemTable_Craftables.inhibitor_pest_ItemDescription: A scarecrow that scares off Pests in an area, preventing them from appearing when powered. This will not prevent assaults or portal storms.
ItemTable_Craftables.pestdummy_ItemDescription: A scrappy Pest look-alike while serving no real function at all.
ItemTable_Craftables.parchment_ItemDescription: A sheet of parchment, imbued with the strange chemicals found amidst Gatekeeper belongings.
ItemTable_Craftables.Tripmine_ItemDescription: A short-range makeshift tripmine that sprays deadly projectiles when tripped. Can be refilled with more screws.
ItemTable_Craftables.Bed_Tier1_ItemDescription: A simple bed that's comfier than a couch, but not much more than that. Can be used as a respawn point.
ItemTable_Craftables.PlantFood_T1_ItemDescription: A simple plant food used to fertilize crops and help them grow more quickly.
ItemTable_Craftables.wall_light_ItemDescription: A simple, sturdy lamp that can be mounted on walls.
ItemTable_Craftables.fieldbattery_ItemDescription: A single-use energy cell filled with a uniquely anteversian substance, aerosolized and absorbable by most battery-powered device for quick recharges.
ItemTable_Craftables.barricade_office_ItemDescription: A small barricade made of... whatever was lying around.
ItemTable_Craftables.battery_makeshift_ItemDescription: A small battery that can store incoming electricity and provide that electricity when none is available.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_makeshift_ItemDescription: A small crate out of wood and plastic found around the office.
ItemTable_Craftables.ChargingStation_ItemDescription: A small deployable device that restores the battery of any item.
ItemTable_Craftables.GlowStick_ItemDescription: A small hand-held and throwable light.
ItemTable_Craftables.ItemStand_Fancy_ItemDescription: A small metal-trimmed stand for displaying your favorite items.
ItemTable_Craftables.shelf_s_ItemDescription: A small shelf, large enough for small crates and some other objects.
ItemTable_Craftables.Ramp_Small_ItemDescription: A small slanted ramp, mostly for mantling and ascending, but may have other uses too.
ItemTable_Craftables.ItemStand_Wall_ItemDescription: A small stand for displaying your favorite items, mountable on walls.
ItemTable_Craftables.ItemStand_ItemDescription: A small stand for displaying your favorite items.
ItemTable_Craftables.makeshift_flashlight_ItemDescription: A small, crude flashlight. The battery is poor, but it'll do.
ItemTable_Craftables.trap_shock_ItemDescription: A sophisticated scientific stunning device, deployed to kill or ensnare. Reuseable, but requires recharging when depleted.
ItemTable_Craftables.splint_ItemDescription: A sturdy support for reducing the impact of bone injuries and aids in healing the bone more rapidly.
ItemTable_Craftables.cart_hazard_ItemDescription: A sturdy, illuminated Platform Cart built for carrying a small number of hazardous materials. Blocks most of the radiation from the items inside but is not safe as long-term storage.
ItemTable_Craftables.thecure_ItemDescription: A syringe containing the cure for IS-0102.
ItemTable_Craftables.moisture_teleporter_ItemDescription: A teleportation device capable of periodically pulling clean water from the air and sending it to nearby liquid containers.
ItemTable_Craftables.net_ItemDescription: A throwable net, great for temporarily trapping small creatures, leaving them vulnerable. This net might even confuse a larger creature for a short while.
ItemTable_Craftables.dropshield_ItemDescription: A throwable shield that protects from harm and allows projectiles to pass through one side of it.
ItemTable_Craftables.PestWheel_ItemDescription: A type of Pest Cage that allows the tamed Pest to temporarily generate electrical energy.
ItemTable_Craftables.database_ItemDescription: A unified distribution-transport terminal able to query and call-up items from storage in the vicinity, and various other applications. Requires power.
ItemTable_Craftables.cart_ItemDescription: A useful storage cart, for carrying large amounts of goods from one place to another.
ItemTable_Craftables.bridge_hardlight_small_ItemDescription: A very advanced energy bridge, powered by lasers and able to extend across great distances.
ItemTable_Craftables.oven_ItemDescription: A very fancy oven for baking things.
ItemTable_Craftables.barricade_carbon_ItemDescription: A very strong barricade made of high-tech materials, raising a secondary shield when powered.
ItemTable_Craftables.pumpkin_carved_ItemDescription: A well-executed Jack-o-lantern, all things considered. Carving can be changed by using a knife and color can be changed with paint.
ItemTable_Craftables.bridge_hardlight_large_ItemDescription: A wide and very advanced energy bridge, powered by lasers and able to extend across great distances.
ItemTable_Craftables.barrel_crafted_ItemDescription: A wooden barrel crafted from reinforced wood and a lot of rustic ambition.
ItemTable_Craftables.plugboard_ItemDescription: Allows connecting even more devices into a single Power Socket. Can be mounted on almost any surface.
ItemTable_Craftables.plugstrips_ItemDescription: Allows connecting multiple devices into a single Power Socket. Can be mounted on almost any surface.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_quill_ItemDescription: An Exor quill with a bit of homing science to spice things up.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_acidbolt_ItemDescription: An acid-coated bolt that melts away armor.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_black_ItemDescription: An ad hoc black pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_blue_ItemDescription: An ad hoc blue pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_brown_ItemDescription: An ad hoc brown pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_cyan_ItemDescription: An ad hoc cyan pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_green_ItemDescription: An ad hoc green pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_lime_ItemDescription: An ad hoc lime pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_orange_ItemDescription: An ad hoc orange pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_pink_ItemDescription: An ad hoc pink pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_purple_ItemDescription: An ad hoc purple pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_red_ItemDescription: An ad hoc red pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_white_ItemDescription: An ad hoc white pigment, but good enough for coloring items like barricades and bridges.
ItemTable_Craftables.Bed_Tier3_ItemDescription: An advanced bed that's much comfier than a couch, heals sleepers and insulates against enemies. Can be used as a respawn point.
ItemTable_Craftables.Bed_Tier2_ItemDescription: An advanced bed that's much comfier than a couch. Can be used as a respawn point.
ItemTable_Craftables.neutrino_emitter_ItemDescription: An advanced, laser-powered device that counteracts the intensity of radiation in a given area.
ItemTable_Craftables.distribution_pad_ItemDescription: An electrical pad that teleports items of a similar type into nearby storage containers.
ItemTable_Craftables.charging_pad_ItemDescription: An electrically charged pad that will instantly charge the items of anyone who stands on it.
ItemTable_Craftables.electrongrenade_ItemDescription: An electrifying grenade that sends crystalline shards in all directions and can stun enemies.
ItemTable_Craftables.HotwireKit_SUV_ItemDescription: An electronic device to allow GATE SUVs to become driveable.
ItemTable_Craftables.HotwireKit_SecurityCart_ItemDescription: An electronic device to allow GATE Security Carts to become driveable.
ItemTable_Craftables.exercisebike_ItemDescription: An exercycle that simultaneously increases sprinting fitness and generates useable power.
ItemTable_Craftables.AlienThermite_ItemDescription: An explosive charge made from alien residue.
ItemTable_Craftables.thermite_molotov_ItemDescription: An explosive charge made from alien residue.
ItemTable_Craftables.PlantFood_T3_ItemDescription: An incredible plant food used to supercharge your plants and make them grow at the speed of light.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_glitch_ItemDescription: An incredible, digital paint that seems to peer right through the substance of our world, into information itself.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t3_ItemFlavorText: An unusual key to an outlandish kingdom.
ItemTable_Craftables.cart_t2_ItemDescription: An upgrade to the regular Platform Cart featuring built-in headlights.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_dw_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure fish of the Darkwater Reservoir.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_ice_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the Frigid Queenfish and other icy swimmers.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_crab_gem_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the Gem Crab.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_silk_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the Silken Betta.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_is98_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the anomalous creature, IS-0098.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_radfish_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the chaotic Radfish.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_antefish_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the common Antefish.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_umbra_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the corrupted Penumbra.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_eel_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the electrifying Gutfish Eel.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_portal_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the elusive Portal Fish.
ItemTable_Craftables.bait_moonfish_ItemDescription: Bait to help lure the nocturnal Moon Fish.
ItemTable_Craftables.toilet_makeshift_ItemFlavorText: Better than soiling yourself, at least.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_ItemDescription: Clever device for hacking high-security keypads. Should be able to hack Clearance Level 1 keypads.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t2_ItemDescription: Clever device for hacking high-security keypads. Should be able to hack Clearance Level 2 keypads and below.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t3_ItemDescription: Clever device for hacking high-security keypads. Should be able to hack Clearance Level 3 keypads and below.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t4_ItemDescription: Clever device for hacking high-security keypads. Should be able to hack Clearance Level 4 keypads and below.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t5_ItemDescription: Clever device for hacking high-security keypads. Should be able to hack Clearance Level 5 keypads and below.
ItemTable_Craftables.Gatekey_ItemDescription: Clever device for hacking high-security keypads. Should be able to hack Clearance Level 6 keypads and below.
ItemTable_Craftables.thecure_ItemFlavorText: Could it be? Is this really it? Inject yourself and find out.
ItemTable_Craftables.syringe_ItemDescription: Directly restores lost health over a period of time. This can also revive downed allies, but is not necessary. Does NOT stop bleeding or cure any other ailments.
ItemTable_Craftables.megalight_t2_ItemFlavorText: Dr. Sukov's improved 'OX' design takes its name from the 'Over-clocked X-rays' created by the enhanced beam condensor.
ItemTable_Craftables.storagecrate_t4_ItemFlavorText: Dr. Tengku's discovery of a new form of bosonic matter led, ultimately, to several thermodynamic 'laws' being demoted to something closer to guidelines.
ItemTable_Craftables.crate_charging_ItemFlavorText: Electromagnetic induction is the closest thing to magic available in our universe. - Dr. J. Ross
ItemTable_Craftables.laser_emitter_ItemDescription: Emits a powerful laser with many uses, including reflection, powering certain objects, and damage.
ItemTable_Craftables.fieldbattery_ItemFlavorText: Exactly how this device works is still under investigation, if only you had more time. That won't stop you from using it, however.
ItemTable_Craftables.PestTrap_ItemFlavorText: Feed trapped pests certain foods to tame yourself a spiky pet.
ItemTable_Craftables.ammo_explosivecartridge_ItemDescription: Highly explosive ammo built for impact detonation.
ItemTable_Craftables.syringe_ItemFlavorText: Hold still, this won't hurt a bit.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t4_ItemFlavorText: If there was anything more 'jugaad' than this field-fabricated, high-security instrusion device constructed on successive layers of equally improvised hackery, you'd like to see it.
ItemTable_Craftables.benchpress_ItemDescription: Induction barbells that improve strength while generating electrical power.
ItemTable_Craftables.wall_light_ItemFlavorText: It probably won't keep the monsters away, but at least you'll feel cozy.
ItemTable_Craftables.laser_turret_ItemFlavorText: LASER stands for 'Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation'. For your purposes, it simply means protection.
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t5_ItemFlavorText: Not much can stand up to this pocket-sized pan-system hole puncher. Admit it, you've impressed yourself.
ItemTable_Craftables.ClothRope_ItemDescription: Place on ledges to create a downward slide.
ItemTable_Craftables.laser_converter_ItemDescription: Receives laser input and outputs power. Can be used for long-distance power transmission.
ItemTable_Craftables.laser_collector_ItemDescription: Recharges laser devices when powered by a laser input.
ItemTable_Craftables.laser_reflector_ItemDescription: Redirects a laser in another direction, but diminishes its power in the process.
ItemTable_Craftables.syringe_acid_ItemDescription: Reduces radiation someone receives, as well as reduce radiation they currently have.
ItemTable_Craftables.cart_aquarium_ItemFlavorText: Science asks questions. In this case, the question was: 'Why not?'
ItemTable_Craftables.benchpress_ItemFlavorText: Some pain, some gains, some mains power.
ItemTable_Craftables.laser_prism_ItemDescription: Splits a laser into 3 weaker lasers.
ItemTable_Craftables.decon_shower_ItemFlavorText: The Radiation and Impurity Neutralization Shower
ItemTable_Craftables.238_ItemFlavorText: The alloy warmly hums in your palm, which you should probably not experience too often due to its highly radioactive nature.
ItemTable_Craftables.sync_ItemFlavorText: The ethics are something left to be debated by better minds than ours, and hopefully not ones found in jars.
ItemTable_Craftables.cart_t2_ItemFlavorText: The list of things you can push around with this cart now includes: Darkness.
ItemTable_Craftables.toilet_portal_ItemDescription: The most technologically advanced solution to an everyday problem. Requires lasers to function.
ItemTable_Craftables.parchment_ItemFlavorText: The paper seems to have accepted the basic ink, and the words or runes inscribed are simply your best guess. And yet...
ItemTable_Craftables.cauldron_ItemFlavorText: The properties of this inky liquid are still largely uncertain, and drinking it is simply out of the question. I made that clear to Dr. Stern. In the meantime, we'll focus on its immense affinity when exposed to various dyes. That little lightshow ought to keep him out of trouble, if only for a bit. - Dr. Derek Manse
ItemTable_Craftables.keypad_hacker_t2_ItemFlavorText: This device sits on the same spectrum of essential functionality as a battering ram or breaching charges, but makes considerably less mess and noise.
ItemTable_Craftables.teleporter_pad_ItemFlavorText: This lodegate is achieved through a combination of hard science and a different, perhaps spongier science.
ItemTable_Craftables.gastromeds_ItemDescription: This makeshift medicine is sure to cure (most) upset stomachs.
ItemTable_Craftables.AlienThermite_ItemFlavorText: This will burn through just about anything.
ItemTable_Craftables.thermite_molotov_ItemFlavorText: This will burn through just about anything.
ItemTable_Craftables.grimoire_ItemFlavorText: To be quite frank, this object has no place in your scientific arsenal, but it feels heavier than it should, and you shouldn't get rid of it until you get to the bottom of this strange phenomenon.
ItemTable_Craftables.megalight_t2_ItemDescription: Ultra-high energy portable EM device, designed to repel or disperse the most powerful x-ray sensitive entities.
ItemTable_Craftables.megalight_turret_t2_ItemDescription: Ultra-powerful, stationary tower designed to repel or disperse the most hardened x-ray sensitive entities.
ItemTable_Craftables.fryingpan_makeshift_ItemDescription: Used for frying up food, mostly.
ItemTable_Craftables.megalight_ItemDescription: Very powerful hand-held device, capable of turning away or suppressing x-ray sensitive entities.
ItemTable_Craftables.toilet_portal_ItemFlavorText: We don't talk about where it goes.
ItemTable_Craftables.paint_red_ItemFlavorText: What's red and smells like blue paint?
ItemTable_Craftables.detcord_ItemFlavorText: When 'bang' is the word of the day.
ItemTable_Craftables.PersonalTeleporter_ItemDescription: When synced with a Crafting Bench, this device can teleport the user there once per charge.
ItemTable_Craftables.xmastree_ItemFlavorText: You can choose to keep it up after January 1st, but no one around here is going to defend that decision.
ItemTable_Craftables.exercisebike_ItemFlavorText: You can keep your fancy hamster wheel. - Dr. Thule
ItemTable_Craftables.Lantern_ItemFlavorText: You could be burning the midnight oil with this, but it was designed to run on electricity instead.

ItemTable_Deployables.Container_LootSpillBag_ItemDescription: A bag created when a container was destroyed. You shouldn't be seeing this.
ItemTable_Deployables.Banner_Order_ItemDescription: A banner that is far older than its wear and tear would convey.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Barrel_ItemDescription: A barrel that can hold a lot of liquid.
ItemTable_Deployables.Bench_Locker_ItemDescription: A basic bench for sitting on.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_ItemDescription: A beautiful glowing plant from somewhere in the Anteverse.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_blue_ItemDescriptio: A blue variant of the beautiful Antelight plant.
ItemTable_Deployables.Bed_Res_01_ItemDescription: A capacious and highly comfortable sleep space.
ItemTable_Deployables.Armchair_Modern_01_ItemDescription: A chair as harsh as its angles, but very sleek.
ItemTable_Deployables.Chair_Beanbag_01_ItemDescription: A comfy blob to sit upon.
ItemTable_Deployables.Armchair_Vintage_ItemDescription: A comfy old armchair with a pattern almost as distinct as its odor.
ItemTable_Deployables.table_kotatsu_ItemDescription: A comfy table with a cozy futon covering its base, keeping some of the cold at bay.
ItemTable_Deployables.Crate_HGatekeeper_ItemDescription: A crate surrounded and sealed by mysticism and heavy metal.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_DiningTable_Vintage_02_ItemDe: A creaky old dining table showing a bit of wear and tear.
ItemTable_Deployables.ChurchPew_Salem_ItemDescription: A crudely carved church pew with a distinctly chaotic symbol etched into the sides.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CementBagWall_Block_ItemDescr: A deployable barricade made of sturdy bags of cement mix.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CementBagWall_Corner_ItemDesc: A deployable barricade made of sturdy bags of cement mix.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CementBagWall_Curve_ItemDescr: A deployable barricade made of sturdy bags of cement mix.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CementBagWall_HalfCurve_ItemD: A deployable barricade made of sturdy bags of cement mix.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CementBagWall_Straight_ItemDe: A deployable barricade made of sturdy bags of cement mix.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Barricade_Half_ItemDescriptio: A deployable barricade made of wooden planks.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Barricade_Window_ItemDescript: A deployable barricade made of wooden planks.
ItemTable_Deployables.Leyak_Containment_ItemDescription: A deployable device capable of capturing and containing IS-0091, when X-rays are used in proximity to the containment chamber. Requires power and stability upkeep to maintain safe containment status.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Couch_fancy_01_ItemDescriptio: A fancy couch, long enough for sleeping.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Cot_Military_ItemDescription: A folding military cot. Somewhat comfortable.
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_half_window_ItemDescription: A full-height, half-width paintable office cubicle with a window.
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_half_ItemDescription: A full-height, half-width paintable office cubicle.
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_full_window_ItemDescription: A full-sized paintable office cubicle with a window.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_TableCard_ItemDescription: A fuzzy table fit for any dingy lounge.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_GRN_ItemDescription: A green variant of the beautiful Antelight plant.
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_half_half_ItemDescription: A half-width, half-height paintable office cubicle.
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_half_nowindow_ItemDescription: A half-width, three-quarter height paintable office cubicle.
ItemTable_Deployables.bed_garden_ItemDescription: A hand-crafted lounge bed adorned with snakes. It follows an ancient stylization but it feels as though it was made just recently.
ItemTable_Deployables.Crate_HInquisitor_ItemDescription: A heavy, ornamented crate used to transport gear and equipment.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_DiningTable_Fancy_02_ItemDesc: A huge dining table made of strong, expensive wood.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_WaterCooler_ItemDescription: A jug-based water cooler, great for holding and dispensing liquids.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_FilingCabinet_Large_ItemDescr: A large filing cabinet. It should allow for storage of many items.
ItemTable_Deployables.Freezer_ItemDescription: A large icebox capable of putting stored food items in complete stasis. Due to the increased thermal insulation, storage space is reduced from that of a normal refrigerator.
ItemTable_Deployables.Desk_Lab_01_ItemDescription: A large multi-drawer desk from a laboratory.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_DiningTable_Vintage_01_ItemDe: A large, firm but aged dining table.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CoffeeTable_Fancy_01_ItemDesc: A low table of medium size and high fancy.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_CoffeeTable_01_ItemDescriptio: A low table of medium size.
ItemTable_Deployables.Couch_Fancy_L_ItemDescription: A massive couch for seating many lounging scientists.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_FilingCabinet_Huge_ItemDescri: A massive filing cabinet. You can fit a lot of things inside this.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_DiningTable_Fancy_01_ItemDesc: A massive oval dining table of a fancy make.
ItemTable_Deployables.table_order_ItemDescription: A massive table, weighed down by years of tradition.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_DiscTurret_ItemDescription: A mechanical turret that automatically launches deadly discs at trespassers.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_FilingCabinet_Medium_ItemDesc: A medium filing cabinet. This will definitely allow you to store some stuff.
ItemTable_Deployables.Bench_Park_ItemDescription: A park bench taken from a park, presumably.
ItemTable_Deployables.Chair_Fancy_04_ItemDescription: A piece of furniture that is more cushion than chair.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_pink_ItemDescriptio: A pink variant of the beautiful Antelight plant.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_MakeshiftStove_ItemDescriptio: A portable, deployable stovetop with two cooktops.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_VinePlant_ItemDescription: A protective plant that slows enemies who walk over its vines.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_red_ItemDescription: A red variant of the beautiful Antelight plant.
ItemTable_Deployables.Fridge_Hazard_ItemDescription: A refrigerator capable of blocking all radiation emitted from inside. Great for storing all kinds of irradiated food-like objects. Due to the increased radiation shielding, this fridge has slightly less storage space. When plugged in, the refrigerator will keep items cool.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_RoundTable_Office_01_ItemDesc: A round table from an office area.
ItemTable_Deployables.Crate_HMusicBox_ItemDescription: A seemingly organic crate, slightly warm to the touch and emitting a soft fog accompanied by a thrumming at the edge of perception.
ItemTable_Deployables.Chest_Vintage_ItemDescription: A sizeable storage chest from another era.
ItemTable_Deployables.bench_torii_ItemDescription: A slice of minimalism, a dash of utility, and a seat upon which to sit.
ItemTable_Deployables.Painting_Landscape_Fancy_ItemFlavorText: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
ItemTable_Deployables.Painting_Landscape_ItemFlavorText: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
ItemTable_Deployables.Painting_Landscape_Large_Fancy_ItemFlavo: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
