ItemTable_Deployables.Painting_Landscape_Large_ItemFlavorText: A small "H.F." is scrawled hastily in the corner.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_FilingCabinet_Small_ItemDescr: A small filing cabinet. It might work as some kind of storage.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Medkit_ItemDescription: A small medical kit, mountable on most surfaces.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Fridge_ItemDescription: A spacious, somewhat radiation-resistant container with one exceptionally heavy downside. When plugged in, the refrigerator will keep items cool.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_RGB_ItemDescription: A special variant of the beautiful Antelight plant with ever-changing coloration.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Magazine_Stand_ItemDescriptio: A stand for holding magazines, probably taken from a city street.
ItemTable_Deployables.Lamp_Standing_Office_01_ItemDescription: A standing lamp for illuminating the darkest corners of the cubicles.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Stool_Office_01_ItemDescripti: A stool from an office area.
ItemTable_Deployables.Crate_HSecurity_ItemDescription: A strong, reinforced crate with an exquisite paint job.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Barricade_Full_ItemDescriptio: A stronger deployable barricade made of wooden planks and what-not.
ItemTable_Deployables.Cabinet_Lab_01_ItemDescription: A sturdy cabinet from a laboratory.
ItemTable_Deployables.Table_Side_01_ItemFlavorText: A table that looks so great, some might say it never should have moved from the spot you found it in.
ItemTable_Deployables.Bookshelf_Office_Tall_ItemDescription: A tall bookshelf fit for any tall office.
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_full_nowindow_ItemDescription: A three-quarter height paintable office cubicle.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Couch_Office_Long_01_ItemDesc: A three-seater leather couch, long enough for sleeping.
ItemTable_Deployables.chair_zabuton_ItemDescription: A traditional cushion, perfect for a nice kneel.
ItemTable_Deployables.TrashCan_Park_ItemDescription: A trash bin from a city park somewhere.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_space_ItemDescripti: A unique variant of the beautiful Antelight plant overtaken by a mesmeric infection.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_ConferenceTable_Office_ItemDe: A very large conference table, best known for holding employees hostage.
ItemTable_Deployables.Armchair_Tall_Fancy_ItemDescription: A very tall, not-so-comfy leather armchair.
ItemTable_Deployables.Stool_Arcade_ItemDescription: A vibrant stool from an arcade.
ItemTable_Deployables.Banner_Gatekeeper_ItemDescription: A war standard emblazoned with a semi-familiar sigil.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_WaterFilter_ItemDescription: A water filter that fits atop a barrel to purify your liquid.
ItemTable_Deployables.WarmingDrawer_ItemDescription: A way to warm things up and speed up the decay process on food. Requires power.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Couch_Office_Medium_01_ItemDe: A well-used comfy leather couch for two.
ItemTable_Deployables.Chair_Corner_01_ItemDescription: A wide armchair that fits nicely just about nowhere.
ItemTable_Deployables.Aquarium_Large_ItemDescription: An aquatic storage environment for a range of marine specimens. While powered, this container completely preserves the fish within it.
ItemTable_Deployables.bench_garden_ItemDescription: An elegant carved bench, with a bit of moss that might double as basic cushioning.
ItemTable_Deployables.bench_order_ItemDescription: An enormous bench, chiseled by heritage.
ItemTable_Deployables.Cabinet_Vintage_ItemDescription: An older cabinet, but still in decent condition.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Antelight_orange_ItemDescript: An orange variant of the beautiful Antelight plant.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_GaseousNest_ItemDescription: An organic nest full of bubbling gasses. It seems to react to being touched.
ItemTable_Deployables.Crate_HOrnate_ItemDescription: An ornamented crate used for transporting valuable artefacts.
ItemTable_Deployables.IS0018_ItemDescription: An ornate high-backed seat embossed with pentagraphic symbols that is, for some reason, perpetually damp.
ItemTable_Deployables.Table_Arcade_ItemDescription: An oval table from an arcade.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_LDesk_01_ItemDescription: Average L shaped office desk. Might make a good barricade?
ItemTable_Deployables.cubicle_full_ItemFlavorText: Banality now comes in all the colors of the rainbow.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_GardenPlot_ItemDescription: Deploy in a well-lit, temperature stable location to grow food. Provides 1 grow plot.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_GardenPlot_Round_ItemDescript: Deploy in a well-lit, temperature stable location to grow food. Provides 1 grow plot.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_GardenPlot_Medium_ItemDescrip: Deploy in a well-lit, temperature stable location to grow food. Provides 4 grow plots, and consumes water at a reduced rate.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_GardenPlot_Large_ItemDescript: Deploy in a well-lit, temperature stable location to grow food. Provides 8 grow plots, and consumes water much more efficiently.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Desk_02_ItemDescription: Desk with a hole in the back. Might make a good view port when stacked.
ItemTable_Deployables.IS0018_ItemFlavorText: Given that the subject has been responsible for the - apparent - disappearance of a fully equipped TR team and a key member of the research staff, I am officially suspending field research on IS-0018 until its operation and purpose is better understood. ~ T. R. Enderson
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Table_Cafeteria_ItemDescripti: Great for sitting around and eating lunch with your pals. Well, before all this happened.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Fridge_ItemFlavorText: Is this thing made of lead?! It's not, obviously, but it sure feels like it. In fact, the heaviest aspect of a refrigerator is the compressor and housing to the fridge itself. The insulation is somewhat heavy as well, but that hardly registers in terms of the sheer back-breaking weight of everything else it's comprised of. Either way, the gravity of this object is sure to weigh on you for quite some time.
ItemTable_Deployables.Fridge_Hazard_ItemFlavorText: Is this thing made of lead?! Mostly.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Desk_01_ItemDescription: Just your average office desk. Might make a good barricade?
ItemTable_Deployables.Leyak_Containment_ItemFlavorText: Research into the exact nature of IS-0091's consciousness has, thus far, been inconclusive. But if it were capable of emotion, then it's at least conceivable the creature would feel flattered at the effort you've expended to contain it. Or it may simply feel vengeful. Either way, containment... is containment.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Desk_Executive_01_ItemFlavorT: Someone important once used this. Well... Not anymore!
ItemTable_Deployables.Banner_Gatekeeper_ItemFlavorText: The Gatekeepers hold that the adjusted GATE rune upon this banner is imbued with protective potency. If this process occured within a GATE facility, it was not documented.
ItemTable_Deployables.Banner_Order_ItemFlavorText: There are no special attributes to this banner. It is as plain as it appears; dyed fabric, inlaid with gold or a gold-like material. Spectroscopy may yield results of form, but not of function.
ItemTable_Deployables.Deployable_Couch_Office_Long_01_ItemFlav: You could probably get a terrible night's sleep on this.

ItemTable_Deployables_CraftingBenches.Deployable_Bench_Cooking_ItemDescription: A large two-sided station that allows both the creation of food recipes and the preparing of fish.
ItemTable_Deployables_CraftingBenches.Deployable_Bench_Upgrade_ItemDescription: A powerful, multi-purpose tooling and machine station for upgrades and refits.
ItemTable_Deployables_CraftingBenches.Deployable_Bench_Repair_ItemDescription: Allows repairing and salvaging of items.
ItemTable_Deployables_CraftingBenches.Deployable_Bench_Ammo_ItemDescription: Conveyer belts and presses, working together seamlessly to create ammunition for firearms.
ItemTable_Deployables_CraftingBenches.Deployable_Bench_Crafting_ItemDescriptio: Primary crafting apparatus. Allows crafting of more advanced recipes and creates a safer home space.
ItemTable_Deployables_CraftingBenches.Deployable_Bench_Cooking_ItemFlavorText: Waiting on its first Michelin star.

ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_witch_ItemDescription: A Wiccan warrior in bobblehead form.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_jotun_ItemDescription: A bobblehead as silent as the real thing.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_leyak_ItemDescription: A bobblehead that may or may not disappear on you any minute.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_leyak_b_ItemDescription: A chilling bobblehead to stare at as long as you wish.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.windchime_exor_ItemDescription: A collection of dangling bones, colorful feathers and other totems not made by human hands.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_flathill_ItemDescription: A colorful playmat with roads, a town hall, and an arcade! Wow!
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Sign_ItemDescription: A customizable sign, placeable almost anywhere.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_lamogi_ItemDescription: A digital creature crafted by an unknown artisan.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_oval_01_ItemDescription: A fancy rug with an oblong shape.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_abe_ItemDescription: A fitting figuration of Dr. Abraham Stern.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.holly_01_ItemDescription: A garland of holly, for the festive physicist.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_exor_ItemDescription: A hand-crafted figurine of IS-0184, complete with luminescent paint!
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Toolbox_Plant_ItemDescription: A hardy toolbox used by the best and brightest, in the deepest and darkest places of the GATE Cascade Research Facility.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.device_garden_ItemDescription: A highly intricate device of ambiguous origins.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_train_ItemDescription: A lifelike physical diagram of IS-0138!
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_sec_ItemDescription: A member of the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.taxidermy_pest_ItemDescription: A mounted specimen of Anterverse II's hoppiest export.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.wallmount_exor_ItemFlavorText: A permanent reminder of your primal side.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_garden_bird_02_ItemDescription: A petrified bird from noble lands.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_hastaboot_ItemDescription: A realistic reliquary for an almost-ally.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_rectangle_01_ItemDescription: A rug with one side a bit longer than the other side. Peculiar.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_arcade_ItemDescription: A rug with some real pizzazz.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_larvabig_ItemDescription: A sculpture of a big chunky larva.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.glowtulip_ItemDescription: A shimmering flower that illuminates the surrounding area.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_torii_ItemDescription: A simplistic and elegant woven floor covering.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Sign_Small_ItemDescription: A small customizable sign with a rustic vibe.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_lamogi_ItemFlavorText: A small monument to intersecting forces of the arcane - or the arcade.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_mat_01_ItemDescription: A small rug. Some might even call it a welcome mat.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.taxidermy_electropest_ItemFlavorText: A small shrine to your prowess, and the cybernetic work of Abe Stern.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_torii_jizo_ItemDescription: A small statue offering protection to the weary traveler.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_darkwaterbeast_ItemDescription: A small statuette that manages to capture the insatiable essence of this Darkwater beast.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_manse_ItemDescription: A striking likeness of the GATE Cascade Research Facility's erstwhile Research Director.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.christmaslights_01_ItemDescription: A string of jolly Christmas lights to deck the halls and the laboratories.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_comp_ItemDescription: A stunning 1:16 scale replica of IS-0064!
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.taxidermy_volatilepest_ItemDescription: A tastefully mounted pest of the volatile variety.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.PlantRope_ItemDescription: A tenacious plant from an Anteverse. Can be placed on ledges to create a ladder of sorts.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.cookbook_ItemDescription: A tome containing generations of cooking experience which aids nearby chefs in learning.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_square_01_ItemDescription: A very square rug for someone with a very square personality.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.windchime_exor_ItemFlavorText: A vessel for meaning, but the exact significance evades you.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.desklamp_elegant_ItemDescription: A well-meaning desk lamp. Can be turned on and off.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_larvabigorange_ItemDescription: A work of orange-hued larval art.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_larva_ItemDescription: A wormish figure of unknown provenance.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_sniper_ItemDescription: An evocation of an Order Sagittari.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bed_order_ItemDescription: An exquisitely Spartan bedroll, rolled with discipline.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_forklift_ItemDescription: An exquisitely-detailed GATE Cascade Research Facility forklift!
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_janet_ItemDescription: An imitative image of Dr. Janet Ross.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.figurine_watercooler_ItemDescription: An incredible replication of a GATE Cascade Research Facility watercooler.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Sconce_ItemDescription: An old lamp that can be mounted on walls.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.rug_order_ItemDescription: An ornate dark rug with inlaced gold.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_exor_armored_ItemDescription: Anteverse II's apex predator, but rather tame in this form.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.wallmount_exormonk_ItemDescription: Anteverse II's most evasive entity, locked in place forever.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_security_bot_ItemDescription: GATE's finest mobile security force in harmless miniature.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.taxidermy_volatilepest_ItemFlavorText: Irradiated in life, resplendent in death.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.glowtulip_ItemFlavorText: It appears to have absorbed some sort of ancient energy.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_leyak_ItemFlavorText: It has 1 / 3 imprinted on the bottom of the base.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_leyak_b_ItemFlavorText: It has 2 / 3 imprinted on the bottom of the base.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bed_order_ItemFlavorText: It was this or something ultra-opulent, but given how grumpy these guys are, it's really no surprise at all.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Deployable_DeskLamp_01_ItemDescription: Just a basic desk lamp. Can be turned on and off.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_order_ItemDescription: One of the devout Order infantry.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.bobblehead_sniper_ItemFlavorText: The Order's secretive sharpshooters would feel highly conflicted by this manifestation of the flesh, given the legendary intensity of their gnostic beliefs.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.wallmount_exor_ItemDescription: The head of an Exor attached to a robust wall mount.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_darkwaterbeast_ItemFlavorText: The real creature was once this size, if only for a brief time.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.ReaperSigil_ItemDescription: There's something not quite right with the hewn stone and aged metal the sigil is carved from, if it is indeed carved at all.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Bell_ItemDescription: This might be a little common dingy bell. This could also be a shapeshifter.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.christmaslights_01_ItemFlavorText: Totems of an ancient, kitsch observance.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.Deployable_WarningSign_ItemDescription: Warning sign with a built-in light.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.wallmount_exormonk_ItemFlavorText: Whatever you had to go through to get this trophy, it was probably worth it.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.fig_reaper_ItemFlavorText: Whether IS-0059 is the source of the Night Realm or merely an emanation, a hint of its threat persists even on this scale.
ItemTable_Deployables_Small.device_garden_ItemFlavorText: While the precise purpose of this device remains lost in the mists of time, elements of its construction bear strangely familiar hallmarks.

ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_carbcasserole_burnt_ItemDescription: A Carbuncle Casserole too burnt to be edible.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meatpie_burnt_ItemDescription: A Creepy Meat Pie, burned to an inedible crisp.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_lunarbisque_ItemDescription: A Moon Fish bisque with Anteverse fungi.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_chop_burnt_ItemDescription: A Peccary chop, burnt to a crisp.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotpie_burnt_ItemDescription: A Pest Pot Pie that has been burned almost beyond recognition.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_silk_ItemDescription: A beautiful fish with fins resembling the finest draped silk.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesewheel_ItemDescription: A beautiful wheel of ripened alien cheese.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.pumpkin_ItemDescription: A big orange squash, equally viable for decoration or sustenance.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meat_larva_burnt_ItemDescription: A blackened puck of Larva meat, almost beyond recognition.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_ItemFlavorText: A bold step towards the union of gastronomy and offensive weaponry.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_popcorn_buttery_raw_ItemDescription: A bucket of corn kernels, ready to pop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_popcorn_buttery_ItemDescription: A bucket of tasty popcorn, ready for snacking.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_portal_burnt_ItemDescription: A burned piece of Portal Fish.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_fogfish_burnt_ItemDescription: A burnt filet of a questionable fish.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cake_raw_ItemDescription: A cake, and minor miracle, uncooked.

ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_rice_ItemDescription: Enough like a bowl of rice to fool most people.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_eel_ItemFlavorText: Even less is known about the sea bordering Canaan. There are no exact analogues to the sea life found in Anteverse CLXVIII, and much of it seems to have evolved highly dangerous capabilities in both offense and defense, indicating potentially, that this eel may not be the meanest thing in the neighborhood.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_moon_ItemFlavorText: Exactly why this creature has evolved to glow so brightly in the moon's reflected UV light remains a mystery.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_is98_ItemFlavorText: Few GATE staff wish to discuss their experiences in Anteverse XXXIII, and none admit to transporting IS-0098 or any of its variants back to our universe.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_fries_burnt_ItemDescription: Fries that have been baked for far too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_ice_ItemFlavorText: GATE researchers are still struggling with the implications of being able to retrieve this creature from IS-0083.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_antefish_ItemFlavorText: GATE researchers theorize that the Antefish's 'all-too-friendly' face evolved as a kind of camouflage, although others point to parallels in its morphology with the birdlife of that realm.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_greyeb_ItemFlavorText: GATE scientists never quite see eye to eye on whether the Greyeb tastes sweet or savory. It seems to vary from person to person.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.icecream_honey_ItemDescription: Ice cream developed from apples and something that appears to be honey.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.icecream_pumpkin_ItemDescription: Ice cream developed from pumpkins, as far as can be ascertained.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_eggplant_ItemFlavorText: In years to come, scientists and philosophers may argue about whether this is 'really' an egg. But right now, it's looking pretty good.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_armandleg_ItemDescription: It cost something an arm and a leg.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_reaper_ItemFlavorText: It has the appearance of something extracted from the darker corners of the subconscious.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_burnt_ItemFlavorText: It hash been cooked for too long...
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pie_apple_baked_ItemFlavorText: It smells like everything you've lost.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_radfish_ItemFlavorText: It survived extreme radiation, but not your culinary skills.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_e_ItemDescription: It vaguely tastes like berry, and you're not really sure which kind.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_raw_ItemDescription: It's a pizza, probably better cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_split_ItemDescription: It's a soup with peas in it, and something else.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_ItemDescription: It's a soup with peas in it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_corn_ItemDescription: It's corn, and edible, sowable corn at that. Likely cleansed of any ill omens at the Flathill Crown Control Facility.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_burnt_ItemFlavorText: It's enough to make a GATE scientist cry.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_ItemFlavorText: It's more than a cookie, it's a monument to humanity's refusal to perish in the darkness without a murmur.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_c_ItemFlavorText: Like a bearhug in your mouth.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_raw_ItemFlavorText: Like so many chowders before it, a dish that hopefully tastes better than it looks.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_heartystew_ItemDescription: Many ingredients were cooked together, qualifying this as a stew.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_mre_ItemDescription: Military standard-issue meal ready to eat.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_burnt_ItemDescription: More char than there is pizza.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_is98_ItemDescription: More mystery than fish, if it can be called a fish at all.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_bad_ItemDescription: No label or markings are apparent on this soda can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_rad_ItemFlavorText: Not impossible, just unlikely, a marine creature whose evolution has been driven - or perhaps distorted - by its transposition into, and unexpected survival within, such highly toxic environments.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesewheel_raw_ItemFlavorText: Now you just gotta brie patient.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_veggiestew_raw_ItemDescription: Once cooked, this should be a healthful veggie stew.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_bread_pumpkin_burnt_ItemDescription: Overbaked pumpkin bread, now hard and dry.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_bread_burnt_ItemDescription: Overcooked but not necessarily utterly inedible.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pasta_homey_raw_ItemDescription: Pasta from beyond tastes better cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_ItemFlavorText: Peas, pests, potatoes - who could resist this most nourishing of pies?
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_burnt_ItemDescription: Pekkie Brekkie Hash that is very, very burnt.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_ItemDescription: Pest pie packed with potato and peas - perfection.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.honey_ItemFlavorText: Preliminary testing indicates it might even be conductive.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pie_apple_burned_ItemFlavorText: Probably more use as a metaphor now.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.tentacle98_ItemDescription: Pseudopodia that tastes as good as it smells.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pumpkin_slices_cooked_ItemFlavorTex: Pumpkins are among the oldest known domesticated plants.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_raw_ItemDescription: Raw eggs, cheese, sausage and potato, kinda.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_englishbreakfast_ItemDescription: Sausage and eggs are a classic, no matter their origin.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.honey_ItemDescription: Some sort of sweet, honey-like substance, from some sort of mean, bee-like insect.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_rotten_ItemDescription: Some very expired food, probably left uneaten for too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheese_ItemFlavorText: Someone had time to make cheese, but not ask certain ontological questions.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.coffee_cold_ItemFlavorText: Someone left it alone a bit too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_random_ItemDescription: Soup is a strong word for this mixture of water and... whatever else someone threw in here.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_leg_ItemFlavorText: Still has a bit of hoof in it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_candy_ItemFlavorText: Sugar is a major food group, right?
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_taco_ItemFlavorText: Taxonomists may argue whether this genuinely belongs to the genus 'taco'.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_shadowberry_ItemFlavorText: Technically a 'whole food', but you probably want to think about its origins.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_raw_ItemFlavorText: Thankfully, the standards for what counts as a pizza have been widened lately.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_darkwater_ItemFlavorText: The Darkwater Fish is theorized to have colonized the Cascade Reservoir via its eggs, though the origin of those eggs is as murky as the water itself.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_arm_red_ItemDescription: The arm of an armor-clad Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_arm_ItemDescription: The arm of an extraordinary Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_gkheavy_skull_ItemDescription: The armor-clad head of a once-towering Gatekeeper.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_icefish_burnt_ItemDescription: The burned flesh of a water-crystal creature.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_radfish_burnt_ItemDescription: The burnt filet of an extremely hardy fish.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_sandwich_toastie_burnt_ItemDescript: The charred remains of an Antecheese Toastie.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_skull_volatile_ItemDescription: The contorted skull of a Volatile Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_leg_cooked_ItemDescription: The cooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_sniper_skull_ItemDescription: The cowled head of a fanatic.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_skink_skull_ItemDescription: The cranial compartment of a Skink.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cake_ItemFlavorText: The fact that someone managed to bake this is an achievement that ennobles the entire human race.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_greyeb_ItemDescription: The fruit seems to emit trace amounts of electromagnetic radiation. It’s not enough to be harmful, but might attract unwanted attention.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_chieftain_skull_ItemDescription: The hard-won skull of a Gatekeeper Chieftain.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_symph_skull_ItemDescription: The head of a menacing fog entity.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_mage_skull_ItemFlavorText: The left eye appears to still twitch about as if observing you, angrily.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_peccmush_ItemFlavorText: The most shocking thing about this is how bad it isn't.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_portal_ItemFlavorText: The portal fish is suspected of spontaneously teleporting to new bodies of water, although this behaviour has never been officially documented in captivity.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_mage_skull_ItemDescription: The shrouded head of a Gatekeeper Mystagogue.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_skull_behemoth_ItemDescription: The skull of a dead behemoth.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_yeti_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a defeated Yeti.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_skull_red_ItemDescription: The skull of a felled Peccary Alpha.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_tarasque_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a felled Tarasque.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a mystical Exor Cha.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_sow_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary Sow.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pecmushroom_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary with a peculiar fungal affliction.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_furry_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Snow Peccary.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_exorheart_cooked_ItemDescription: The slightly cooked heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_witch_skull_ItemDescription: The still-adorned skull of a Gatekeeper Witch.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_ItemFlavorText: The taste better be worth it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pest_tail_burnt_ItemDescription: The torched rump of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_body_ItemDescription: The uncooked head of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exorheart_ItemDescription: The uncooked heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_leg_ItemDescription: The uncooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_meat_larva_ItemDescription: The uncooked meat of a dead Larva.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_tail_ItemDescription: The uncooked rump of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_leg_burnt_ItemDescription: The way over-cooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_skull_ItemFlavorText: There are many questions around Exor intelligence, and four of them are chiefly concerned with the Exor's jaw structure.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_gkheavy_skull_ItemFlavorText: There is no lack of volunteers for the role, despite the many side-effects, including a general reduction of activity in the Wernicke's area of the brain. This has subsequently become a badge of honor, a colloquial "Vow of Silence" and evidence of bravery on the frontline.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_d_ItemDescription: There's nothing funny about the Fizz.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_raw_ItemDescription: These cookies show promise, even uncooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_human_skull_ItemFlavorText: They probably don't need it anymore.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_creamyfish_raw_ItemDescription: This combo of fish and fungi may well be passingly edible when cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_umbra_ItemFlavorText: This creature has not succumbed, but somehow adjusted to eldritch forces of the deep.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_antefish_burnt_ItemDescription: This filet of Antefish is post-cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_radfish_raw_ItemDescription: This fish may glow less when cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_silk_ItemFlavorText: This gossamer creature's appearance belies its hydrodyamic efficiency.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_toxic_ItemDescription: This is an uncooked mess of things that ought not be eaten.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.fish_antefish_ItemDescription: This small, flamboyant and surprisingly robust aquatic creature has come a long way from its origins in Anteverse II.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_c_ItemDescription: This soda tastes like licorice, or something worse.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.icecream_melted_ItemDescription: This was once a happy treat, and is now a sad slop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesepuffs_ItemFlavorText: Those farm-to-table cheese puffs, just like Mama used to make.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_mashedpotatoes_raw_ItemDescription: Uncooked, but promising a taste of home.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_potatosausage_ItemDescription: What it says on the can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_potatosausage_raw_ItemDescription: What it says on the can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_poop_ItemDescription: What on earth are you thinking?!
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_nigiri_umbra_ItemFlavorText: What you put in your body is, ultimately, up to you.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_fishglue_raw_ItemDescription: When cooked this will make a serviceable adhesive.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_carbdumplings_raw_ItemDescription: When cooked, this may actually be edible.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meatpie_slice_ItemFlavorText: Whoever concocted this pie felt the need to feed their friends, and was willing to stop at nothing.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_sugarslop_raw_ItemDescription: With care this may turn into barely acceptable slop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_risotto_ItemDescription: Xanterium Rice, Peccary, and IS-0098, together at last.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_lethal_ItemDescription: You do NOT want to drink this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_toxic_ItemDescription: You do not want to drink this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_raw_ItemFlavorText: You're the one who made it.

ItemTable_Gear.trinket_nightpass_ItemDescription: A GATE-authorized pass, handy for safely traveling the halls of the Facility during after-hours.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_jetpack_ItemDescription: A backpack that allows for increased flight by jumping twice. May not initially respond well to portal environments.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_longjumppack_ItemDescription: A backpack that allows for rapid and repeated long-distance propulsion. Adapts quickly to portal environments, making it useable in most scenarios.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_security_ItemDescription: A backpack worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_beret_ItemDescription: A beret worn by what appear to be the squad leaders. It features some sort of rune on the front.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_forge_ItemDescription: A better-than-basic pair of protective arm wraps.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_witch_ItemDescription: A bewitchingly whimsical hat made of matted wool and leather. A bit squashed, either by age or turmoil.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_cushions_ItemDescription: A big chestplate made from cloth, tape and stuffing.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_puffycoat_ItemDescription: A big puffy coat with the warmth and figure of a campfire marshmallow. Made from natural insulating fibers and a little dash of science by way of thermal insulation.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_hastaboot_ItemDescription: A boot worn deep with travel, worn raw with time.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_exor_ItemDescription: A broad plate of bone and skull from an all-too common foe.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_labs_ItemDescription: A chitinous set of arm protectors, built from slain beasts and bit of scientific engineering.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_rook_ItemFlavorText: A close, but not quite perfect imitation of iconic Groupe armor, also offering some warmth.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_medmask_ItemDescription: A cloth medical mask usually worn by doctors.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_core_ItemDescription: A cold stone with a very soft glow. Pets seem to respond positively to it.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_holiday_ItemDescription: A comfy flat cap for a relaxing holiday.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_geigercounter_ItemDescription: A compact device that detects radiation in the immediate area.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_voidpack_U1a_ItemDescription: A cosmic crystal container that slowly recharges battery and laser-powered devices within it.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_forge_ItemDescription: A decent attempt at actual head protection.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_rebreather_ItemDescription: A diving suit with a rebreather for extended underwater journeys.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_ogredoll_ItemDescription: A dual-headed doll-like trinket of Gatekeeper provenance.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hardhat_ItemDescription: A durable helmet to protect warehouse workers.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_goggles_swim_ItemDescription: A facial apparatus for seeing clearly underwater, but not useful for much else.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_carbuncle_ItemDescription: A fancy hat cobbled accordingly from the carcass of a contemptible carbuncle.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_santahat_ItemDescription: A festive hat from a jolly man who has no respect for the laws of physics.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_biofusion_ItemDescription: A field-generating imitator that sends a low electrical signal through the wearer's body, allowing the operation of artifact weapons and overriding any lower tier bio-metric lockouts.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_carbuncle_ItemDescription: A floating flesh-balloon that reduces pack weight.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_powerC_ItemDescription: A full-body hyper-mobility exosuit based on experimental GATE electro-active polymer research and some even more speculative technology.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hydrohat_ItemDescription: A hardy helmet to protect hydroplant workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_makeshift_ItemDescription: A hastily constructed piece of body armor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_swamp_ItemDescription: A hat worn by the eldritch witches of the Gatekeeper contingent.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_ratsuit_ItemDescription: A hazardous environment suit adorned with odd markings. Greatly reduces radiation buildup.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_sappersuit_ItemDescription: A hazmat suit that has seen better days, and likely no longer does the job very well. However, it seems to have a substantial amount of explosive residue coating the surface. Best to avoid open flames.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_bunnyears_ItemDescription: A headband for a time of year whose celebration is completely optional at all GATE facilities except for Springer.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_t2_ItemDescription: A heavy laboratory vest used to block harmful radiation.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_ItemDescription: A heavy lead vest typically used to block harmful x-rays.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_night_ItemDescription: A helmet bearing the Sigil of the Night.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_reactor_ItemDescription: A helmet chiefly made of an alloy that no one understands.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_peccary_ItemDescription: A helmet made from a cantankerous creature.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_pecc_alpha_ItemDescription: A helmet made from a rare, red Peccary.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_yeti_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head an abominable creature.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_behemoth_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a colossal brute.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mushroom_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a fungal fiend.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_peccary_snow_ItemDescriptio: A helmet made from the head of a fuzzy little guy.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_sow_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a purple Peccary.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tarasque_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of an enormous microbe.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_breacher_ItemDescription: A helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings and iron bars laid across the face shield.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_military_ItemDescription: A helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_U1_ItemDescription: A helmet reconstructed to resemble finely etched porcelain.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_gkheavy_ItemDescription: A helmet restored from the fallen remains of one of the Gatekeeper's best - and largest.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_ItemDescription: A helmet sewn together from paper and padding, with the melodious qualities of a cardboard box.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mountaineer_ItemDescription: A helmet worn by alps-ascending assailants.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_greek_ItemDescription: A helmet, more polished than one might think, but the quality of metal is subject to the opinion of the material sciences.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_sciencecoat_ItemDescription: A high-tech coat, ideal for sub-zero temperatures and the occasional snowball fight.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_NVG_t2_ItemDescription: A highly-advanced image processing apparatus, capable of lighting up even the most abyssal locations.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_horned_ItemDescription: A horned helmet worn by the so-called Chieftains, patriarch of most Gatekeeper units.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_foglantern_ItemDescription: A humming lantern that seems to react when in the presence of lingering water vapor.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_heavy_ItemDescription: A large carrying case from a fallen Gatekeeper of enormous stature.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_large_ItemDescription: A large field research pack with inbuilt storage for radioactive and refrigerated samples from other worlds.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_hikingpack_ItemDescription: A large hiking backpack with a very supportive frame.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_sniper_ItemFlavorText: A large portion of the Order's symbology appears to derive from ancient Etruscan linguistic influences, with signs of more recent Levantine contribution.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_research_U1b_ItemDescription: A large, heavily-insulated field backpack with a dedicated freezer pocket and dual cooling sections.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_research_U1a_ItemDescription: A large, heavily-insulated field backpack with multiple radiation containment slots for perfect shielding while transporting hazardous materials.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_rat_ItemDescription: A large, heavy pack that does absolutely nothing for its wearer's spine or posture.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_medic_ItemDescription: A medic's helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_reactor_ItemDescription: A metallic encasing of nuclear-tempered alloy held together by an indecipherable digital interweave.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_radio_ItemDescription: A military backpack with some electronics attached.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_pilgrim_ItemDescription: A modest hat from a bygone age.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_default_ItemDescription: A mounted headlamp capable of deftly replacing any handheld flashlight.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_petrock_ItemDescription: A painted rock with googly eyes.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_snowgloves_ItemDescription: A pair of gloves sure to keep anyone warm in the most frigid conditions, when paired with other warm clothing, that is.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_waders_ItemDescription: A pair of waterproof waders, perfect for scrounging in the muck.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_ItemDescription: A passable excuse for a helmet.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_shieldgenerator_ItemDescription: A repurposed Gatekeeper hardlight shield, adding another layer of protection when worn.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_chieftain_ItemDescription: A rugged, customized backpack focused on field utility, with just a smidge of aegis.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_composer_ItemDescription: A scrappy leg armor made from pieces of much taller beings.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_friendfinder_ItemDescription: A signal beacon that detects the pagers of nearby GATE employees.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_white_ItemDescription: A small anomalous gem that constantly emits a white light.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_friendfinder_ItemFlavorText: A small bit of writing on the label: May not detect all nearby GATE employees, hiding employees, or entities pretending to be GATE employees.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_purple_ItemDescription: A small crystalline shard, emitting a purple light in response to conductivity in the air.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_yellow_ItemDescription: A small photon emitter converted into a warm lantern.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_spuddy_ItemDescription: A small potato with a chain on it.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_orange_ItemDescription: A small tube that emits a comfy orange glow.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_floppy_ItemDescription: A snug hat to keep even the coldest scientist toasty and warm.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_shieldgenerator_ItemFlavorText: A sort of technological palimpsest, this protective force field emitter was created from a broken Gatekeeper hardlight shield, which was itself created by GATE's Synaptic Labs from a reverse-engineered device retrieved from Anteverse 8.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_huge_ItemDescription: A strange backpack with huge storage capacity.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_voidpack_U1b_ItemDescription: A strange multi-purpose pack with ultra-dimensional properties and a variety of slots for cooling, warming, and radioactive protection.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_labs_ItemDescription: A strong chestplate built from the shells of insects and a few other things.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_weldingmask_ItemDescription: A strong helmet to prevent welders from receiving injuries.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tech_ItemDescription: A strong high-tech helm with a premium visor, provided there's enough of the system present.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hex_ItemDescription: A sturdy cloth-draped mask with careful spiral woodwork, reminiscent of the natural weavings of the Hexwood from which it's carved.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_labs_ItemDescription: A sturdy helmet built from some lab equipment and alien carapace.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_ItemDescription: A sturdy porcelain clads these arm wrappings.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_mgt_larva_ItemDescription: A suit made from Larval remains. Renders the user less suspicious to larvae and their ilk.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_beekeeper_ItemDescription: A suit purpose-built for protecting the wearer from all kinds of stinging insects, without doing much else.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_commander_ItemDescription: A suitably weather-worn cap that sits atop the head of all commanders of a Planetary Legion.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_order_ItemDescription: A symbol worn by the most fanatical members of The Order, keepers of the oldest traditions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_commander_ItemFlavorText: A tag on the inseam reads "Licensed by LycoSoft E.P.E." and has a series of pictographs indicating proper machine-wash instructions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_IS_0003_ItemDescription: A top hat with an unusual property, making it less of a hat, and more of a beaver-skin cylinder.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_mage_ItemFlavorText: A unique conjunction of arcane fashion and cutting-edge thermoplastics.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_pumpkin_ItemDescription: A vegetal helmet with an orange rictus grin.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_leather_ItemDescriptio: A very heavy apron used by blacksmiths.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_makeshift_ItemDescription: A very small backpack made from cloth scraps.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_neutrinolantern_ItemDescription: A warm, wearable light in a cold, radiation-filled universe.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_wreathcrown_ItemDescription: A wreath delicately wrought from the leaves of an evergreen laurel.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_U2_ItemDescriptio: Ad hoc head protection elevated to respectable armor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_gasmask_ItemDescription: An airtight mask often used by those working with dangerous chemicals.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_mage_ItemDescription: An amalgam of ragged cape and stole over high-grade body armor.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_snow_ItemDescription: An arctic pack for cold-weather mountaineering.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_security_ItemDescription: An armored vest worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_security_starter_ItemDescrip: An armored vest worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_green_ItemDescription: An extremely complicated bit of radioactive technology, but emitting a wonderful green light all the same.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_kylie_shieldgenerator_ItemDescri: An extremely dense data storage device parented to a personal shield generator. This unique unit allegedly contains the translated digital consciousness of Kylie Muir.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_kylie_ItemDescription: An extremely dense data storage device, allegedly containing the translated digital consciousness of Kylie Muir.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_labs_U2_ItemDescription: An extremely heavy-duty helmet that wears its bio-scavenged origins proudly.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_forge_U1_ItemDescription: An industrial-edged curiass reinforced by carbon fiber.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_censer_ItemDescription: An ornate censer allowing self-revivification under certain conditions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cowl_ItemDescription: An ornate hood with a pointed crest, worn by marksmen of old, devoted traditions.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_highinquisitor_ItemDescription: An ornate, fullbody accoutrement indicating one has achieved the most supreme rank of Inquisitor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_egg_ItemDescription: An oval hat no doubt created by a scientist who has truly lost their marbles.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_cornhuskdoll_ItemDescription: An unsightly doll made from the raw husks of fetid corn.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_gravitycube_ItemDescription: An unusual cube that makes people feel a little lighter than normal...
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_wreathcrown_ItemFlavorText: Apollo's delusion, transmuted into a symbol of victory.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_leather_ItemFlavorText: Apparently blacksmiths still exist. Who knew?
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_U1_ItemDescription: Arm defence more robust than its porcelain-like appearance would suggest.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_makeshift_U1_ItemDescription: Arm protection, swiftly concocted, recently improved.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_forge_U1_ItemFlavorText: Armor-Enhanced Guardian Impact System doesn't exactly roll off the tongue.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_reactor_ItemDescription: Armplates of green, adorned with radioactive labeling, which prove the wearer belongs among the actinide.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_exor_ItemFlavorText: As if injected into your mind, the design of this armor channels something deeper, something older.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_luckyhat_ItemDescription: As lucky as it is quirky.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_groupe_ItemDescription: As warm as they are heavy, these padded leggings are sure to keep you toasty.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_forge_U2_ItemFlavorText: Attempts at getting anyone to refer to it as the Advanced Tactical Outer Mechanized Shielding have yielded few takers, but persistence generally pays off, so keep trying.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_grunt_ItemDescription: Basic leg protection of long-standing Order design.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_hex_ItemDescription: Body armor crafted from the wood of an extremely unusual tree.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_U2_ItemFlavorText: By its nature, Anteverse I seems to carry the very essence of wabi-sabi. Researchers at Crown and Cascade alike have hotly debated whether that is simply an anthrocentric interpretation or one being provided by the mist-shrouded solivagant.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_U2_ItemDescription: Ceramic arm defense of the highest order.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_composer_U2_ItemDescription: Ceramic-alloy body armor enhanced in both defense and aesthetics.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_composer_ItemDescription: Chest protection made to mimic the inhabitants of Anteverse I, with a few creative liberties.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_greek_ItemDescription: Classic, if basic, arm protection for old-world infantry.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_bionic_ItemDescription: Cobbled together by ingenuity, and a bit of hope, these legs will allow the wearer to move faster and land harder. Does not contribute to armor weight when worn.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_crystal_U1_ItemDescription: Cold-worked crystal head defense with curious optical properties under certain conditions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_labs_U1_ItemDescription: Combines the resilience of various extraterrestrial offcuts and several material reinforcements into a formidable body armor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_sniper_ItemDescription: Composite arm protection emblazoned with ancient Gnostic symbols.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_sniper_ItemDescription: Composite body armor adorned with sigils of a recondite sect.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_sniper_ItemDescription: Composite leg armor acquired from an Order Sagittarii.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_crystal_U1_ItemDescription: Crystal-based leg armor, reworked and deformed to increase resilience.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_crystal_U1_ItemDescription: Crystalline body armor alloyed and hardened with experimental precipitates.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_gkheavy_ItemFlavorText: Exactly who suggested the moniker ‘Jotun’ is unclear, although it may have originated in the Gatekeepers' connection to the north.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_tech_U1_ItemDescription: Extremely advanced and effective body armor with a few experimental tricks under the hood.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_medic_ItemDescription: Flexible leg defenses once worn by those often required to kneel in the field.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_hazmat_casual_ItemDescription: For those only casually invested in their own safety.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_highvisvest_ItemDescription: For those who like being seen.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_core_ItemFlavorText: Forged from other-worldly remains with a residual connection to their origin, this potent idol channels forces from the recently-discovered Anteverse 299.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_yeti_ItemFlavorText: GATE researchers at the Voussoir Facility had been studying this rare cryptid for almost half a decade. It's even rarer now.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_makeshift_U3_ItemDescription: Greatly improved, if still ad hoc leg protection.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_labs_U2_ItemDescription: Hardened and reinforced leg defenses forged from defensive insects, amongst other things.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_labs_U1_ItemDescription: Hardened full-face armor that melds alien exoskeletal remains and a handful of more domestic elements.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_breacher_ItemDescription: Hardened leg defenses intended for a disgraced Order Exulum.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_makeshift_U2_ItemDescription: Hastily devised arm defense, upgraded to provide decent protection.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mage_ItemDescription: Head armor combining a shroud-like hood over something resembling a flight helmet.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_tech_U1_ItemDescription: Heavily armored and augmented leg defenses.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_forge_U2_ItemDescription: Heavily reinforced head protection elevated from its industrial origins.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_labs_U1_ItemDescription: Heavily reinforced leg defenses that combine the bone-like remains of several anteverse creatures.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_U3_ItemDescriptio: Heavy duty head armor augmented by myriad found materials.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cqc_ItemDescription: Heavy duty head protection for combat and coldness.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_rook_ItemDescription: Heavy duty head protection from a highly aggressive attacker.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_forge_U1_ItemDescription: Heavy duty head protection, reinforced with carbon fiber.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_breacher_ItemDescription: Heavy frontline chest armor emblazoned with Order arcana.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_medic_ItemDescription: Heavy-duty tactical body armor from an unfortunate Order medic.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_makeshift_U3_ItemDescription: High grade body armor from humble origins.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_captain_ItemDescription: High quality body armor obtained from an Order officer lost in the field.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_interf_ItemDescription: High-grade combat headwear adorned with chainmail coverings.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tech_U1_ItemDescription: High-tech head protection that balances extreme defensive capacity against the eternal risk of over-engineering.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_labs_U2_ItemDescription: Highly-protective arm defense leveraging the mortal remains of exotic creatures and some other nifty stuff.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_mgt_larva_ItemFlavorText: If you put aside aesthetics, disgust and dignity, it's not just fine, it's almost comfy.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_makeshift_U3_ItemDescription: Impressive upper limb defenses contrived from unusual constituents.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_makeshift_U2_ItemDescription: Improvised chest defense enhanced to an impressive degree.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_interf_ItemFlavorText: Interfectors conceal their faces to symbolize isolation, perfection of spirit, and to honor a hermetic saint whose gnostic relevations continue to inform their sect.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_mage_ItemDescription: Intricate, if heavily worn, arm defense combining aeronautic and hand-woven materials.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_witch_ItemFlavorText: It feels almost magical -- if you believe in that sort of thing.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_huge_ItemFlavorText: It's probably safe to reach in there.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_greek_ItemFlavorText: It's technically Corinthian, which adds further questions left unanswered by its rigidly silent owner.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_crystal_ItemDescription: Jagged and reflective armor created from curious dust.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_labs_U1_ItemDescription: Laminar arm protection that augments a hard-wearing chitin analogue with some stuff that was lying around.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_tech_ItemDescription: Leg armor made from strong metal alloys and a heap of science.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_makeshift_U1_ItemDescription: Leg defense, hastily contrived, somewhat enhanced.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_labs_ItemDescription: Leg protection built from the backs of many foes with some laboratory scrap holding it all together.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_composer_U2_ItemDescription: Leg protection that's as effective as it is alluring.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_hex_ItemDescription: Leg protection with a touch of the arcane...
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_ItemFlavorText: Let's shed some light on the subject.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_crystal_ItemDescription: Light but protective crystalline arm protection.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_greek_ItemDescription: Light leg protection that will not interfere with movement, or enemy weapons either, really.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_greek_ItemDescription: Lightweight chest protection in the hoplite tradition.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_crystal_ItemDescription: Lightweight head armor crafted from crystalline remains.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_captain_ItemFlavorText: Like so much about the Order, this armor is ancient in its traditions, yet sacrifices little in modern construction and comfort.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_crystal_ItemFlavorText: Little is known about IS-0139, but the crystal remains have some unique optical properties when combined with the right technology to activate it.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_purple_ItemDescription: Long purple gloves, typically worn by those handling precious objects.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_karate_ItemDescription: Makes getting punched in the head suck slightly less.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_NVG_ItemDescription: Monocular night vision made from various scientific gadgetry. Not the highest quality, but it'll light up even the darkest corners.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tarasque_ItemFlavorText: Nothing that small should ever be this big.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_interf_ItemDescription: Old world style meets modern materials in a surprisingly comfortable and limber armor system.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_rat_ItemFlavorText: Once stuffed with scrap and supplies pilfered from the Facility, returning it to its former state is the goal of any good Rat.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_grunt_ItemFlavorText: One can disdain modernity without needing to renounce Kevlar.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_night_ItemFlavorText: One of them was said to have placed the sigil across their eyes. A curse against the enemy? A boon against the dark of Night? Regrettably, it was neither.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_NVG_t2_ItemFlavorText: Originally built by the GATE Cascade Synaptic Labs.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_composer_U1_ItemDescription: Ornate ceramic body armor, reworked to more closely mimic the inhabitants of Anteverse I.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_U2_ItemDescription: Ornate ceramic head armor infused with strengthening metallic fibers.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_ratsuit_ItemFlavorText: Ostensibly, these "Lab Rats" are known to be as meticulous as they are unhinged. Combining deep science with utter devotion to the cause, this path has led the Rats to a field of science that may not even exist.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_composer_U1_ItemDescription: Otherworldly leg protection, less fragile than it once was.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_U3_ItemFlavorText: Over many incarnations, this protective wear has attained a state that is both highly functional and fairly fabulous.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mage_ItemFlavorText: Overseen by Synaptic Labs, the design of Mystagogue field armor required an uneasy collaboration between an aerospace engineer, a materials chemist, and a Peruvian brujo.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_groupe_ItemDescription: Padded and gloved, these arm guards are ready for snow - and bullets.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_groupe_ItemDescription: Padded for protection in cold climes and combat, the cozyness of this jacket-vest combination is only rivaled by its sheer weight.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_green_ItemFlavorText: Perhaps too much green light. Also acts as a geiger counter.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_medic_ItemDescription: Protective armwear acquired from an Order medic.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_U1_ItemDescriptio: Protective headwear of an improved, yet still improvised nature.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_forge_U1_ItemDescription: Protective leg-wear with multi-layer carbon fiber reinforcement.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_mage_ItemDescription: Protective legwear constructed from an unusual blend of materials.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_makeshift_U1_ItemDescription: Rapidly devised chest protection with some running improvements.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cqc_ItemFlavorText: Regardless of its authenticity, a solid piece of frontline armor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_captain_ItemDescription: Reinforced arm defenses designed for an Order Legate.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_medic_ItemFlavorText: Reworked over centuries, the Exsurgo's body armor still retains hints of its debt to Egyptian medicine.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_exor_ItemDescription: Ridges of bone and spike, quill and carapace.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_garden_ItemDescription: Rough green gloves, typically worn by gardeners and those working with thorny plants.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_tech_ItemDescription: Science combines with ingenuity to create a chestplate that's effective, light and just a little bit comfy.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_bonnet_ItemDescription: Seemly headwear from a bygone age.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_lab_ItemDescription: Sleek white gloves, typically worn by lab workers.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_dimension_ItemDescription: Some kind of anomalous backpack with impossibly large storage capacity.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_security_ItemDescription: Standard-issue arm protection worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_security_ItemDescription: Standard-issue armored helmet worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_securitycap_ItemDescription: Standard-issue cap worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_security_ItemDescription: Standard-issue leg protection worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_reactor_ItemDescription: Steel-clad legplates, tempered by hot, radioactive spillage and bound together by digital question marks.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_grunt_ItemDescription: Strengthened Order arm defenses, not quite general issue.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_labs_U2_ItemDescription: Strengthened body armor largely crafted from armored bodies.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_tech_ItemDescription: Strong arm covers to keep threats at bay.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_captain_ItemDescription: Strong tactical leg protection intended for use by Order officers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_bionic_ItemFlavorText: Stronger. Faster. Eh, you know the rest.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_work_ItemDescription: Sturdy gloves typically worn by construction workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_makeshift_U2_ItemDescription: Swiftly constructed leg defense, considerably improved.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_horned_ItemFlavorText: The Chieftains seem to use anything at their disposal. Crosses, hexes, totems and iconography of all manner and design to discourage, thwart or otherwise turn evil the other way.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_breacher_ItemFlavorText: The Exulum are paying penance, deployed on the front lines with a constant reminder of their guilt.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hex_ItemFlavorText: The compulsively-carpentered woodgrain stirs with what can only be described as longing, somewhere deep underneath your skin. Fractured visions shoot across your mind, of etched stone encasing writhing meat, or... it's simply a metaphor for bark, encasing a tree. You're compelled to run your hand along the woodgrain one more time.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_shieldgenerator_U1_ItemDescripti: The dense 'zip' array of micro-capacitors in this personal shield generator was designed to trade defense for faster recharge speed.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_chefhat_ItemDescription: The hallmark of a true chef.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_U1_ItemFlavorText: The inscriptions appeared of their own accord, as if an attempt at communication were being made.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_grunt_ItemDescription: The most recent iteration of tactical body armor for the Order frontline.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_powerC_ItemFlavorText: The original Synaptic Labs brief invited designs for a wearable lightweight, speed-enhancing suit to assist multi-axis movement with reduced effort. Nothing made it off the drawing board, until now.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_jetpack_ItemFlavorText: The potential danger almost outweighs the fun. Almost.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_hex_ItemDescription: The protection these gauntlets grant goes beyond the mundane, starting with the name.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_highinquisitor_ItemFlavorText: The rank of High Inquisitor is regarded with equal amounts of veneration and suspicion, due to the necessary immersion in otherworldly artefacts that attainment of this echelon implies.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_breacher_ItemFlavorText: The reinforcement of this chestpiece reflects the position of Exulum, deployed on the frontline to redeem grievous lapses in honor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_U2_ItemFlavorText: The true process of creation: improvise, improve, polish, accept.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_pilgrim_ItemFlavorText: The villagers of Canaan are pious, but only slightly less than they are antiquated, suffering both in attire and reasoning.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_voidpack_U1b_ItemFlavorText: There remains no assurance that reaching into this backpack will return your hand intact.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_biometric_ItemDescription: These armwraps don't provide much armor, but they do allow the wearer to operate certain weapons.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_biometric_t2_ItemDescription: These armwraps don't provide much armor, but they do allow the wearer to operate special weapons.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_swamp_ItemFlavorText: They cannot be real witches - if such things exist. They are warriors adorned and embellished by technology we all too easily mistake as magic or confuse as the work of the gods.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_ItemFlavorText: This could work as armor... For now.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_ogredoll_ItemFlavorText: This curious, even child-like idol bears witness to the Torments of Arkus, Avatar of the Abyss.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_red_ItemDescription: This multitude of eyes set amidst a fleshy red glow gives the wearer awareness in all directions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_breacher_ItemDescription: Tightly bound arm protection designed for an Order Exulum.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cowl_ItemFlavorText: To the Sagittarii of the Order, the hood represents protection from the evils of the world, and the narrow focus required to cleanse it.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_tech_U1_ItemDescription: Unmatched defensive arm shielding that sacrifices nothing in the name of protection.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_heavy_ItemFlavorText: Utilizing hyper-generative biomaterials recovered from Anteverse 42, Gatekeepers began a series of experiments, in conjunction with GATE, designed to ‘productively enhance’ human size and strength.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_U1_ItemFlavorText: Varsha Patel introduced the word 'jugaar' to engineers in Manufacturing Sector, and it seems to have caught on.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_blacksmithinggloves_ItemDescr: Very heavy gloves, typically worn by metalworkers.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_dimension_ItemFlavorText: We're dealing with things we simply can't understand, but we can sure as hell utilize.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_chefhat_ItemFlavorText: Well, you LOOK like you can cook, anyway.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_snowpants_ItemDescription: When these pants are worn, warmth no longer becomes a need, but an entire state of being.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_preacher_ItemFlavorText: While many gnostic cults eschew intermediaries, this hat seems to say 'I have answers'.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_sappersuit_ItemFlavorText: While some Saboter are volunteers, many are initially placed in this role as a punishment for Inquisitorial failings, and many come to see it for what it truly is - a pivotal role in bringing down the very structures that hold up the pomposity of man.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_red_ItemFlavorText: While the Greyeb itself exhibits all the usual signs of non-sentient flora, you could swear this little guy now looks at you from time to time.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_crystal_U1_ItemFlavorText: While the exact origins of IS-0139's crystalline appearance remain obscure, the material itself submits to many of the same techniques used to harden and reinforce similar substances on Earth.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_longjumppack_ItemFlavorText: While the normal advice would be something along the lines of USE WITH CAUTION, you likely wouldn't have made it otherwise.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_hazmat_ItemDescription: Worn by scientists to study radiation and biohazardous materials. Greatly reduces radiation buildup.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_fire_ItemDescription: Worn by volcano researchers and molten manufacturing workers. Blocks most exposure to high heat and flame.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_carbuncle_ItemFlavorText: You are king of the carbuncles. Which... doesn't really mean much.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_scarbuncle_ItemFlavorText: You are queen of the carbuncles. Which... doesn't really mean much.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_egg_ItemFlavorText: You know what you are, why not embrace it?
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_kylie_ItemFlavorText: You made her a promise, remember?
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_kylie_shieldgenerator_ItemFlavor: You made her a promise. Was this part of that promise?
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_ItemFlavorText: Your arms feel lighter, almost as if they're being suspended by strings.

ItemTable_Pets.pet_skink_ItemDescription: A charming, albeit elongated friend. Perhaps they could be useful, with the right motivational attachments.
ItemTable_Pets.pet_skink_ItemFlavorText: Precisely how this denizen of Anteverse 21 arrived in our world is unclear, but the preponderance of wayward perforations is a prime suspect.

ItemTable_Pickups.shieldgen_broken_ItemFlavorText: "GATE's Synaptic Labs have been given incredible leeway in their pursuit of R&D. The results speak for themselves, but make me no less nervous. They have not simply torn through the red tape, they have repurposed it to bind demons from hell itself. Or so they like to say at the Christmas party." - Dr. Derek Manse
ItemTable_Pickups.salem_book_04_ItemFlavorText: ... Watching him weep and renounce his faith, I saw the failing of all flesh, the evil of its fetters, forged by the Enemy in the far past. I glimpsed the release that we seek, and knew in that instant I was being called. Beyond the flesh, a faint light in the darkness. A Paradise that beckons. And as he spoke further of his falling, this wretch revealed another truth when he told me of the gifts he carried, which he could now neither return to his Order nor rid himself of. The artefact that so terrified him, that planted the seed of his unravelling, would be the very key to Paradise. I felt no shame when I tracked him outside, and relieved him of his burden and a few further trinkets. His purpose was achieved. He was freed.
ItemTable_Pickups.soilbag_ItemDescription: A bag of healthy, fertile soil.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_plastic_ItemDescription: A bag of plastic odds and ends.
ItemTable_Pickups.rubberbands_ItemDescription: A ball of rubber bands. Someone spent a lot of time making this.
ItemTable_Pickups.bandage_ItemDescription: A basic bandage that will stop one instance of bleeding. Does NOT restore health.
ItemTable_Pickups.stapler_ItemDescription: A basic office stapler. Contains springs.
ItemTable_Pickups.woodplank_ItemDescription: A basic piece of wood, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.gravitycube_ItemDescription: A blue, anomalous cube. It appears to affect the gravity of anyone holding it.
ItemTable_Pickups.screws_ItemDescription: A box of screws, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.salt_ItemDescription: A bunch of sodium, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.pens_ItemDescription: A bundle of office pens. You can think of a few clever ways to utilize these.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_order_ItemDescription: A bundle of random high-tier Order electronics and other pilfered curio. Might be useful in recipes.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_military_ItemDescription: A bundle of random military-grade electronics. Nothing too helpful by itself.
ItemTable_Pickups.oil_ItemDescription: A can of petroleum-based oil. Used for repair and crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_gatekeeper_ItemDescription: A carved rune in the shape of the GATE company logo, or something very near it.
ItemTable_Pickups.batterycharger_ItemDescription: A charging kit for regular car batteries. Perhaps it can be repurposed...
ItemTable_Pickups.gigaglue_ItemDescription: A common adhesive used to bind things together.
ItemTable_Pickups.casefan_ItemDescription: A computer case fan, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.circuitboard_ItemDescription: A computer circuit board, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.harddrive_ItemDescription: A computer hard drive, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.powersupply_ItemDescription: A computer power supply unit, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.gunpowder_ItemDescription: A concoction of lightly powdered explosive material, best for propelling projectiles.
ItemTable_Pickups.coil_ItemDescription: A copper coiling, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.royal_crown_ItemFlavorText: A crown, much like any royal authority, is as real as those around it agree it to be.
ItemTable_Pickups.shieldgen_broken_ItemDescription: A damaged Gatekeeper Shield Generator. If restored, it may provide personal protection of an entirely different sort.
ItemTable_Pickups.oil_black_ItemDescription: A dark, oleaginous liquid extracted from IS-0207.
ItemTable_Pickups.censer_ItemDescription: A deeply ornate censer used in some sort of dark or otherwise unseemly arts. It may have some technology inside, but you can't get it open without breaking it. However, the powdery substance that shakes out of it leaves a warm, tingling sensation upon your skin.
ItemTable_Pickups.neutrinomapper_ItemDescription: A device containing a chart of particle locational data, tuned to a specific frequency. Collected by the astronomers of the GATE Voussoir Facility.
ItemTable_Pickups.burner_ItemDescription: A device used for heating up chemicals. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.ammo_disc_ItemDescription: A disc with a very sharp edge.
ItemTable_Pickups.sg_book_03_ItemDescription: A dog-eared notebook filled with a tiny, elegant script.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_gatekeeper_ItemFlavorText: A familiar shape, but one that takes up more space around it than your eyes can perceive.
ItemTable_Pickups.salem_book_02_ItemDescription: A few pages from a larger journal, no doubt.
ItemTable_Pickups.fireextinguisher_ItemDescription: A fire extinguisher consisting of a compressed air can.
ItemTable_Pickups.essence_frozen_ItemDescription: A frigid residue left behind by IS-0091-B when bathed in high-energy x-rays.
ItemTable_Pickups.gel_ItemDescription: A gel from the Anteverse with extremely unstable properties.
ItemTable_Pickups.beaker_ItemDescription: A glass tube used for experiments.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_gold_ItemDescription: A gold-plated CPU, recovered from a mobile artillery unit.
ItemTable_Pickups.geigercounter_ItemDescription: A hand-held radiation detector. Point it at yourself to check your own radiation level.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_tech_ItemDescription: A handful of random technological junk.
ItemTable_Pickups.lcd_screen_ItemDescription: A handy display for electronic devices.
ItemTable_Pickups.organ_ItemDescription: A hard-shelled gas apparatus that can produce noises audible far beyond its size and shape would imply.
ItemTable_Pickups.digital_gold_ItemDescription: A hardy alloy with properties that place it squarely between the physical and the digital spaces of our universe.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_bio_ItemDescription: A heap of biological scrap. Might come in handy.
ItemTable_Pickups.capacitor_ItemDescription: A heavy device used for storing or discharging energy.
ItemTable_Pickups.anvil_ItemDescription: A heavy object, useful for acting as a giant paperweight. Might also be helpful in repairing stuff too, with the right additions.
ItemTable_Pickups.aircompressor_ItemDescription: A high pressure air transfer unit, might be useful for things that require copious amounts of air power.
ItemTable_Pickups.receptor_ItemDescription: A high-end optical detector for registering photon emission.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_ItemDescription: A high-tech CPU, recovered from something extraordinary.
ItemTable_Pickups.cable_fibre_ItemDescription: A high-tech fibre optic cable, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.diode_ItemDescription: A high-tech laser diode, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_security_ItemDescription: A high-tech security key clearly used to keep important things locked up tight.
ItemTable_Pickups.headlamp_NVG_t2_broken_ItemDescription: A highly-advanced image processing apparatus that has seen better days. Perhaps it could be restored to its former operational status.
ItemTable_Pickups.core_fragment_ItemDescription: A humming piece of simple stone.
ItemTable_Pickups.anomaly_ItemDescription: A indecipherable entity that appears to respond to glass and has a peculiar attraction to plant life.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_inq_ItemDescription: A key to many secrets, if not simply a key to a very hefty chest.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_porcelain_ItemDescription: A large ceramic key of misty origin.
ItemTable_Pickups.saltrock_ItemDescription: A large lump of salt, perhaps salvageable into a useable product.
ItemTable_Pickups.salem_book_05_ItemDescription: A ledger consisting of honorifics and last names, denoting a personal knowledge of who they refer to. One item stands out as unique, with far more detail than the rest.
ItemTable_Pickups.sydyk_book_01_ItemDescription: A loosely bound notebook of some vintage.
ItemTable_Pickups.organ_partial_ItemDescription: A lump of structured tissue and something reminiscent of pottery, harmoniously intertwined.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_purple_ItemDescription: A modified CPU, recovered from an automoton that is as incredible as it is aggressive.
ItemTable_Pickups.sg_book_01_ItemDescription: A much-thumbed notebook scrawled with delicate handwriting.
ItemTable_Pickups.powderedcrystal_ItemDescription: A mysterious powdered crystal residue. Tiny arachnids crawl through the sandy substance.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_metal_ItemDescription: A pile of metal. Definitely useful for crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_arcane_ItemDescription: A pile of odd baubles, tokens, and paraphernalia from the Gatekeepers.
ItemTable_Pickups.emptymug_ItemDescription: A porcelain mug, bereft of any sustenance.
